The four figures are fully rendered, 3D versions of the four Bridge officers. The four figures and two spaceships are similar to Heroclix figures, with the clicks on the dials at the base of the figure representing damage and corresponding diminished abilities.

This product is designed as a non-collectible, non-blind, all-in-one-and-done game, but is built upon the "expandable" board game model meaning that down the line, new missions and crew members will be made available for folk to play other "episodes"!

publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
75037.description:
Geico Insurance, the company known for its great rates, superior service, and, of course, its talkative gecko mascot, created this custom game to reward its agents for meeting and exceeding sales goals. A promotional game, yes, but the omnipresent gecko made it a popular purchase at Geico company store sites, as well. Themed with an engaging city-by-city travel slant, and styled with a very contemporary look, GECKOPOLY had the Company’s competitors seeing green!

Publisher's Description

publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
75038.description:
WAFFLE-OPOLY was produced exclusively for the employees of The Waffle House Restaurants. In celebration of Waffle House’s 50th Anniversary, the game has both a very distinctive look and a name that’s just fun to say. Late for the Sky designed and produced all of the art, including the sunny-side up eggs that sit in the game’s distinctive Skillet token.

As time has passed, this game has developed a bit of a cult following. People still want to know where they can buy the game. It seems that customers of these popular restaurants have as much love for Waffle House as Waffle House employees! But this game was designed for Employees Only. The four Company principals appear in caricature on the game board and a timeline representing the Company’s 50 years in business is also featured. The property spaces on the board are store locations that were selected through an internal Waffle House contest, driven through performance of a store’s employees. A great competition ensued, coupled with a real source of pride throughout the entire Waffle House store network. Regardless of the competition’s outcome, every Waffle House employee received a WAFFLE-OPOLY game.

Publisher's Description

79136.description:
The game has 18 "Tetris"shaped blocks and a little square boardgame, 3 hexes by 3.
The game also comes with an electronic buzzer.

When it's your turn, you press the buzzer. The buzzer will tell you which block you have to take, this by describing the colour of the block.
You take that block and put it on the board, when you did that, you push the buzzer again, which will tell the next player which block he has to pick and place.
When putting the block on the board you only have a certain amount of time (8, 10 or 12 seconds).

By putting the blocks on the board you'll create a tower, when it's your turn you must succeed putting the block on the board or on another piece already placed on the board and by doing so trying not to turn over the tower.
If the tower falls, that player is excluded from the game.

You play on untill there's one player left.

source: user summary

publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
75043.description:
CASEY-OPOLY was produced to celebrate the 35th Anniversary of Casey’s General Stores.

Patrons of this popular convenience store chain were treated to a virtual Casey’s shopping trip, with a light-hearted look at store items and the Casey’s shopping experience. The game retailed throughout all of the Company’s locations. Manufacturer coupons were included in the game to promote the items found in the store. Collectively, the coupons provided greater value than the cost of the game. Casey’s General Store enjoyed 100% sell-through of the games.

Publisher's Description

publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
75044.description:
Created by Haworth Furniture, HAWORTHOPOLY was designed to reflect the distinctive look of this contemporary office furniture manufacturer. The content was product driven and used to excite the employees about the product line. To add to the flair of the presentation, a game was placed on each employee’s desk overnight to greet them in the morning as they arrived at the office. Predictably, there was a significant buzz that spread from the associates to the marketplace as games were shared with clients. It proved to be an unforgettable promotion!

Publisher's Description

publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
75045.description:
McKee Foods, owners of Little Debbie Snack Foods, has a fiercely loyal family of dedicated employees, a valuable asset that is readily recognized by the owners of the Company. There is also a strong recognition of, and respect for, the Company’s long and storied history. To complete the connection to all of these elements, SNACKOPOLY was created. SNACKOPOLY was only made available to Company employees, and the games quickly became a prized possession. SNACKOPOLY was so popular, it was reprinted to satisfy the overwhelming demand of employees to have two one as a keepsake and one to play! Today, it remains a well-loved employee memento.

Publisher's Description

publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
75046.description:
ATLANTIS-OPOLY is sold in the retail gift stores found throughout the beautiful and vast resort, Paradise Island, Bahamas. An endless stream of happy visitors has made ATLANTIS-OPOLY a staple in the resort’s retail planning. The game has gone through several printings. It has been a real bonus for the Company to take advantage of Late for the Sky’s manufacturing capabilities, allowing updated amenities to be featured on the current games. Short production runs can be practical!

Publisher's Description

75052.description:
This is a challenging game for 2 players. The board has holes in it. Those holes are shaped like a star. Each player begins with 10 letters and from those 10 letters tries to make a 5 letter word. then fills his hand to 10 letters. Only 5 letter words can be added to the star(or in some cases 9 letter words can be created using a previously placed 5 letter word ). All words must begin and end on the points of the star. If a word has two of the same letter such as WHICH a bonus of 2 points is earned. Words that read both ways (like SLOOP and POOLS) would earn an extra 5 points. The second player can add a new word using his 10 letter hand or any letters from the first word which can be removed from the first word to help create the second word.

A 9 letter word could be made by going through a point on the star and then ending on another point (PLACE begins and ends on a point of the star and adding either FIRE to the beginning or MENT to the end of the word would create a 9 letter word

Ages 11 & Up

75061.description:
A cute educational game in which players turn over a card with a simple maths problem and attempts to answer it correctly. If the answer is correct the player moves their pawn forward to the next available space on the board which has the number of their correct answer. The game is themed such that the players are mice and they may land on special squares: escape a cat, move forward to n, chased by a cat, move back to n or caught in a mousetrap, miss one turn.
There are two sets of cards, one of addition and one of subtraction, and a double sided board to go with each card set.

75062.description:
This is a childrens version of the game Code Sudoku by Kod Kod International Games. This version uses two sided tiles with numbers with a corresponding colour and shape on one side or cute little pictures on the other. Puzzles range in difficulty with 4 x 4 grids of pictures at their simplest and 6 x 6 grids (unusual but it works) with numbers for the older / more experienced players. The puzzle sheet being attempted is placed into a plastic frame with a clear plastic cover over the top. The cover has a raised grid to hold tiles directly above the squares of the puzzle sheet. score tacks for 4 players run along the side of each puzzle sheet for competitive play in which each correctly placed tile earns a point.

Rules are in English but the game is language independent.
75062.name: Code Sudoku Junior

76681.description:
In The Kingdoms of Crusaders, players assemble units to create armies and overwhelm opponents competing for the same territories. The game includes components for a two-player game; by combining two sets, up to four players can compete.

Units are represented by cards, with each card depicting the forces in it with color-coded symbols across its top. The forces come in five strengths, which from weakest to strongest are Lance, Bow, Sword, Helmet and Banner. For example, a unit (card) with Sword and Helmet will have across the top: blank, blank, green, yellow, blank. Each player starts with a hand of five cards and a location card on the table depicting five territories, which is where a player lays his cards.

On a turn, a player draws a card from the deck, then lays one card from his hand into one of the territories next to his location card. Each territory can have no more than four cards in it. Once you've played four cards into a territory, you've determined the final strength of the army there. If the same symbol is on all four cards, you've created a Regiment; the same symbol on only three cards creates a Battalion, and the same symbol on only two cards creates a Company. (You can create multiple Regiments, Battalions and Companies in the same territory.)

To determine who wins the battle in a territory, compare each player's army in this territory. The player whose army has the most Regiments wins; if players are tied for the number of Regiments, then the player with the strongest Regiments wins; if players have equally strong Regiments, then the player with the most Battalions wins; and so on. Even if his opponent(s) have not completed their armies, a player can win a territory by proving that it's impossible for someone to create a stronger army in the same territory.

When a player wins a territory, he places a lowest available victory marker on this army. Once all five victory markers have been claimed, the game ends. The player who collects the most markers wins; if players are tied for the number of victory markers, then the player whose markers have the lowest sum wins.
76681.name: The Kingdoms of Crusaders

75089.description:
A unique and original golf game. Anything that happens in real golf can happen in Think Golf.
The use of different clubs for different shots with varying degrees of risk, requires decision making as in real golf.

This game is designed to give you a realistic golf score, incorporating all hazards and lucky shots.

Object of the game is to get the lowest score after a round of 9 or 18 holes.
You choose your club represented buy special dice. You roll the dice and move up the hole the number of yards designated on the dice.

75091.description:
In Norenberc, each player represents an ambitious merchant trying to gain influence in the town council of Norenberc. To do this, players must win over the craftsmen of the city's various guilds. The player who manages to win over the most (and the most influential) craftsmen will be the one who wins the game.

Every round consists of one or more turns. Every turn, all players simultaneously select the guilds at which they wish to take actions, limited by the number of agents at their disposal. Actions include buying and selling goods and hiring guests who are lodging at the guilds: various craftsmen and townsmen with useful special abilities.

At the end of each round, the master of each guild will select a favorite from among the players: the one owning the most of that guild's goods. The favorite of each guild will claim the loyalty of that guild master and earn one of that guild's crests. The most important guild in the city will also bestow one of the valuable prestige crests upon its favorite.

At the end of the game, players will compare their amassed craftsmen, crests, money, and townsmen to see who has won the game!
75091.name: Norenberc

79188.description:
Co-operative trivia game on history, mainly Belgian and European.

Players move their pawns through six different periods in history. For each move he makes, the active player must answer a question about that period. When answered correctly he draws a token (mostly hour glasses) and gains one point on the players' mutual life scale. For each wrong answer, one life point is lost.

In each history periode, there is also an enemy card, representing an evil character or event in history. Each enemy has a printed value. When reaching such an enemy, the active player may try to defeat the enemy. For that purposes he bid a number of hour glass tokens and throws a ten sided die (values 0 through 9). The number thrown is then multiplied by the number of hour glasses bid and if that number is equal or higher than the enemies value, the enemy is defeated and life points are gained. Otherwise the enemey card remains on the board and three life points are lost.

Players win the game when all six enemies are defeated or they lose the game when they have no more life points left.

75095.description: Stranded is a fast-paced light strategy game for 2-4 players where being last will make you first. Players remove randomly placed game pieces from the platform in hopes of trapping their opponents. But beware - each piece that is removed changes the game surface, creating new moves for some and different strategies for others. Suspense will mount with every move or remove you make - just remember not to fall into your own trap.

75104.description:
From the publisher:
In Eesti mälumäng you have 100 cards with 600 questions from six categories: History, Culture, Nature, Geography, Sport and Miscellaneous. Vast majority of questions concern Estonia only. To win the game, you need to get all 5 categories on one side of the triangle on your score pad.

Content:
100 cards
2 category dice
pencil
block of score pads
rules

75105.description: Players advance through the Casino, trying their luck and testing their skill at seven games in the following order.. (1) Slots (2) Blackjack (3) Keno (4) Superbowl (5) Craps (6) Pokers (7) Roulette. The Object: To be the one player who bankrupts all of the others, winning all of the money. (Rulebook)

name.#text: Stupak The Ultimate Game of Skill & Chance

75111.description:
A Monopoly like game.
Players roll and move along a square board. Instead of streetnames the spaces are companies located in the Dutch city of Delft. Players try to buy, sell and trade property.
The player which collects the most money and plays the other players bankrupt, wins the game.

79213.description:
Remember the days when your parent's or job made you put money in a swear jar everytime you ended up using curse words?

Now play the game inspired from all the times you lost your money to the jar. Match colors or values in the fast paced game while trying to get your Swear Jar built up before someone plays a dirty word.

No Actual Foul Language is used in the game.

Each player is dealt 5 cards. Each turn a player draws a card and must place a card in their swear jar. Cards must match either the color or the value of the top card of their current swear jar. If a Swear Card is played the banks are removed and added into the players scoring pile. Once all cards in the deck have been played the round is over and scores are added up. Cards are reshuffled and play continues until a player reaches
500 points.

publishers: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
79216.description:
Players try to reach the highest point on the ever changing board. In a turn, players either place a tile, place their pawn on the board, or move their pawn if it's already on the board.

Moving a pawn is allowed under the condition that for each step (based on the square grid of the board), the pawn has to either go up or down one level. Precisely one level. Too steep a climb or descent and the pawn can't go there. Movement on the same level is also not allowed.

The players that reaches the highest point is the winner. In case of a tie, the player that is on the largest plateau wins. If this doesn't solve the tie, then the player that has been on the highest point the longest is the winner.

With two players, the game is very strategic. With 3 or 4 players luck also becomes a factor to take into account.

EDIT (November, 2nd 2011): There's a new supplementary rule (approved of by Winning Moves):
Players are allowed to remove their own pawn from the board as a separate move (and re-enter it on the ground level at some later point of the game as a separate move).
79216.name: Plateau X

75127.description:
This is the center spread game that came in the Spielbox magazine 2010 #3.

Object of the game
The players are ghost hunters cooperating to free Baron von Hagen's manor house of haunting ghosts. The ghosts are, however, only harbingers of their queen...

Game materials required (not included):

1 playing piece per player (ghost hunters)
1 neutral playing piece (harbinger)
1 rummy card deck
1 6-sided die




Spook by Spook is a cooperative game: the participants act as a team against the game. They can only win together or lose together.
75127.name: Spook by Spook

75129.description:
A travel version of Zingo where the dealer shakes the car, reads off the dice and the players flip the matching image. The first player to flip over a complete traffic light is the winner.

Comes with 9 traffic lights that snap together, the Zoomer car which contains the dice, the instruction manual and a travel bag for the game.

79245.description:
This game is based on the Norwegian reality TV Show "71 grader nord", where a number of participants hike from Norways south most point "Lindesnes" to the North Cape.

From the publishers website (translated from Norwegian language):
"Who achieves the most victories on the way to the North Cape?

Finaly the board game is here, which lets us all attend the exhausting tour from Lindesnes to the North Cape.

The aim of the game is to answer right to most of the questions in the course of ten stages and gain stage victories, which you can take with you on your way to the North.

Here you can show your knowledge of Norway. All from geography and history to famouse peoples and curiosities is includet. And, like in the TV show, it is possible for you to use a map as help, if your strengh lies not in geography.

If you are lucky you can get an extra round, where you can get full three points if you are fast. The questions on the cards are classified in easy, medium and difficult, and so they can created total unpredictable situations.

Are your the next to be winner of 71 grader nord?

Content: board, map, gaming pieces, dices, 200 cards with questions, 100 bonus cards, free card, point counters, winner counters, card counters, hour glass and Norwegian rules."

75165.description:
Italy, late Middle Ages. The fabric merchants need to write down their contracts in a language that everyone can understand and the literates are looking for an alternative to the elite of the traditional Latin language. So, the Volgare, the language spoken by the common people, taken from the dialects spoken in the various Italian regions, starts to gain relevance. During this period, Francesco D’Assisi writes his famous Canticle of the Sun and Dante writes the Divine Comedy, both written in Volgare.

The players will have to do their part in the creation of this new language! But who will provide them the proper knowledge to understand the manuscripts in the different dialects? Who will succeed to uncover the secrets of the books inside the Papal Library? Who will embrace the religious life and who will remain a merchant? Some of the players can become a famous banker, someone else can climb the church’s hierarchy to be the next Pope! But in the end, who will be the most appreciated and respected for his status and his culture?

The aim of the game is to obtain more Volgare points. The players will gain VP from reading manuscripts, looking for important documents like the Canticle of the Sun or "The Riddle from Verona". Players can also gain VP by improving their social status, for example, if the merchant becomes a banker or the Friar becomes a Benedictine Monk or the Cardinal becomes Camerlengo or Pope. Moreover, VP can be gotten with money and with the support of Politicians, Noblemen, Abbesses, and the Amanuensis.

75167.description:
User summary -

Nature trail is a turn based game. Each player rolls 1 die and moves around the board landing on (spotting) various animals that you might find in the English countryside. Once spotted the player gets a card depicting the animal, which they collect and at the end add up to give a final score. There is a 100 point bonus for the 1st person to finish. There are also red arrows that if landed on give either a penalty ranging from -5 to -15 or a bonus of +5 to +15. The player picks one of these card from the stack and they may contain bonus plants & animals or a penalty for littering, leaving gates open or other contraventions of the 'countryside code'.

This game came with no printed box - just a plain white card sleeve. Inside is a plastic tray, 1 board, set of rules, x1 6 sided die, 4 player counters (coloured tidily winks), x30 penalty and bonus cards for landing on red arrows, 24 animal cards, 1 100 point wining bonus card, and black card tiles to cover animals that have been spotted by players on the board.

History - I believe it was bought from the RSPB shop (The Royal Society for the Protection of Birds) UK, which is based a few miles from where I lived when I was younger. It seem it may have been a short test run of games - or only sold direct by the RSPB -

The game has stayed at my parents and is played a lot by grandchildren and adults when we get together. The game works well, with a slight imbalance in the second half of the board, or if you use the bonus points card - that lead people to race round the board.

75172.description:
Miniature Battle Rules - [from the box] Fields of Battle is a simple, straightforward, easy-to-ues game of mass combat. It easily simulates battles between hundreds and even thousands of comabatants, all in a single gaming session. Herein are all the tools you need to decide the outcome of Large-Scale Warfare. Playable with the included Battle Unit Counters, or any type of miniatures, Fileds of Battle is a flexible, easy-to-learn rules set that allows you to conduct small battles between a few dozen combatants or Mass Wargare between the Armies of Kings.

Fields of Battle comes complete with 1 Rule books, 4 different Battle scenarios, scopres of Battle unit counters, 8 sheets of two-dimensional terrain tiles, 1 Three dimensional battering Ram, 1 three diminesional catapult, and 1 three dimensional siege twoer supplied by Fat Dragon Games.

Fields of Battle is fully compatible with most any Roleplaying game. It's simple siege engine mechanic is highly adaptable, allowing you to smoothly integrate the Fields of Battle Rules set with any ongoing campaign. Your PCs and their arch enemies can even battle it out alongside their clashing forces, their skills and abilities directly impacting the tide of the wars they wage. [end of box]

The game is either a stand along tabletop miniatures mass combat game in the same vein as warhammer or warmachine...or it can also be used as a battle system in which you can integrate it with whatever RPG system you feel like so that your characters can be involved with the battle as heroes.

73563.description:
All your favorite toy box friends are back and ready to play everyone's favorite family game. UNO is even more exciting with colorful graphics and fun characters inspired by the film, Toy Story 3. Includes customized Toy Story 3 UNO cards plus the exclusive Dump Truck card.

Publisher's Website

79275.description:
Red Card is a game based primarily on luck where you try to beat 90 levels by revealing cards until you reveal a bad red card.

Rules

There are 12 green cards in each level. There is 1 red card in level 1, 2 red cards in level 2, 3 red cards in level 3, etc. The cards are randomly laid out on the board.


Red card count and red card limit

Red card count is a number of red cards remaining on the board. To calculate red card limit divide initial red card count by 2. Round up to nearest integer. For example, in level 7 red card limit is 7:3=3.5, round up to 4. If you pick a red card and red card count is lower than red card limit, you lose. You win 1 point times multiplier for each green card during main game, 2 point times multiplier during 1st replay, 3 points times multiplier during 2nd replay, and so on. If you complete all 90 levels, you play the game again.


Yellow cards

Yellow cards are cards that are used automatically to avoid decreasing of a red card count if you pick a red card. Levels 41-65 come with 1 yellow card on the board and levels 66-90 come with 2 yellow cards.

79280.description:
From Wikipedia (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuarenta)

Cuarenta is the national card game of Ecuador. It is a fishing game played with a Baraja, a pack of 40 Spanish playing cards. The game can also be played with the standard 52 card pack of Anglo-American playing cards, but all 10s, 9s and 8s are omitted (ace is low).

Cuarenta is Spanish for the number 40. This refers to the number of points that are required to win a chica (small division of the game) and also to the number of cards used to play it. Two chicas or the first chica with zapatería (loss of the chica by scoring less than ten points) win the game (a completed game is called a "mesa", which means "match"). The game can be played by 2 players, or 4 players split into two teams.

Five cards are dealt to each player, given out as a batch of five cards at a time. Each player plays one card face up onto the table. Cards on the table may be captured by the opponent. If cards are captured, they are placed face down in front of the player or his teammate. Played cards remain on the table until they are captured or the round ends.

Cards can be captured in the following three ways: matching (card same rank as on the table; player places matching card onto own pile), addition (two cards add to the value of the other; a 2 and a 4 can be captured by a 6; an ace, a 2 and a 4 can be captured by a 7; cards with pictures have no value and cannot be captured this way), and sequence (a card captured by matching or addition entitles the picking of the next higher card; matching a 2 entitles the capturing of the 3 and 4 (etc.), as well, should there be any).

If a player clears the table by capturing all cards, they score a limpia. If a player captures the card just played by the player before, this is called a caída. In either case, the player scores 2 points.

Before the first individual turn after each deal, special announcements have to be made by each player if applicable. These are the doble ronda (four cards of the same rank) and the ronda (three cards of the same rank). A doble ronda automatically wins the game; a ronda scores two points. After all five cards are played, there is a new deal. After all cards have been played (2 deals with 4 players, 4 deals with 2 players), each player or team counts their collected cards. If the number of collected cards is 20, 6 points are scored; an additional point is given for each captured card in excess of 20, rounded to the next even number.

A chica is won when a player or team reaches 40 points. The game is won when a player or a team wins two chicas or when the opponent doesn't reach ten points at the end of the first chica.

79282.description:
From rules:
Explore the lives and minds of Alexander Graham Bell, Karl Benz, the Wright brothers and other pioneers of invention and experience the thrill of the industrial revolution. Be there when the cash register, the sewing machine, the typewriter, the telephone, the gramophone, the photograph camera, the car, the steam engine and the plane are all invented again in Era of Inventions. This time you will be the inventor, who creates, patents and introduces these inventions to the markets and the world! In the late 19th and early 20th century, these inventions were all made in a certain order. In Era of Inventions, however, you’re the one who determines the order of the inventions. Race your competitors to invent as much as possible, or to speed through the production process. But don’t forget to register your patents. Otherwise you may lose influence in the industry.

GAME OVERVIEW
Era of inventions is played over 8, 9 or 10 rounds –depending on the number of players–. In each round players attempt, by using action tokens, to use the following actions at the wisest, such as: building factories, buying or producing goods, and making and producing new inventions. The number of action tokens is limited however(the time is short), and thus you must choose the best of many actions, given your situation. The player who uses his actions, money, goods and development points at the best will earn the most influence in the Era of Inventions and win the game!

75187.description:
From the back of the box:
In Eric Carle's ABC Game, players spin the spinner and search for letter cards that match their space. The letters and corresponding animal cards are inspired by Eric Carle's ABC book.

This game introduces children to the alphabet by teaching them the difference between big and little letters. Children also reinforce counting skills as they move around the board. It's easy to learn and fun to play for both children and adults.

79287.description:
From the box:

Welcome to a world of the Imagination
Where subtle, yet cunning decisions pave the way to Victory

In this time of peril, your most trusted and elite Forces have heard your call to Battle. As you watch them assemble, you recall the previous Victories were gained through intelligence and a keen sense of strategy. Explore every option, then choose your course of action - but, remember, your opponent will be doing the same...

Tactics must be used which recognize the strengths and weaknesses of your opponent's battle forces, as well as your own. Slow-moving ground forces can successfully defend key sectors of the Battle Grid, while swift-moving ground forces race through alley-ways to the attack. But always be aware of the power of the air forces and the Ranger which, when skillfully positioned, can be devastating.

Now, it is time to clear your mind so that you can imagine the impossible. Be prepared to change course in a heartbeat, yet always keep the ultimate goal firmly in mind. You are ready.

Play: Players execute one option per turn and alternate turns until victory is attained. The battle forces consist of the army under the command of a player. Siege occurs when you can attack your opponent's commander on your next turn. Victory is attained when your opponent cannot excape siege. Opening setup is similar in look to a chess game, and each individual type of fighter is able to move in a different way. The fighters include both ground and flying forces.

Ground forces can be positioned by movement, or in certain cases through spinning, or through BOTH spinning and movement. Flying forces can fly in the flight zone established by the ground forces (portals).

81482.description: Wythoff's game is a nim-like game played with two piles of counters. Players take turns to remove counters from one or both piles, with the winner removing the last stone. The Dutch mathematician W. A. Wythoff published a mathematical analysis of the game in 1907.
81482.name: Wyt Queens

75202.description:
From the Rulebook:
Assault of the Dead: Tactics is a tactical board game with roleplaying elements, The game combines thematic elements from the Assault of the Dead game but with a combat system unlike any other previously seen in the series. In contrast to Assault of the Dead: Tactics has a character building system (that includes Perks, Weapons, and Survival kits) as well as support for solo play.

Assault of the Dead: Tactics is set in a fictional zombie-infested city called Cloverdale. The game's story follows through scenarios, unfolding part of the city map allowing the players to explore new and dangerous areas. As the story progresses, you and your allies discover a sinister effect behind the zombie outbreak.

The game-play of Assault of the Dead: Tactics differs in several key areas; Characters move on a battlefield composed of circular tiles; movement and actions are determined by the character's Perks, Weapons, and Survival Kits he carries. Battles are low luck; a character can use any number of actions to attack, with attacks always hitting. During battle, whenever an attack is made, dice rolls determine the number of damage points the character can 'spend' on hits and weapon crits. Deal enough hits, and the Zombie is defeated leaving behind a Survival token -- used to buy actions or resupply your character.

Like the original Assault of the Dead: Tactics adjusts the level of reaction from the Zombie side based on how well the characters are doing. Do well and the game spawns more zombies, makes them aggressive, and more powerful. Do poorly, the game will end your misery soon enough.

75203.description:
Designer Notes:

Bible Wars is the first, and best selling, of the "10 Minute War Games" by Warcoach Games. The game gives the players the feel for ancient Biblical combat including differences between cultures and their armies.

The game features the armies of Israel, Egypt, Canaan, Philistine, Babylon, and Assyria. The army decks are sold separately and any army has an equal chance against any other army deck. The difference comes in the players skills in being able to apply his armies strengths against his opponents armies weaknesses and having the right unit mix to do so.

In April 2013, Bible Wars Deluxe was released with new historical units, advanced combat matrix, enhanced graphics, and clarified rules.

75209.description:
From the inside box cover

"Treasure Island is a game of fun. Each player represents Jim Hawkins as he attempts to find the most pirate treasure. It is simple enough for a child five years old and yet exciting enough for to be a favorite with a person who is 12 or even older.

The object of the game is to obtain the most "pieces of eight", by moving your playing piece over the path of various shaped dots from start to finish."

This version appears to be a tie in to the 1950 Disney movie of the same name. The likeness of Long John Silver and Jim Hawkins are close enough.

75210.description:
From the box back:

Travel the simply dreamy path through Strawberryland. Spin the spinner, move your pawn, and collect the charms along the way. It is twice as much fun with TWO ways to win. Be the first to collect three in a row and cross the finish line OR fill your card completely and you win! So get in step with fun and remember, friends make the good times even berrier!

No reading required

This game is not to be confused with with another Rose Art offering called Strawberryland which is a memory-based game.

name.#text: Strawberry Shortcake Strawberryland: The Board Game for Berry Best Friends

75212.description:
Grand Cru represents the best locations for a vintner to create and cultivate wine. But creating great wine and running a successful vineyard requires much more than just a great location. Patience, dedication, and a good understanding of the market are all needed to be profitable.

As ambitious vintners, the players attempt to run new vineyards located at the best sites available. As with many new businesses, starting up is very difficult. For cultivation and operating of their new businesses, the players will need to rely on loans from the local bank. Money is tight and wise investments will also help with the costs of the business. There is a need to observe the cellar and balance long-term strategies against short-term interests for running a successful vineyard. Far-sighted planning and skillful timing are keys to success.

The game ends when the first player is able to pay off all of his loans. Only then do the players find out which vintner has the most profitable vineyard to win the game. A votre santé!

79310.description:
Seven of Seven (S.o.S.) is a card game that has seven different ways to play! The main concept has to do with conflicts among Eternals which are divided in Archangels, Demons, Fortune Gods and Mortals which divided in the Sages of Ancient Greece and the Sages of China.
Each player is a Supreme Being which tries to manipulate mortals with the help of Eternals. Also, to make things more interests, you use the Seven Heavenly Virtues and Seven Deadly Sins to help in this endeavor.
In the end, the Seven Wonders help to take advantage of cards that already being used, for a small price. The Wonder is given to an opponent, and at the end of the game, the opponent benefits from the Wonders given to him.
But that's just for the first variation of the game!

The titles of the Seven of games of Seven are as follows:


Seven Supreme
Epta (by the greek number of Seven.)
Triptych
Revenge of Mortals
Iris
Heaven vs Hell
Voidance


Also, you might have understood by now, that all the cards in
this game are related to the number Seven. So, here's a list of
the games components:

7 Sages of Ancient Greece
7 Sages of China
7 Archangels
7 Demons
7 Fortune Gods
7 Heavenly Virtues
7 Deadly Sins
7 Wonders
1 Justice




Total of 57 cards.

81485.description:
Jet Set: Distant Lands - Expansion Set 1 is a set of expansions for Jet Set (including the Jet Set: Investor & Business Expansion, which was previously released alone) adding four new ways to play the game as well as 90 more Long and Short Flight Cards and 18 more Final Flight Cards. You can add the expansions individually or combine them for more fun:


Flight cards
Short Flight Cards (50 cards) - adds more Short Flight options
Long Flight Cards (40 cards) - adds more Long Flight options
Final Flight Cards (18 cards) - adds more Final Flight options

Investor (8 cards) - injects money when Vacation cards are drawn based upon conditions mentioned on the card - e.g. receive €2 for each VP
Business (40 cards) - allowing you to bend the rules - e.g. by placing free planes, by locking down an unclaimed Flight Card or by collecting tax money from the other players' income
Hubs (plastic hub markers, die-cut tokens for VP bonuses and income bonuses) - adds bonuses for routing flights through certain cities
Distant Lands (two small boards, a deck of International flights cards, 12 city tokens) - adds Intercontinental flights which are expensive but gives a good boost to income and VP

name.#text: Jet Set: Distant Lands – Expansion Set 1

79312.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The mysterious event that has animated the dead has also given them an unhealthy hunger for your brains! The only way to survive is to fortify your house and make your stand. How long can you survive?

In Zombie Survival: The Board Game, you choose your provisions to survive a zombie apocalypse. Each player selects items to place in their house, including weapons, lumber, gas, first aid, etc.

The second part of the game brings your fears to light as the zombies start heading towards your house, tearing down your barricades and creeping in. You may have a chance to make it to town for some additional supplies, hopefully avoiding the zombies there, leaving your family to defend against the walking dead. Did you prepare for the possible power outage, contaminated water, sickness and fatigue? How long can you feed your family and keep them healthy?
The best prepared will win.

79316.description:
UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 Standard Boxed Set

UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 Standard set. This aerial combat game allows players to fight for control of the sky over New Mexico. Players can choose to fly the classic piston-engine P-51D Mustang or the Roswell UFO over the desert. The Standard set contains the following: UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 Rulebook Roswell UFO (1/285 Scale) + MAJIC Flying Base P-51D Mustang (1/285 Scale) + MAJIC Flying Base + Templates, Dice and Reference Cards.

name.#text: UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 Standard Boxed Set

75223.description:
Utopia Engine is a free print-and-play dice game for one player. You play an old artificer named Isodoros who is attempting to reconstruct the Utopia Engine, a fabled device from the distant past and possibly the only hope for averting the fast approaching Doomsday. You must recover the machine's six parts from six dangerous regions and assemble the Utopia Engine before the world ends. The game uses simple dice mechanics to simulate searching the wilderness, activating and assembling powerful artifacts, and combat with artifact weapons.

Requires a printed play sheet, two six-sided dice, and a pencil with eraser.

75224.description: This is the most popular card game in Morocco. It is a fishing card game. It is played with 2 players (or 2 teams of 2 players). The play goes around the table counter clockwise. The player to the right of the dealer starts by putting a card from his/her hand on the table. Play continues around the table until the cards are exhausted. If a player has a card in his/her hand that matches a card on the table, he/she may play that card and pick up both his/her card and the one that matches. If there is a card on the table with a number 1 higher than the card played, he/she can pick up that card, too. He/she can continue picking up cards from the table with succeedingly higher numbers until the run is broken. If, during play, a player matches a card just played by the player to his/her left, the player earns 1 point.

families: Small Box Games Pure Card Line
75230.description:
Twenty-four planets speckle the tiny galaxy of Insyllium. These planets have been jointly ruled for an eon by five appointed Viceroys. Each player has a new vision for the galaxy, and will manipulate the Viceroys and their Agents in attempts to conquer the planets of the galaxy using a variety of devious methods.
Insyllium is played over series of rounds, and each round is broken into several parts, or phases: Viceroy Phase, Agent Phase, and Cleanup Phase. During a round, players will draft a Viceroy and an Agent, and attempt to gain control of new planets through a variety of devious methods. Players score points based on the planets they control as well as any completed objectives.

75233.description:
Each player start the game with 4 cards. The game takes place in several rounds, as soon as a player loses his third round the game ends.

Each player puts in his turn a card and adds its value to the amount of cards already played. If a player achieves or exceed the total of 55 he looses the round.

75234.description:
In this dice game, you must know how to stop in time to mark points. In every throw, put aside one or several dice, then throw the remaining dice. If your throws contain one 1, one 5 or a three of a kind you mark points. As for 8 it saves you, but any mediocre throw cancels the accumulated points.
The first player in 8000 points wins the game

79332.description:
Foxhole is a series of board wargames planned to cover a number of important battles of World War II and later those of other wars from the Napoleonic Wars to the War on Terror. Players assume the roles of Divisional or Corps commander. Although there are other ways to play the game, in the historical scenarios the goal is not to "win", but rather to do better than the historical commanders whose role the players have overtaken. The series' scale encompasses both the Operational and Tactical levels. Although the product is a wargame its publishers prefer to call it a simulation. It is developed by game designer Glenn Davis and published by Diffraction Entertainment, Ltd. based in Scotland, UK.

Foxhole's first product Utah Beach can be played by two to six players, while future installments are to allow additional players.

The product comes with three ways to play the game:
1) The historical scenario that comes with each product where the goal is to do better than the historical results,
2) A competitive (called tournament-style in the rulebook) system with over two dozen orders similar to Warhammer 40k like sieze and hold, rearguard action, etc. where your goal is to "beat" your opponent to the goal. Interestingly, in this version you each take one of the hexagonally shaped maps, set up your forces, and then push them together, giving you a bit of fog of war.
3) TSWW conversion: Although seemingly not fully supported in the original product, the rulebook implies that with later releases of TO&E data players will be able to play out TSWW battles at the Foxhole scale, giving gamers the first opportunity ever to play out World War II at the company scale ... everywhere.

As for playing the game; the following is ripped straight from the rulebook: "A Primer on Foxhole™ in 400 Words or Less
Each Player Turn consists of 6 essential Phases:

Supply-Movement Phase: Units which are adjacent to enemies, plan on firing an artillery barrage or conduct an Activity this turn must Trace Supply instead of do anything this Phase. Otherwise they may move as usual.
Barrage Phase: Barrages may be fired this Turn by Sorties and Artillery. In the case of Artillery, they must have Traced Supply in the prior Phase and not move in the next in order to do so. Note that the Reacting Player may also be able to fire Barrages.
Activities-Movement Phase: It is during this Phase and only if the Unit Traced Supply in the Supply-Movement Phase that Units may conduct Activities other than Movement such as digging entrenchments, demolishing them, bridges, etc., crossing a river or un-pin a Vehicle Platoon (which represents Vehicles bogged down). Units may also move unless they fired a Barrage in the prior Phase.
Combat Phase: There are two kinds of Combat and each hex may be attacked only once. Assaulting allows Units to enter and, if successful, secure a hex. Its disadvantages are that it allows the opposing Player to make Covering Fire against your Assaulting Units, you have less terrain benefits and are limited to 4 Units Assaulting the Hex. By contrast, Fights allow Units to attack enemy Units from range and has none of the above hindrances, but cannot secure a Hex and is less likely to do serious damage to the opposition.
Motorized Movement Phase: Motorized Units are all Vehicle Platoons plus any other Unit with the little wheels at the bottom. Any of such Units can move during this Phase. In lieu of moving, they may instead make a 50/50 attempt to Un-pin themselves from the hex (but they couldn't have moved anyway).
Vehicle Assault Phase: During this Phase Vehicles Platoons (not all Motorized Units) may make Assaults.
Full Turn: A Full Turn consists of Weather Determination and Forecasting followed by a Player Turn from each Player. The Offensive Player always goes first, which is also the Allied Player in the Utah Beach Historical Scenario. There are three Full Turns each Day representing the Morning, Afternoon and Night. Preceding each Morning Turn and the beginning of the day both Players should conduct a Dawn Briefing." - Foxhole Rulebook, page 36.




The only thing the above misses is a fun little weather forecasting and resolution where players forecast the weather two turns ahead of time, and it may or may not actually end up being the weather they thought it was going to be (but *probably* will), adding a lot a pressure/tenseness as the commanders look overhead to see whether those clouds will clear up, start a drizzle, or remain overcast as predicted.

79339.description:
A trivia game with the Dutch National Ballet theme.

Each player gets a jurysurvey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the jurysurvey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the jurysurvey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

79340.description:
There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she receives a Right-chip. Otherwise he/she receives a Wrong-chip.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

MAde for the travel company Baobab.

79343.description:
There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she receives a Right-chip. Otherwise he/she receives a Wrong-chip.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

A trivia game about fashion, dances, music and Bacardi.

79345.description:
Each player gets a Playboy card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the Playboy card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the Playboy card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Trivia game about the World of Playboy.

75254.description:
Death in the Snow game book is a complete 28mm miniatures rules system, but also can be used to expand any of the other Flintloque 3rd edition game books.

Death in the Snow is a Napolonic Fantasy skirmish wargame which you only need under a dozen miniatures for each side and a number of D10s to start playing.

Death in Snow takes the histrocal background of Napoleon’s invasion of Russian and places it into the Flintloque fantasy background of the Elven Emperor Mordred invasion of The Mysterious Witchlands.

name.#text: Flintloque (third edition): Death in the Snow

75256.description:
Grapshotte is an expansion book for 3rd edition Flintloque rules and you will need one of the other game books to use them (War in Catlucia, Death in the Snow, Bier and Bones or Blood on the Sand).

The expension rules contants rules on artillery, mines, weather, sappers, new trooper types and new skills etc.. Also it lists new equipment for each race.

75259.description:
This exclusive Dutch expansion box for Power Grid includes the officially released Power Grid: Benelux/Central Europe and Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards:

Benelux: As the Benelux countries support ecological power, players may have greater opportunities to acquire such power plants. Also, oil is more available and coal less available in these countries.

Central Europe: As Poland has large coal supplies, coal will be much more plentiful than elsewhere in Central Europe. However, due to political stands taken by some countries, players may be limited in their access to nuclear power.

New Power Plants: This deck is a complete set of power plant cards for Power Grid that can be used:

in place of the original deck
paired with the original deck (to make for an unpredictable mix)
cards added to the original deck (to make the game as long as "Funkenschlag", game will end at 20 cities)
in custom mixture of the two decks (to create specialized decks) with any maps.




Expands:

Power Grid

75260.description:
From the DoW website:

Here comes the final installment in our first Battle Maps series!

The Disaster at Dieppe expansion features 2 large-scale ready-to-play Overlord Scenarios, 4 Standard Scenarios, 6 half-tracks miniatures and 6 Jeeps miniatures.

Disaster at Dieppe highlights the ill-fated raid on the German-occupied coastal town of Dieppe, code-named, Operation Jubilee; while The capture of Tobruk features Rommel in June of ‘42 as he relentlessly pushes his Afrika Korps after smashing through the British lines at Gazala in North Africa.

The Battle Map series is designed to encourage team play and accommodates up to 8 players; each map comes ready-to-play with all terrain, obstacles and unit positions pre-printed, making set-up a snap. Battle Map Volume 4 includes 6 half-tracks miniatures, 6 jeeps miniatures and 4 standard scenarios that are playable on a regular Memoir ‘44 board. The 4 Standard scenarios are: Raid on Barce and Rommel’s Right Hook, featuring the new Willys jeeps as long-range patrol cars; and Panzers in the Atlas and Le-Mesnil-Adelée, featuring the new Sd.Kfz. 250 half-tracks. Also included are detailed rules for the long-range patrol cars and half-tracks.
75260.name: Memoir '44: Disaster at Dieppe

75266.description:
Additional Information:
This simple card game links play and learn. The players add up the stored value cards, in order to achieve a predetermined amount. Then action comes into play: the question of mystery and movement!

Product:
In the middle of the table are the number two chip 9-15 The players place their chips on this one card, which indicates a positive or negative number. Is already a card there, they expect the result of the numbers. If a player reaches the value of the chip number, he can win this, as he solves a riddle, a question of knowledge or action task. Whoever collects the first four numbers chips wins.

name.#text: 3 mit Kopf & Pfote: Lustig und schlau!

76715.description: (Original title: Приключения на луне) The goal of the game is to rescue a lost spaceship on the moon and bring it back to the lunar base. It consists of two parts. During the first part, players roll dice to land on different locations on the moon map, collecting points for doing so. Some of the locations may have the lost spaceship. As soon as the lost spaceship is rescued, everyone moves back to the base, collecting additional points along the way. This game is mostly luck but features an accurate lunar map and encourages players to learn lunar locations and some noteworthy lunar missions.
76715.name: Adventures on the moon

75269.description:
From the publisher:

Attention, attention! It is time to start the big race! All cars have taken their standing positions! Is McQueen going to win again? Join the race and see who will be the crazy speed champion this time. Ready, steady, go!

Game play:
Lay the board into the middle. Place the token next to the board. This is the "token bank".
Place the cars on the start line. Youngest player will start.

You win the game when you finish the race first. But to do that you need fuel. Token act as a fuel in this game.
You get fuel on the square with a cup on it. The max number of token collected is different with number of players.
Each token also add 1 to your dice roll. So 6 token add 6 to your dice roll.
After crossing the lightning square you will no longer get the token bonus.
And when two cars land on the same space, then the one who was there first will miss one turn.
Special squares:
Gas station - extra gas. 3 more spaces.
Wheel - snow. Subtract 2 from the next roll.
Flat tyre - miss two turns.
Gear box - stay put until roll at least 4.
Speedometer - 4 extra spaces.

The winner is the one who crosses the finis line first.
75269.name: The World Of Cars: Race-O-Rama

79367.description:
The Step Chain Expansion adds a fourth color into play and also includes a new type of card that allows you to split your chain into multiple chains, giving you more options for scoring and blocking.
Source: [ The Game Crafter].

The expansion set really completes the game adding yellow into the mix. A total of 80 cards are added including the new Split Chain Cards offer more options on building chains and some interesting scoring possibilities if you can merge your chains back together.

72620.description:
Triplets is a game where players attempt to form patterns using the symbols on hexagonal tiles.

Each tile has one, two, or three symbols in one of three different colors and one of three different shapes. A triplet is formed with three tiles where each attribute is either all the same or all different.

The tiles must be played in a way that forms a honeycomb lattice of overlapping rings. To score a triplet, the three tiles must be on a single ring of hexagons, and each triplet is scored by placing a marker in the open center of the ring. Multiple triplets can be formed on a single ring, and each tile is part of three rings, allowing for multiple scoring opportunities on each turn. The player scoring the most triplets wins the game.

Triplets is a game that will twist your brain, but stretch your visual perception and pattern matching skills at the same time.

Triplets won the 2010 KublaCon Game Design Contest.

75275.description: A game made to encourage debate before the Swedish referendum in 1994 on joining the European Union. Players roll and move along the game board, triggering various events that include having to quickly look up answers in a book named Mega Express. Along the way they pick up votes to be used in the end game, which takes place after an arbitrary agreed-upon period of time (the rules suggest half an hour or an hour). Each player now casts their accumulated votes either for or against joining the EU, and the totals are added up to show the outcome; the rules envision several concurrent games, the votes from each session being added up to a grand total. It should be noted that the book required for proper use of the game was not packaged with it, may not accompany copies found in thrift shops, and may be difficult to obtain.

75278.description:
Trivia game based on the 00s incarnation of a Swedish TV trivia contest. The title translates to "double or nothing", which describes the fundamental "push your luck" element: the goal is to answer six questions in succession (with a timer being used for the last four), or to stop and collect money.

Hasse and Karin Thorsvad are credited with supplying the questions, although the actual game designer is not credited.

There is a game of the same name based on a previous incarnation of the TV show.

75279.description: Tic-Attack-Toe makes tic-tac-toe cool again! Players try to get three-in-a-row before their opponent by playing with numbered X and O cards. Higher numbered cards can be played on lower numbered cards. By combining the easy to understand rules of three-in-a-row with the luck of the draw Tic-Attack-Toe is a fun, strategic game that kids and adults want to play over and over again. The Tic-Attack-Toe playing board also doubles as a carrying case to make for a great summer travel game.

75281.description:
The government has become corrupt, repressing, and enslaving the people, ruling with iron fist. The world has been tossed into turmoil. But amidst the upheaval, leaders are being made; heroes with their own agendas. As they gather more followers, they are creating armies to take down the Global Government and anyone else who may stand in their way. Competing ideological federations are battling for control to unify the world under their principles one nation at a time.

As General of a federation, you are to leverage your innate capabilities to master the market, leverage trades, and then develop and command your military to conquer provinces.

Up to four players can play and each player is provided with armies comprised of Caltrops (Soldiers), ArmTors (Armored Units), Threshers (Sea Units), and Fight Kites (Air Units) each with specific capabilities and costs. Each individual playing piece can be further developed with enhanced capabilities depending on the level of training a player is willing to invest. The playing board is comprised of hex tiles that carry with them specific assets that enable players to accumulate assets and money. Players can use money and assets to create manufacturing plants (Barracks, Armories, Harbors, and Hangars) which in turn can be used to create armies. Unit ranks determine the level of dice players roll in battle which determine victory or defeat.

The victor is the General who captures all of their opponents Headquarters or forces the other Generals to concede the game.

Follow the development at http://revolution-thegame.blogspot.com

John Biggs & Jay Guerrero – Game Design
Todd Biggs – Game Piece Design
Mark Mahaffey – Artwork

76718.description:
"Welcome to the world of totally cheap tabletop wargaming! Why spend buckets of cash on a superior, worthwhile product when you can download this crappy cheap ass parody of Warhammer 40K? Now you too can roll fistfulls of dice to see who split whos testicles open on the bloody field of battle, otherwise known as the kitchen table. Now, you too can have no life and be the sort of nerd who even furries snicker at: a grognard, a wargamer. This and more is all yours for cheap as free with TOYMALLET 40 Cents!"

(from author's webpage)

Beneath the parody, this is a simple but playable miniatures wargame. Two players take turns moving, shooting, and assaulting with their miniatures armies, which can be made from almost any kind of miniatures or toys. Everything is fitted into three broad categories (squads, commanders, and tankmecha), with some options for further characterization by special rules (extra armour, flight capability, etc). All combat is resolved by rolling six-sided dice, and all measurement is in terms of Lengths (any length unit the players agree on - the game accomodates miniatures of any scale if you chose a sensible length of a Length). The winner is the side that after six turns have accumulated the most Happy Time Fun points, which are earned for seizing objectives and killing enemies.

75292.description:
This is the sixth game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

This promotional Pocket Battle wargame is one of four games that cover the American's fight against KG Peiper and other German forces during the Battle of the Bulge. They can be played separately or linked together for a "grand campaign" It is printed on a single postcard-sized piece of cardstock, with game map on front and rules on the back. Counters need to be cut out. Die-cut counters are available from ATO with any purchase at no additional charge. One set of die-cut counters will provide the counters for ALL FOUR of the "Peiper" Pocket Battle Games.

The German player is needs to get his single tank unit ("Spitze") to exit the west edge of the map within 6 turns, or eliminate all US forces. The Germans have off-board artillery and the US can demolish bridges to slow the German forces. A regular deck of playing cards is used to handle unit activations and combat results for both players

79389.description:
User Summary:
Polemos: Risorgimento is a free to download miniature ruleset supplement to Polemos: Franco-Prussian War covering the Italian Wars of unification.

Two sizes of games are presented. The Risorgimento Fratelli d'Italia focuses on smaller scale actions with corps sized forces. One base of miniatures is to represent an infantry battalion of approximately 500 soldiers. For players who prefer army scale games Risorgimento Feldzeugmeister is the other part of the game. In Feldzeugmeister one base of miniatures represent brigades, approximately 2500 soldiers in the case of infantry.

The game is available from Baccus6mm in the U.K.

75294.description:
Naval Thunder: Bitter Rivals is a huge expansion of the Battleship Row WW2 naval combat core rules with over 130 new classes of ship representing the fleets of Britain, Germany, France, and Italy as well as data cards for merchants and transports for use in convoy games. Special nationality-specific rules represent the unique character of each fleet.

Also included are 13 carefully researched historical scenarios featuring many of the most important naval battles of the war from the Atlantic, Pacific, and Mediterranean theaters. Scenarios range in size from small cruiser actions to huge fleet engagements. Each scenario includes a complete order of battle, deployment map, victory conditions, overview, and historical outcome.

A half dozen new special scenario rules, including minefields, shore batteries, mechanical breakdowns, and more, allow you to confront the same challenges faced by the historical commanders.

The flash preview below will let you page through the rules & scenario portions of the book to see the exciting content it includes. Ship data cards are included with the purchase but do not appear in the preview.

Requires Battleship Row core rules to play.

75295.description:
This 48-page expansion to the top selling Naval Thunder: Clash of Dreadnoughts core rules covers pre-dreadnought era combat during the Russo-Japanese War (1904 - 1905).

The addition of pre-dreadnought era combat to the Naval Thunder line adds a whole new tactical angle to the existing Clash of Dreadnoughts rules. With neither the speed nor the weapons range of their World War I era cousins, pre-engagement maneuver becomes critical, and once the battle is joined it's a brutal affair conducted at "knife fighting" distance.

Included in Naval Thunder: Rise of the Battleship are the rules changes necessary to the core Clash of Dreadnoughts rules to recreate exciting pre-dreadnought battles on your tabletop. It also includes fleet lists and data cards for the Russian and Japanese Imperial navies, two historical scenarios, The Battle of the Yellow Sea, and The Battle of Tsushima and an updated quick-reference guide reflecting the rules changes so you can jump right into the action.

All data cards in Rise of the Battleship are completely compatible with Clash of Dreadnoughts and other Naval Thunder releases. Included with the dowloads is an optional MS Excel tool that allows you to select and print data cards in seconds. Instructions for using Rise of the Battleship with other Naval Thunder products are included.

name.#text: Naval Thunder: Rise of the Battleship

75302.description:
Palavra Final is an exciting game, on every word, and every card. You spin the wheel, play, and start to create you sentence, from the first word. Everybody starts the game with 10 cards and the objective to achieve the victory is to discard all your cards, but to do this you have to keep an eye on the sequence: It has to be logical.
Each turn every player spin the wheel and do whats it's written.
It could be to drop a card, drop a closed card, give two of your cards to another opponent, challenge another player if the sequence makes sense, without the risk of taking all cards to you, change two cards, put a card between others that are already on a sentence, or the most excite option, put a card on any blank space, but when the sentence gets there it has to be logical. And if you don't agree with your opponent you can challenge him to explain the sentence. You can conjugate the verb in diferent ways to make sense, but if the other players don't agree you take all the cards from the board, but if you can explain to them and they accept the opponent that challenges you take all the cards. The first one to discard the last card wins the game.

75313.description:
A special promo card for anyone who preorders Dixit 2, the American card pictures a cowboy sitting in a room with a bag of popcorn to his side and a television on in front of him with a cartoon on.

From the promotion site: Several months ago, the idea to get a special card for Dixit made its way to the Asmodee North-American office. Then the idea became bigger, why not have an exclusive card? The success of the game, even if it’s still only the beginning, even if we were sure this game will be a hit, takes us by surprise, by the strong and continuous demand. (http://www.asmodee-us.com/ressources/articles/dixit-contest....)

79413.description:
Players cooperate to catch the thief who stole the King's magic ring. To catch the thief, players need help from various animals living in the castle. But time is working against them, so they need to have a good memory and a little luck to catch the thief before time runs out.

This is the portable version of the electronic boardgame, including only tiles, one pawn and a custom die. It is a simple roll-and-move game with a memory element and some limited tactical opportunites.
79413.name: Qui l'a vu: Version de voyage

75322.description:
"Cholent the Game" is a brand new card game that everyone in the family will love playing. Players are dealt a secret recipe card and venture out into the shuk--or market--to collect the ingredients they need, like meat, potatoes, eggs and spices. Using their gelt--or money--, players outbid each other for the ingredients. But don't forget your chevra! The other characters you meet in the market, like The Rebbe, The Bubby, the Prophet and more--will help you get your ingredients before anyone else.

You've tried the food. Now play the game.

75326.description:
Gefährlich Ehrlich (engl. Precariously honest) is a communication and party game.
The players move their pawns long a trail froms start to goal, answering questions. Their pace of movement is determinend by how well they have solved the last question. Die kind of question is determined by the field their pawn is standing on. There are three different categories:

Extreme! : All players vote which one of two contrary characteristics on a Extreme!card fits most to the character of the active player. The two characteristics are either both negative or both positive, so everybody is forced to give a honest vote for the more fitting characteristic.

Hey, that´s You!: All players point at each other simultaneously, voting who at the game table fits most to a given attribute.

Top or Flop: A situation is described on a card. The active player has to describe how he/she would solve it. The other players vote (by showing thumb up/down simultaneously) if they think his answer is honest and fits to his character.

As a very important aspect of the game, players act a lot with their hands while playing: swinging the fists, counting aloud, pointing fingers on other player, showing thumbs up/down and declaring counting-out rhymes together. So there is always action at the game table.

Gefährlich Ehrlich is not just a fun game but also a kind of tool to find out more about how other people look at you and what kind of character they think you are.

73500.description:
(From the website)

This is a fan created expansion for the card game Agricola. This print and play expansion contains 15 Occupations, 11 Minor Improvements, and 1 Major Improvement for Agricola.

You need Agricola to play.

Original content for The MY Deck is © 2009-2010 Michael Young. Agricola is TM and © Lookout Games.

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 License.

name.#text: The MY Deck (fan expansion for Agricola)

75331.description: Playable with up to four players, the game begins with players determining player-order. Each player in-turn spins the spinner and hangs the shown amount of monkeys and bananas on the monkey tree. The round stops when one of the players makes the tree lose its balance and drop monkeys or bananas. That player out and the game begins anew with the other players. The winner is the last person standing.

75333.description:
‘Target Earth” is a board game simulation of an Alien Invasion of Planet Earth.
Battlefield is the whole planet, represented by a Global Board, featuring the 30 most economically powerful countries on the planet. Allied countries will bring money and Victory points to the Alliance. Countries aligned with the Aliens will count as victory points for the invader. By the end of the seventh turn whichever side has more Victory Points will be the winner.
Each player represents a faction of a Human Alliance and manages one of their bases and its associated resources (money, units and cards). Players must deal with the alien offensive using their units to fight airborne and landed UFOs in an effort to strengthen their Alliance by getting countries to join them. In order to stop the Alien offensive and beat the invader, they must also investigate new technologies as well as the nature of the Alien life form.

The Alien side is not controlled by any player. Its actions are determined randomly each turn, with an incremental difficulty as game progresses.

The game has two playing modes:
-Basic mode is a cooperative game where 1-4 players form a Human Alliance that will fight to stop the alien invasion.
In this game mode, if the Human Alliance achieves victory, all players win. Otherwise, everyone loses.

-Advanced game mode, is a semi-competitive game for 2-4 players, where each player forming the human Alliance has his own secret agenda and is able to obtain individualized victory points. As in the basic mode, the total amount of victory points and human technology level will determine whether the Alien side has achieved victory. If Humans win, only one of the players will be declared winner, according to their fulfilled agenda and performance during the Alien War.
75333.name: Objetivo La Tierra

80115.description:
Dolmen
(Room P3, Terrain, Goodies 2007)


Dolmens are 3D obstacles.



There are seven squares of Dolmens surrounding the Reflecting Pool and a normal floor square allowing access to the pool.


Reflecting Pool
(P3 Room, Terrain, Goodies 2007)


The Reflecting Pool is magic. Its powers can be cancelled by the Magophage.



A character entering the Reflecting Pool must immediately end his movement.



A character who enters the Reflecting Pool will remain still (he enters into meditation) and cannot carry out any action as if he were wounded (except actions specified below).



A character meditating in the Reflecting Pool has a combat value of 0. The Ghost and Specter can also meditate.



The meditating character (standing in the Reflecting Pool) can for 2 AP activate the rotation gear of any "natural" room. The room turns a 1/4 turn in the direction of the arrow (or the opposite direction for the Mekanork).



A room is considered "natural" if it contains at least one trees or vines.



As of the Lands of Ice expansion, the forested rooms are P3, 29, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 36.
80115.name: Dungeon Twister:  Room P3

79442.description:
From the rules:
'The object of this exciting game is to become the greatest possible owner of Hilton Hotels. In pursuit of this goal a little optimistic speculation is as important as being lucky at dicing.'

Similar to Monopoly, you roll a die, move, then take/add to a hotel or take a card if you land on the right space.

79446.description:
Dominoes variant played using hexagonal pieces.
The pieces are divided equally amongst the players and a start player chosen. The start player places one of their hexadoms, Second play must place on of their pieces matching one of the sides. Subsequent players must place matching two or more sides.
If a player cannot place a piece they miss a turn. Play continues until one player has placed all his Hexadoms - they are the winner. If no player can place a Hexadom then the player whose pieces show the fewest dots is the winner.

72633.description:
Shaun das Schaf - Kuchen Chaos is an easy kids game, with a variation of a dice tower - a cace machine - as core mechanic.

In every turn, a player throw in muffin-tokens (one pink and one blue with different shapes) into the tower and than moves one of the 4 platforms, to open or close holes. So after some turns, muffin-tokens will fall out of this cake machine. The player during whose turn the muffin drops out of the tower gets it. The first to collect 8 muffins wins the game

75353.description:
Taking top battling to the next level. These magnetic powered tops spin at high speeds and can top out over 6000 RPMs with the turbo launchers.

Battle to the end with customizable tops to adjust Attack, Defense, and Control. Once in battle these tops don't just spin and move randomly, you can control them with a magnetic glove to direct your top to attack or avoid your opponent.

User Description

79452.description:
From the website... "The Soviets have broken through the NATO line in West Germany, and the West German, British, and Americans are in full retreat. They approach the French border, hoping for aid, praying for sanctuary, but the AMX-30 tanks on the far side of the border fire, their shells ripping into the approaching NATO troops. Thus starts another chapter in the World at War series.

Paris is Burning brings the French into the flaming battlefields of Europe. Zealots, patriots, and determined to defend their homeland, the French battle any army that crosses into France. Paris is Burning ships with two 11" x 17" geomorphic maps, 176 eye-popping counters, player’s aids, and module rules, all tucked neatly into an attractive box. Paris is Burning is an expansion for World at War: The Untold Stories.

This expansion includes:

Two 11" x 17" geomorphic mounted maps.
176 counters depicting French, British, Americans, and the evil Soviets.
Player aid card.
Module rules.
Vividly illustrated box.

name.#text: World at War: Paris is Burning

75358.description:
A re-issue of David V. H. Peters' SNCF (Société Nationale des Chemins de fer Français). Originally released by Winsome Games as part of its 2010 Essen Set, SNCF was subsequently licensed by Queen Games and rereleased as Paris Connection in 2011. This is a fast network-/portfolio-building game with a train theme, with the objective of having the most valuable stock portfolio at the end of the game. Players can own and trade stocks as well as influence the value of each company.

There are 6 colors of wooden locomotives, each color representing a company. Players are dealt random hands of 5-10 (depending on number of players) locomotives, which are essentially a stock portfolio; the rest of each color are placed in a pool. On your turn, you can either increase the value of a single company by placing 1-5 locomotives from the remaining pool of that company, or you can trade one locomotive in your portfolio for one or two locomotives from the remaining pool in a company.

The game board is a map of France, with cities worth anywhere from 1-4 points, and rural hexes worth 0. Connecting to a city adds to a company's value.

The game ends when Marseille is reached by a company, or when there is only one company with locomotives remaining in the pool. Players' scores are determined by the value of each company at the end multiplied by the number of locomotives the player has for each color.

SNCF expansions may be used with this game.
75358.name: Paris Connection

75360.description:
You and your friends are rail barons trying to be on top. Who will correctly determine the end game and have the most money?

A fun train game.

Harry Wu's Texas & Pacific is a train game that employs 2-6 players for an hour. The players are rail barons who purchase stock and try to increase their income through shrewd track placement.
