In the 1970s, the governments of the world faced unprecedented demand for energy, and polluting power plants were built everywhere in order to meet that demand. Year after year, the pollution they generate increases, and nobody has done anything to reduce it. Now, the impact of this pollution has become too great, and humanity is starting to realize that we must meet our energy demands through clean sources of energy. Companies with expertise in clean, sustainable energy are called in to propose projects that will provide the required energy without polluting the environment. Regional governments are eager to fund these projects, and to invest in their implementation.

If the pollution isn't stopped, it's game over for all of us.

In the game CO₂, each player is the CEO of an energy company responding to government requests for new, green power plants. The goal is to stop the increase of pollution, while meeting the rising demand for sustainable energy — and of course profiting from doing so. You will need enough expertise, money, and resources to build these clean power plants. Energy summits will promote global awareness, and allow companies to share a little of their expertise, while learning still more from others.

In CO₂, each region starts with a certain number of Carbon Emissions Permits (CEPs) at its disposal. These CEPs are granted by the United Nations, and they must be spent whenever the region needs to install the energy infrastructure for a project, or to construct a fossil fuel power plant. CEPs can be bought and sold on a market, and their price fluctuates throughout the game. You will want to try to maintain control over the CEPs.

Money, CEPs, Green Power Plants that you've built, UN Goals you've completed, Company Goals you've met, and Expertise you've gained all give you Victory Points (VPs), which represent your Company's reputation – and having the best reputation is the goal of the game ... in addition to saving the planet, of course.
72225.name: CO2

72226.description:
A simple but deep solo game played with pen and grid paper.

Starting from an initial cross pattern of 36 marks, score one point for each mark you can add to the pattern that can be joined with existing marks into a non-overlapping line of five.

76323.description:
From publishers homepage:

“Throw the dice against tobacco” is a fun interactive board game through which the players can learn a lot about tobacco on the global scale. It can be played with up to 5 players with a minimum age of 12 years. In the game you are responsible for your own country and with some knowledge, luck and strategic thinking you will lead your country to be a healthy non-smoking community. All the situations and facts in the game are based on real-life cases and independent statistics.

72229.description:
(Loosely translated from publisher's description)

Hooray! Alex Ape is happy, because he received a postcard from his friend Paul Penguin! Help them, and divide the postcards among the animals. Each card shows the first letter of one animal. Turn the card over to see whether you have given the postcard to the right animal!

72232.description:
You are a "CEO" of a multinational company. Your objective is to "transfer" money from the company account to your private "retirement" account on the Cayman Islands. You fly around the game board in your company jet, carrying a well-stuffed moneybag - but the money isn’t yours.. yet.
As a serious and highly paid "CEO" you have a lot of chores; hiring a new secretary, whose business qualifications spring from her weeklong experience as a Hooters waitress, convincing the SEC that a couple of late night phone calls do not qualify as insider trading, but are simply a question of friendly talk between collegues, and maintaining your expensive friendship with the local politicians. Of course you also have to be on top of the latest news from the various business' you are involved in, which means chatting up other "CEO's" on luxury cruises. On your way, you encounter the chance to do alittle trading, spend the Company's money on luxury items and maybe have a run-in with the IRS or the SEC. So before you get to fly to Cayman, your moneybag may have inflated or deflated – or you may even be forced to exchange your moneybag with another "CEO".

You are ready to retire (have won the game) when you have put away 150 Million on your private Cayman Islands account.

80425.description:
(From the website)

The first major battle of the Civil war, Bull Run (also known as First Manassas) was a contest of tactical opportunities lost. Featuring a brilliant flanking march by Union forces under General Irvin McDowell that caught the Confederate General Beauregard by surprise on his weak east flank, the Union army failed to roll up the Confederate line due, in great measure, to the famous stand by General Thomas Jackson's Virginia brgade, which was said to have stood "like a stone wall". On the other side of the tactical ledger, General Beauregard's plan to drive across Bull Run on the west side to Centerville, thus cutting the Union army off from its supplies and communications, failed due to poorly communicated orders. Battle at Bull Run is a simulation of historical events of July 21, 1861 intended to give a feeling for the historical decisions required by the two army commanders in a fast play format.

* Two-Person or Solitaire Play
* Color Five-Page Game Rules Manual
* Upgraded Game Map In Full Color
* Larger Game Map Now 15 x 11 Hexes
* 25 Upgraded 3/4" Counters
* Two Union Units Added To Order of Battle
* Solitaire Play Rules
* Available in PDF Format

72234.description:
Howdy, ya'll. Rattlesnake Creek is a rip-roaring miniatures wargaming system primarily designed for 25/28mm models.

Set in the Old West, this game delivers a fast, simple, and exciting experience of small-scale gun battles, recreating the drama of combat with dice rolls and poker chips.

So grab yer six-shooter, pilgrim!

72235.description:
You start the game with 50% health. The object is to get to 100%, but the luring sides of life and the challenges are plentiful and you can easily fall into the pits that will give you lower health.

The Health game is a good mix of questions, brain trainers and - if you are up for it - physical exercises (can be played without if you choose)

There are two different categories of cards (questions and exercises) in the game:

F-cards contain questions about Food, Fitness & Family.

W-cards are challenges for your Will, Wit and Well-being. Some of these 'exercises' call for the use of the timer included in the game.

The more correctly you answer questions and solve your challenges, the healthier you become - at least in the game.
72235.name: Health

72236.description:
The Allies expansion set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces new units into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards. The Allies Expansion Set may not be played stand-alone.

From the back of the box: (including typos)
For the first time in card game history, fans of both card an strategy games will be able to experience a phenomenal and stunning new gaming experience. Units that you are likely to encounter: Spitfires, p-38 Lightning, B-17's, German Ju-87 Stukas and Heinkel HE-111 bombers. Thanks like the well known Sherman and the deadly Tiger. Also the naval power does not stay behind and will be represented by powerful units like the German Super Battleship Tirpitz and the powerful British Dreadnoughts, while next to them invisible submarines roam the wide deep Atlantic trade routes...

Card mix: (55 cards)
14 x land units
15 x air units
11 x naval units
5 x action cards
3 x territory improvement
5 x base improvement
2 x territory
72236.name: History of War: Allies Expansion Set

72237.description:
The Axis expansion set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces new units into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards.

The Axis Expansion Set may not be played stand-alone.

From the back of the box: (including typos)
For the first time in card game history, fans of both card an strategy games will be able to experience a phenomenal and stunning new gaming experience. Units that you are likely to encounter: Spitfires, P-38 Lightning, B-17's, German Ju-87 Stukas and Heinkel HE-111 bombers. Tanks like the well known Sherman and the deadly Tiger. Also the naval power does not stay behind and will be represented by powerful units like the German Super Battleship Tirpitz and the powerful British Dreadnoughts, while next to them invisible submarines roam the wide deep Atlantic trade routes...

Card mix: (55 cards)
14 x land units
15 x air units
4 x naval units
10 x action cards
5 x territory improvement
5 x base improvement
2 x territory

name.#text: History of War: Axis Expansion Set

72238.description:
Defenders of the Realm: The Dragon Expansion provides the means to ramp up, ease up, expand and customize your Defenders of the Realm gaming experience in a variety of ways. The three new Dragon Generals (Onyx - black, Hemlock - green, Brimstone - red) can be used with Sapphire, the original blue Dragon, in a struggle that will severely test the mettle of the Heroes of the Realm. The new General card for Sapphire gives her an additional hit point for each other Dragon in play.

You can also mix and match the new Generals with the existing Generals. The new Generals minions' each have their own special abilities:

Onyx's (black) Zealots go berserk when fighting - the survivors together dealing one point of damage after each combat action. You'll still take a wound from each if you remain in the same area with them at the end of your turn.
Hemlock's (green) Imps propagate quickly (whenever you place an Imp, another one pops up in every adjacent space) and steal a random card from you if you remain in the same space with them at the end of your turn.
Brimstone's (red) Fire Elementals spontaneously combust whenever three of them get together, setting the area on fire. Areas on fire require 2 Actions to move into, taint whenever three minions are present, instead of 4 and deal wounds to Heroes remaining in the area at the end of their turns.




The Generals each have their own special nastiness as well. For example, Brimstone, instead of moving along the usual red-General path, moves every time her card comes up when Darkness Spreads, flitting here and there and setting the world on fire. Players can lose cards when attacking Hemlock.

Any of the new dragons can also be used as an Agent of the Dark Lord when playing with at least one of the original Generals (Varkolak, Gorgut, or Balazarg). You can add up to 5 of the 10 Global Effects Cards (5 Good, 5 Bad) to the Darkness Spreads deck to adjust the toughness of your campaign. Likewise, a number of Royal Blessing Tokens (4 max) can also be added to the game. Royal Blessings allow players to either ignore a Darkness Spreads card, remove a taint crystal or prevent a General from moving.

For a more Campaign-style game, players can utilize the King's Champion Scoring Variant which allows players to track their feats, major and minor. Feat examples include: taking on 3 minions at once, killing two with one blow, attempting to complete a quest, successfully completing a quest, healing the land, putting out a fire, dealing wounds or the killing blow to a General... The player with the most fame at the end of the game becomes the King's Champion. The 2nd, 3rd and 4th most famous Heroes also receive titles and awards. The titles and awards each provide a special ability to that character that can be utilized the next time it is played by the same player.

Scheduled to debut at Spiel 2010 is the Dragon Expansion (formerly the Black Dragon expansion), which consists of the following:

3 General Miniatures (3 Dragons)
3 New General Cards
1 New Sapphire (Blue Dragon) General Card
4 Wound Tokens 1 for each General
3 Agents of the Dark Lord Cards
10 Fire Tokens
4 Royal Blessing Tokens
1 Royal Blessing Card
12 New Quest Cards
10 Global Effects Cards
1 Fame Card
6 New Special Cards
New Darkness Spreads Deck
New Hero Cards Deck
King’s Champion Variant Scoring Tokens
7 Kings Champion Reward Cards
Rulebook and A Story from the Realm

name.#text: Defenders of the Realm: The Dragon Expansion

72239.description:
Three-Card Monte is played one of two ways. The first method is a children's game in which three cards or objects are laid out face-up. The cards or objects are then turned face down and scrambled. The challenge is then to pick out where one of the objects is now positioned. It's flipped over and the guess is either correct or not.

Variations of this "honest" version are now commonly shown on the big screens of sporting events.

The "confidence" version of Three-Card Monte actually uses 4 cards. The dealer uses a palming technique to make a card switch, so that the player can't find the correct card. This method is a rigged game, which often involves the use of a shill to create the illusion the game can be won.
72239.name: Follow the Lady

72240.description:
Expand your Warcosm games with boarding actions.

This add-on provides quick-playing rules for using assault squads. Board enemy vessels and either sabotage or commandeer them, but be ready to fight off defending contingent squads. Maintaining the same game mechanics as ship to ship battles, this addendum to the Warcosm game introduces new rules for assault craft, troops, hyper-shunting, and ramming, as well as new systems like assault bays, chaff launchers, plasma bursters, and tractor emitters.

Available in both PDF and printed formats.

72242.description:
Each year, the International Bridge Racing Association selects a city with lots of bridges to host its annual Bridgetown Race. This year they have chosen Portland, Oregon USA.

Players - using bicycles, motorcycles, taxis, buses, automobiles, the street car and sometimes their own two feet - try to be the first to cross each bridge and capture its flag. Be the first to capture a flag from every bridge, and you win the race!

Each round, players arrange for transportation by placing coordinators on the transportation mode or special action of their choice. Next, the players choose a transportation mode and move their racer through the streets, trying to be the first to cross a bridge and pick up its flag. The flag is placed on the player’s Bridge Completion card and the first person to collect all eight flags wins the race.

80435.description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion, is not considered part of the Dominion family, and is not affiliated with Rio Grande Games.***




From the Developer:

"The word of God has spread throughout the realm, leading to the rise of the church, and bringing peace and salvation to the faithful. Monks search their souls for illumination, priests seek to teach the grace of God, and grand towers and cathedrals are erected in his name.

But not all choose to follow in God's light - a host of heretics, pagans, and cultists threatens to destroy the sanctity of the church, risking damnation for their dark and sacrilegious ways. But who is truly without sin? The coffers of the church swell from tithe and indulgence, crusaders war and plunder in the name of God, while the inquisition silences their enemies in a wake of terror and blood.

The choice is yours: join ranks with forces of God to spread his holy word, or risk your eternal soul for unimagined power in this fan-made expansion to Dominion!"

72244.description: The great powers of eary modern Europe strive for asendency. Playing country, action, and number cards into various types of melds allows control of a nation, and a chance to industrialize it, through such occurences as war, marriage, alliances. Victory points are awarded for taking control through various means, whoever gets the most points wins. In addition to a board with spaces for each of 15 countries, there is a custom card deck, and you'll need tokens/markers/chips: unique color for each player to show control, common set for victory points, common set of industry markers.

publishers: RDN Games division of Publibec Limited
80438.description:
User Summary:
Before starting, the players decide the number of countries to "complete" in order to win the game. To complete a country the player must obtain all all three types of cards belonging to said country. The three cards are the flag, the coat of arms, and the capital.

There are two phases of play, the "road" and the "boardwalk".

The Road:
Players roll the dice and move their peg along the road traveling through 85 countries that existed during the mid 1980's. When players land on a country, they must choose which card they think they can correctly guess. When the player guesses correctly, the player obtains said card.

The Boardwalk:
A person can only move to the boardwalk when they have the necessary number of cards. For instance, if the players agreed upon 3 countries to complete, the player must obtain 3 cards of the coat of arms, 3 of the flags, and 3 of the capitals (it doesn't matter if they are of the same country or not). During the boardwalk the players have chances to take away cards from other players and to correctly guess the remaining types of cards of the countries the player has already obtained cards for.

From the Box:
Capitals - Flags - Coat of Arms in Flags The Game

For the teen who has to learn geography!
For the adult who wants to know more!
A fun game for everyone no matter what is your knowledge about geography.
You can play easily and with fun, because, Flags The Game makes a brain without strain.

Publisher:
RDN Games division of Publibec Limited
Sorel, Quebec, Canada J3P 6K5
80438.name: Flags The Game

72251.description:
This is not a driving school, ladies and gentlemen.

We know you can all change gears, accelerate, brake, turn, pass... But that is not all there is to it. This is racing. And you're the elite of the elite.

And racing is about taking risks. About knowing when and how much to risk.

The new Compact Edition replaces the first edition and it's fully compatible with it (same rules and decks). The base game is for 2 players. Then you can purchase additional decks for more players (you need one additional cotton case to keep those extra decks). In order to make things simpler, the base game contains all eight cars and counters.

The base game (2 players) contains: pad (circuit), 2 lap markers (gray), cotton case, 8 plastic cars, 8 plastic counters, 2 decks, one plastic 'safety car' (finally!), rulebook.

With the base game you can also play Top Speed Mini.

80444.description:
Description: The city of Belfast has long been one of the few destinations that is able to cater for all interests, with its rich heritage of naval connections, lively arts, great restaurants and bars. And now you can tour this amazing city and all its famous locations with the new Belfast Monopoly! From Donegall Square to the Titanic Quarter, and from the Belfast Waterfront to the historic Parliament Buildings at Stormont, it’s all up for grabs as you race around the board building a property empire to beat your opponents!

It's Monopoly.

79626.description:
An ethnic and inappropriate 'Black Memorabilia' ball toss game from 1931 produced by All-Fair Games
The box was set up on a table top and the object was to throw a ball into the mouth or hats of a number of Black caricatures who are seen eating and standing around a large watermelon. Points were scored for landing in the targets.

80446.description:
October, 1929: The Republic is crumbling. With the death of Gustav Stresemann on October 3, 1929 and the crash of the American Stock Exchange, Germany's recovery from the devastating Great War now is in doubt. Communist, Fascist and Republican forces clash over ideology and erupt into a war of words and violence. Unemployment begins to spiral out of control while the German people grow restless. Rallies are held by charismatic leaders as lawmakers struggle to find answers. Amongst the chaos, a new figure will head the German nation.

Weimar: German Politics 1929-1933 is a two-player political game that tries to simulate the chaos of Germany prior to Hitler's appointment to chancellor. Will you take the role of the Social Democratic leadership, staving off the extreme ideologies of Communism and Fascism? Using your political influence and paramilitary forces, will you try to gain control of the Reichstag, or send Germany to the brink of anarchy? Can you change history, or is Germany doomed to repeat it?

Weimar is a block/CDG in which one side plays the SPD and the other plays the NSDAP. A third Communist force is played by both players. Players hold rallies, street fights, build alliances, and try to win the hearts and minds of the German people.

Victory can be achieved in multiple ways, with both parties being able to gain influence in each electoral area and score them in each election phase. Influence is gained by holding rallies and bringing political and paramilitary forces to both "encourage" and intimidate the German people. Alternatively for the Nazis, they can use events to increase chaos and unrest in order to bring down the weak parliamentary government. For the SPD, they can use special actions to stop the Nazi political machine, including the elimination of its leadership.

76351.description:
From the box:

1)Start from the "HOP" square and play until you reach square "STOP". Winner is the one who manages to do this first.
2) Place the six tiles with dice symbols on to the table face down and shuffle them good. Before every move turn one over and move the number of steps. Then shuffle the tiles again.
3) When you reach the red square then move according to the arrow and step to the nearest orange square.
4) When you reach the yellow square with the man figure then do the following:
walking man - walk around the room
crawling man - crawl around the room
man standing on the chair - quickly stand on the chair
sleeping man - miss a turn and take a nap
leaning forward man - lean forward 3 times
crouching man - jump like a frog
jumping man - jump 4 times up into the air

This is the first game in the series of 4 games, that make together one mega Delma game.

Delma is a product here in Estonia and Baltic. The game was made as a part of a campaign of them.
76351.name: Delma: Linnas

76352.description:
User Summary:

Bid Euchre is a variation of Euchre. Bid Euchre uses Jacks to Aces from two decks (two of each card). All cards are dealt to the players, who are on two teams of two.

Due to there being two of each card, the first card played is the high card (if the Ace of Spades is played first, it would beat the other Ace of Spades if it was played during the same round).

Unlike Euchre, where there is a turned-up card that dictates what is trump (trump being a suit that beats all other suits, with the Jack of the suit being the highest, the other like-coloured Jack being second highest, then Ace, King, Queen, 10 and 9), each player bids how many tricks he/she thinks they can take and the what they want as trump. Valid bids are suits and no trump. No trump means that there is no trump suit and Aces are the high card for each suit. Each player bids once, with the person to the left of the dealer starting and the dealer ending the bidding round. Whoever has the highest bid starts the first hand.

Play starts with the starting player playing one card face up. Following players must follow suit if they can, otherwise, they can play any card they want. High card takes the trick and dictates who starts the next hand. Play continues until all cards have been played (each player will have 8 cards).

Each team counts the number of tricks they took during the round. The team that won the bid must have at least the number of tricks they bid to score. Otherwise, they lose the number of points bid (if they bid 4 and only took 3 tricks, they lose 4 points). It is possible to have a score in the negatives. The non-bidding team scores a point for each trick they took.

Teams can bid lone hands, requiring them to take all 8 tricks. If they do, they can score extra points. If they don't they will lose those points.

After each player has dealt twice, the game is over. The team with the most points wins.
76352.name: Bid Euchre

76353.description:
"It's a Rummikub card game with a new twist."

The deck has cards with 1-7 objects in 2 colors and 3 shapes, as well as Jokers and Reverse & New Hand cards. Eight goal cards, numbered 1-8 are placed on the table, and everyone starts with a 7-card hand. In a turn, each player draws a card and discards a card. The first player to fulfill the current goal (e.g. to get all cards of the same color) takes the card for that goal, discards his hand and draws a new hand. The other players continue playing with their current hands. Once all goal cards are taken, the player with the highest total of goal cards wins.

76354.description:
From the box:

In the land far far away there are this ball where all the most beautiful princesses will gather. They all want to be the queen of the ball and they all have prepared well for this. Sadly maid have mixed all their clothe chests and taken them into the wrong rooms as well. Now the princesses need to find the clothes and get to the ball at the right time...

Content:
Board
Room walls
Spinner
50 tiles
4 pawns
Rules

The Game:

Your goal is to collect your dress elements.

At first lay out the game board. Then place the walls and tiles to the right places on the board. Place all the princesses to the start square.
Move the spinner and move your princess to the nearest square with that color. If you are on the cross roads, you can choose another path. When the spinner is stopped between the colors, you can choose the color. When you get green, you can check the tiles near you, without showing it to another players.
Without the spinner you can move one step any direction.

green tiles - this means clothes.
yellow tiles - magic wand. You can choose one tiles and look at it.
orange tiles - mirror. You love your reflection and miss a turn.
red tiles - friend. You can just take any of the tiles from the board.
purple tiles - miss a turn.

NB! After checking tile and this is clothes and not your clothes, place it back on the board - face up.

Winner - be the first to get 5 parts for your dress.
76354.name: Princeses pirms lielas balles

72259.description:
(from inside cover of game book)

Get set for a great trip across the U.S.A.! You don't have to worry about what to bring or what to wear. So don't drag out the backpacks or knapsacks, and forget about the plane, train, and bus tickets. You won't even need a driver's license. All you will need for the journey is THE ACROSS THE USA GAME book and a few playful, game-loving friends.

With this great game you'll travel from coast to coast, exploring all fifty states and discovering all sorts of interesting info about this wonderful land of ours. You'll find out about national parks and rivers, famous monuments and landmarks, prominent people, state capitals, flowers, and birds - tons of terrific trivia. When your cross-country game is finished, you will have had a fun-filled time from sea to shining sea - and what better souvenir of an unforgettable trip!

72260.description:
(from back of box)

Children will be charmed and challenged as they play this delightful counting game which combines live-action and animation.

-Puppet host Farmer Bing gives simple step-by-step directions, guiding children through three different picking sessions. After setting up the game, little or no adult assistance is required.
-10 of Farmer Bing's animal friends star in fun-filled animated sequences featuring the Farmer's toe-tapping theme song.
-Every game is unique because random play elements assure that no two games will ever play exactly the same.
-There's educational as well as entertainment value as children pick cherries, and are then shown how to count them.

72261.description:
From the box: The ultimate stock car racing trivia board game for race fans coast to coast.

Players answer stock car racing trivia questions to move off Pit Road, onto the Track and around to the Finish and Victory Lane.

72262.description:
Baseball Heroes is a two player baseball card game, designed by Luke Morris, that captures the psychological battle between pitcher and batter.

Three teams with 36 unique players line up to hit eachother out of the park! The pitching player and batting player try to psych-out eachother into striking out or throwing a bad pitch to be hammered away for a home run.

Baseball Heroes is a light game but includes rules for outfield and infield fielding, dropped catches, bunts, base stealing, double plays, errors, runs, balls, strikes, bullpens and more. Each batter has his strengths and weaknesses and each pitcher has his list of balls he can pitch.

Baseball Heroes is also available with full Japanese rules.

76359.description:
From the game rules:

TIVOLI GAME
Game idea
Welcome to Tivoli! Here you can enjoy yourself at all the famous attractions. Take the train on wheels, show your skills on the range, try your luck at the wheel of fortune, drive bumper cars and take a trip to the carousel or roller coaster. But you do not forget haunted house! Here, although unpleasant things happen, but because you have to visit all attractions, you have no choice.
It must also be fast and have luck with dice and cards carnival. Winner is the player who, after visiting all the attractions, first go through the whole Tivoli.

Game contains:
1 game board
6 tokens
1 dice
48 carnival cards (8 of each color)
96 Event cards

Preparation
Each player must equip itself with a checker and 8 carnival cards of the same color. The cards are mixed and put into a pile, face down, in front of each player.
For each attraction (other than the shooting range and wheel of fortune) each event includes 16 cards. These are, face down, in the box at each attraction. Game pieces are placed at TIVOLI input. Then turn each of the top amusement park in his card and place it, face up, in front of him. The card talks about the attraction which he / she must first go.Till finally determined who to start (eg, the youngest player).

The game
The player who is next in line to hit the dice and move their game piece as many steps as the die shows. When the player comes to the entrance (marked with red arrow) to move the right attraction is finished, even if the dice show more. The next time it is his turn, he / she go into. The wagons, radio, cars, ghosts, etc. serves as a playground. In each attraction (other than the shooting range and wheel of fortune) are two or three games box whose color is different from the others in attracting. Ports of one player in such a field, he / she take an event card and follow the instructions. The card is then back bottom of the pile (not freebies).
(When two or more players are on the same attraction as follows: It is not allowed to be lost or end up on the same playing field as a front current players. It means that behind the present author can not always use all their dice dots the movement.
This rule does not apply if a player receives an event card which gives an extra roll or extra step forward, which means that he / she can catch up or overtake.
A player who is emerging from an attraction to turn the next card in his amusement park high in order to know where he / she was then attending. (You do not stop. On the blue arrow that marks the end). They use carnival cards must always be available, with the front up, front of the player.
A player who visited all the attractions to be as fast as possible to get to the end.


Freebies
Part of the event cards are free tickets. One player who receives such a card will keep it indefinitely. Anyone who has a freebie do not follow an instruction in an event card if he / she does not want. It might include whether to stand over a roll of the dice or move back to their game play. A free ticket can be used in all sites, regardless of where it was. However it only once, and when it is used on the bottom back in its rightful high.

Shooting range and wheel of fortune
At these sites there are no games or field events. One player who will be visiting the shooting range or wheel of fortune must normally stay on the red arrow, even if the dice show more. The next time it is his turn, he must be better than a five or six (the highest score on the range) and first or second (lucky for wheel of fortune) to move their gamespiece to the blue arrow and turn over a new carnival cards.

Extras casting
On the 'three game fields are images even dice. A gamer that end up on any of these fields will have an additional roll.

Winner
The player who, after having visited all attractions, first go through Tivoli will win the game

72265.description:
User Summary:

Song of Armies and Hordes is a fantasy mass combat miniatures system from Ganesha Games, following in the footsteps of its successful fantasy skirmish miniatures system, Song of Blades and Heroes. Song of Armies and Hordes allows players to enact large-scale fantasy battles with 15mm or 25/28mm miniatures, with some similarities (such as Quality and Combat Ratings) to the skirmish rules.

Although the game is not yet released, here is a link to a preview of the Army Builder.

76362.description:
In Celtic Challenge, players want to remove as many tiles from the game board as possible.

To set up the game, turn the 45 tiles face-down, shuffle them, then arrange 25 of them in a 5x5 grid on the game board; add a 4x4 grid of tiles on top of these, then reveal the final four tiles and place them on the 4x4 grid. (See this image as an example.)

Players alternate play over the game's six rounds. In a round, a player chooses one of the five symbols, scores all face-up tile(s) showing this symbol, then reveals any tiles with a free edge that are now completely uncovered due to the removal of one or more tiles. Any tiles showing the chosen symbol are also scored and removed from the board. This process continues until no more symbols of that type can be scored. (Some tiles bear two symbols, and they are scored if either symbol is collected.) The player who has removed the most tiles after six rounds wins.

In the solitaire game, the solver goes through all six rounds, trying to leave as few tiles as possible.

72267.description:
Railways of the Western U.S. is an expansion for Railways of the World. Designed by Rick Holzgrafe, this expansion map uses the score track, pieces, tiles, money, trains, bonds and rules of the original game, but comes with a new map, featuring the Western half of the United States. The basic mechanics and gameplay of the original game are unchanged, as players build track and deliver goods to increase their income and earn points, but the expansion also includes new pieces and rules. These extras may optionally be used with this expansion as well as with the base game and all other expansions.

This expansion is also compatible with Railroad Tycoon.

72268.description:
Railways Through Time is an expansion for Railways of the World. It requires the pieces, tiles, money, trains, bonds, and rules of the original game, but comes with an innovative board that takes the Railways of the World family in a whole new direction by introducing a third dimension: time.

This rules of this new expansion follow the basic gameplay and pick-up and deliver mechanism of the Railways of the World series but introduce the idea of time travel between different eras.

A similar concept was released as an expansion for Age of Steam, called Age of Steam Expansion: Time Traveler.

72269.description:
"Toscana is an exciting game set in the competitive world of wine. You are the proud owner of a winery in Tuscany. You run its daily business: you hire workers, hold winetastings, make wine and trade it at the local Wine Stock Market. Indeed you will need a keen nose for business to cash big and become the favorite of the high-class wine circles. Toscana is a light, well-aged strategy game and tastes best when enjoyed among friends."

Toscana is a game with short and clear rules, but with considerable depth of play and minimal random elements - so it suits gamers and non-gamers alike. It is a unique combination of stock market and area control, and the game introduces some good and trusted mechanics in a new blend.

The game is played in rounds. Every round each player has 3 available actions: Hiring, Winemaking, and Trading. Players perform actions in turn, and the order in which they perform them has consequences.
In the Hiring-action, the player hires a winemaker or a winemaster who can make wine, and he can hire the Lobbyist or Mr. Rosé who can influence the market place. In the winemaking-action the player makes wine and in the Trading-action he buys or sells it at the Wine Stock Market. The player with the most money in the end wins.
Simple rules, simple structure, but loaded with tricky choices and difficult decisions.

CONTENTS:
- 1 gameboard
- (8 map pieces to optionally create a random map)
- 4 lobbying tiles
- 5 price markers

Boxes (cubes) of:
- 15 red wine, white wine, champagne, rosé
- 20 water

In each 5 player colors:
- 1 winery board
- 4 action coins
- 5 workers
- 3 winemasters
- 7 winetasting tiles

80462.description:
Back of box: Things are going haywire in the toy factory! It's up to you to move your toys safely along the conveyor belt and into the gift box. But watch out for the other toymakers. They'll try to squish your toys or send them off the track! The race is on to see whose toys will make it to the gift box first!

Players mold different color play doh into their game pieces. There are 4 different molds and 4 different colors of play doh. They then spin a spinner and have a choice of 3 actions: Moving along the board, truning the crank mechanism (to make the pieces turn around...either making them closer or further to the goal) or to "recycle" an apponent's game piece by squising it. The player who gets 2 of their game pieces into the gift box first is declared the winner.
80462.name: Play-Doh Spielzeugfabrik

80013.description:
The Elusive One
(4/2) (Goodies 2005-2006)


For 0 AP, at the end of an opponent's action, and only once during an opponent's turn, the Elusive One can move one square.



The square does not need to be a normal floor square, but must be valid (like water, or a pit trap if the Elusive One has a rope).



Blue, yellow, red and green (3/4players)
80013.name: Dungeon Twister: Insaisissable

72276.description: A trivia game about the municipality of Reykjanesbær in Iceland. The questions come in three levels of difficulty making this an easier game for younger / less knowledgable players than many trivia games.

72279.description:
An abstract wargame from 1780!

Also known as "Hellwigs Kriegsspiel" (Hellwigs Wargame) or "Braunschweiger Kriegsspiel" (Brunswick Wargame).

It's an attempt to recreate 18th century warfare through an chess-like approach.

Mainly it was made for military education and entertainment.
The main goal is to capture the enemy fortress.
Players have Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery to obtain their task.
One unit represents a battalion.
The movement of the pieces and combat is similar to chess.
The game is played on a board with 1617 squares depicting terrain like towns, marshes and rivers.
72279.name: Braunschweiger Kriegsspiel

80472.description:
Valeur et Discipline is a set of rules for napoleonic wargaming with figurines al scale 1/100 or 15 mm. It's ideal for play al Corps level and with multiple players.

(From the introduction)
The players in each turn first give orders at his units, after the units are activated and declare "charge" (the enemy can react) and move (the enmey again can react or make defensive fire). The combat phase is common, with artillery fire, musket fire and melee, and ending with the moral checks.
The object of the game is to desmoralize or rout the enemy formations when they reach a determined level of losses.

80473.description:
Expansion kit for The Truckers 1st edition user.
Thus please see description of the original game about game-play and goal.

You should replace the original map with this new map.
Rules are revised and tuned-up 1st edition into high spec more enjoyable game!

components
1 new map board
1 round marker
5 order markers
1 new rule sheet

Main changing

Enhanced player-interaction with scrambling containers
Truck-introducing rule changed more flexible
Reduced disadvantage of First Player
Forbidden Negotiation
The game will end after 2nd player reached the goal, not 1st player.
Simplified and some adding of Scoring
Introduced Score Track around the game board
80473.name: The Truckers version 1.5 tune-up kit

80474.description:
There are many types of people who arrive at a bus stop waiting to get on a bus; babies,kids, high school girls, working men, seniors and ETs(the Extra-Terrestrials). In this game it is your job to get the same type of people on to one of your buses, and to make sure your bus is full before taking them to their destinations. If you have more kinds of people than you have buses you will have to make some of them wait at the bus stop for another bus to come. If the game ends and you still have passengers waiting for a bus, you create unhappy customers and you receive negative Victory Points.

This is the new version of card game Busstop.
Cards changed into tiles, main board and player boards.
A new kind of passenger called baby introduced.
And several rules are changed.
80474.name: Busstop: The Boardgame

72285.description:
TOTEMO - A colourful, 3D building game for Braves, Squaws and Papooses from Surprised Stare Games (Summer, 2010)

Players place custom-designed blocks into a restricted playing area to construct Totem Poles, for which they score victory points.

Blocks must be placed according to their colour, and the colours of the blocks they may touch in three dimensions - for example, a purple block may be placed on its own OR adjacent to purple, red or blue blocks. The more blocks it touches, the higher your score for placing.

Bonus placements (and scoring) are possible if you land exactly on special spaces on the score track (these spaces are randomly determined at the start of the game).

Totemo is bright, colourful, tactile and heap big fun!

(Source: Surprised Stare Games Ltd)

72286.description: A game of starship-based combat and exploration with a variable board of planets and empty space. Mission, event, equipment and personnel cards are dealt to the planets, and players use their starcraft to travel amongst them, executing missions for the currency used to purchase upgrades to ship and crew, and to earn Fame points. Game is won when a certain amount of Fame points are collected.

72287.description:
From Bruno Faidutti's site:

It has been found again by Bruno Cathala and Ludovic Maublanc with Mr.Jack Pocket, the small card game derived from Mr. Jack. The board is replaced by a square grid made of nine street cards. The suspects, and among them Mr.Jack, are pictured on the cards. Holmes, Watson and a dog are turning around the grid, a system already used by Bruno Cathala in several games, and can “look” at the streets in a row or column. Every round, like in Mr.Jack, four actions are available. The first player selects one, his opponent two, and the first player then uses the last remaining action. Actions allow moving a detective one or two spaces clockwise around the grid, turning a card in order to change the view of the streets, swapping two street cards or drawing an alibi card. At the end of the round, Mr.Jack states if he can be seen by one of the detectives. Of course, the detectives must identify Jack, who must stay hidden long enough to escape.

72290.description:
Gasp! is a chaotic, extremely interactive trick-taking game for the Basic Decktet, a handful of its suited tokens and 2-5 players. Players are likely to gasp in astonishment as they watch their fortunes change with alarming frequency and rapidity.

One token in the reigning suit is awarded after each hand and the winner will be the first player to acquire 2 tokens in each of the Decktet’s 6 suits.

72291.description:
Forest Wars of the Haven is a fantasy wargame based on the novel The Haven (later revised as Forest Wars) by Graham Diamond, the co-designer. The game depicts an assault by the Forces of Man (also called the Forces of the Haven), consisting of humans, wolves, hawks, and eagles, on the camp of the Forest Lords, who control dogs and bats.

The gameplay will be familiar to anyone who has played a grand tactical wargame. The system is fairly standard for the period, with some special rules for air support, charging units, and units which can be hidden or have variable loyalty.

80484.description:
The game has been updated by Dr. Tom Cline and redesigned for accuracy and enjoyment! The game comes with 20 All-time great golfers along with the DC Metro Golf Course (Congressional).

The course has been painstakingly designed for the utmost accuracy and depiction. Like all of our updated games, the instructions and boards are combined in a handy spiral bound 7 1/2" x 10" booklet. The course comes in its own booklet! The course booklet is roughly the size of the Baseball and Football Master Game booklets. Also, we've printed the course holes on a coated stock that allows us to eliminate the use of the old golf markers. Now you can mark your holes with a fine tip wipe marker (included) with its own eraser! That's right no more bumping the table and accidentally moving the markers.

The current add-on courses available from APBA are Magnolia (Augusta National), Badger Links (Whistling Straits) and NY Empire State (Bethpage Black).

72806.description:
Colorswap is based on a juggling notation called siteswap.

Goal: Get all of your pieces including the cube into different columns and onto different colors. The cube must be played in the far right column (I)

Setup: Each player has a board and 8 pieces. There is also 1 cube sitting between all of the players. On your turn place a piece on your board in any row as far left as available. All other players immediately place a piece on their own board in the same place. When all 8 pieces are played the puzzle solving begins.

Solving the Puzzle and Scoring Points: Pieces may be moved left and right, but not up or down. The very last column on the right (I) is reserved for the cube. Once a player has all of their pieces in different columns from A-H, simultaniously on different colors and are the first to grab the cube and place it onto the missing color they score a point.

Negative Points: Players who grab the cube before finishing the puzzle get a negative point. Players can also get a negative point by grabbing the cube and finding that their answer is actually not correct.

72294.description:
Traffic Jam - A zany gridlock game of limited strategy and outrageous bumping and blocking fun.
If you can avoid the patrolling policement and dodge your fellow drivers you have a chance of winning the game. It sounds easy... but players become ruthless as the intersection grows more more congested. One minuted you may be on the verge of winning and the next ... your card is bumped back to the start.
(Back of box)

72295.description:
La Porxada is a historical building in the town of Granollers. It was built in mid-16th century by order of the town council. At that time it was a cattle market and a place to trade agricultural commodities.

Carcassonne - La Porxada is a very-very-very little and unofficial expansion for the game Carcassone (only 1 tile!); designed by Klaus-Jürgen Wrede and Oriol Comas i Coma.

It was available for those who took part in the Jugarxjugar'2010 Fair in Granollers.

72298.description:
(from VaeVictis website:)

On his way to the Holy Land, Richard Coeur de Lion (the Lionheart) arrived at Cyprus. The ruler of the island, Isaac Dukas Comnenus, tried unsuccessfully to repel the Crusaders’ landing before falling back to Nicosia to regroup his forces. Once assured of the safety of his fleet, Richard set off into the interior of the island. Isaac marched against him, hoping to confront him in a vast plain favorable to the maneuvers of the redoubtable Byzantine cavalry. The clash occurred near the village of Tremithousa on May 21, 1191. The cavalry charges were horrendous and for a time the issue was in doubt, but the Anglo-Normans’ heavy knights finally prevailed. Isaac was captured, and this caused the Greeks to rout. Richard, now in control of Cyprus, could resume his journey to the Holy Land.
He joined Philip Augustus at Saint Jean d’Acre, which fell on July 12. When Philip returned to France, Richard gained sole command of the Crusader army. He marched south with the intention of liberating Jerusalem, but on September 7, 1194, Saladin attacked the Christians as they made their way down the coast. Showered with arrows, the Hospitaliers launched a premature charge, forcing Richard to give the signal for a general attack. After a violent counterattack, Saladin’s troops were finally vanquished by one last charge of the Crusaders. Richard the Lionheart soon reconquered the coastlands, after which he negotiated an agreement with Saladin which allowed pilgrims free access to Jerusalem.

Tremithousa and Arsuf 1191 are the 31st and 32nd battles of the series Au fil de l’épée / By the Edge of the Sword, launched in issue 26 of the magazine Vae Victis. The game includes two battles won by Richard the Lionheart during the course of the Third Crusade, the first battle being fought on Cyprus against Isaac Comnenus and the second in the Holy Land against Saladin.

Le Lion et l'Epée / The Lion & the Sword includes :

two 59 x 40 cm maps (one sheet backprinted),
216 double-sided die-cut counters and markers,
rules and scenarios booklet
player-aid card in color.




Units : 1 strength point per 100 combatants
Map scale : 250 m/hex.
Turn : 30 minutes
Complexity : 6/9


Battles: Tremetousia (Cyprus, May 21 1191) and Arsuf (Holy Land, September 7 1191).
72298.name: The Lion and the Sword

72302.description:
A simple roll and move game, in which you get questions about the difference between being a follower of the Nazi Party or the Swedish Democrats.

Published in Faktum #95.

72304.description:
"From crooks (sharks) to friends (dingos)...As you pick up Character cards, you will eyeball some truly bewildering and at times downright embarrassing dilemmas cut from the deck of life and complemented by true blue Aussie trivia. The exercise may make you blush, call for help or glaze over like a stunned mullet - but it's all about having a point of view, not letting life go through to the keeper."
To win this board game you must be the first player to collect a diploma from each of the four courses an have accumulated 10 character points.
72304.name: Max Walker's Take It To The Max Board Game

72808.description:
A body was found in the picturesque mountain village. Players try to guess the murderer and the motive behind the murder as well, as completing their own tasks (see below).

During the game players "bet" on the characteristics of the murderer. In their turn, they play an action that allows them to give a suspect an alibi. Some alibis can be made invalid through other actions. Its also possible to lower or rise the chances of a suspect being the murderer. It does also contain an deduction element, because the clues that identify the murder cannot be changed. Finding out the clues that are in the game is vital. In the end one of the clues in the game will be drawn to identify the murderer.

The game also contains a take-that element: Players can hinder the player taking his turn by giving him a task that he is obliged to fulfill instead of taking his turn, or risk negative points.

In the end, players score positive points for the correct suspect, motivation and clues and negative points for the unfulfilled private tasks.
72808.name: Saustall

76402.description:
Golf Strategy 2008
“Golf Strategy 2008” is a game of golf and is similar to golf in every detail.
“Golf Strategy 2008” is a game of skill and luck that requires the player to choose
strategies more effective for him to get the best score.
You can play “Golf Strategy 2008” alone, in pairs or more players to organize real golf
tournaments.
The proper use of the instruments inside the packaging of “Golf Strategy 2008” makes the
game brilliant and charming.
Enjoy yourself.
The pack of “Golf Strategy 2008” contains:
– 18 floor plans of many holes, color and scale, laminated
– 3 rulers meters distance and direction; 1 for par 3, 1 for par 4, 1 for par 5, in transparent
plastic silkscreen.
– 11 dices
– 1 pen
– An eraser
– A dash board – based game that contains dices and floor plans of holes.

GENERAL RULES
To play alone, in two, three or four. You can play in pairs or teams of four players and
organize real tournaments. The player, or team, wins the game playing fewer strokes like
real golf.
How to play the hole.
1 – Draw with the pen a mark on the green where you want.
2 – Divide the green in three areas, using the pen
3 – If you play in two or more players draw the order of play.
4 – Playing is simple
a) choose the ruler meters corresponding to par the hole.
example: par 4, ruler meters 4
b) set what tee color you will start from all 18 holes
(indicator blue, white, yellow, black, red).
c) The player who will start first must use the ruler to measure the distance and
direction, matching the hole corresponding to 0 (meters).
The ruler meters can be moved on the course as you prepare.
The player chooses the distance.
Each distance shown on the ruler is equivalent to golf clubs distance.
The ruler cannot be moved.
d) At this point the player will launch simultaneously the three dices “SHOT”
indicated on the dashboard and read the result.
The player will find the hole on the ruler to be marked with the pen.(Extract from the rules)

80499.description:
In this Goodies 2007: Bonus Objects

You will find,

2 Cursed trunks
1 Ring
1 Ring of weakness
1 Ring of repulsion
1 Teleportation ring
1 Anti-magic ring
1 Jade mask
In gold color!
4 Elven Bows (B/Y/R/G color)!

The rules ares in Dungeon Twister site (.org).
80499.name: Dungeon Twister: Bonus Objects

72309.description:
Warlocks of the Dark Star is a strategic space wargame pitting the eponymous Warlocks against a group called the Technoids or Techlongs (the rules use both names). The Technoids, as suggested by their name, use technology, while the Warlocks use magic.

The basic system is not especially complicated but there is a fair amount of chrome. For example, the Warlock player receives magic points which can be used to build new units and create effects (such as moving a star system). The Technoid player can't create new units but can scavenge the wrecks of old ones.

At the start of the game, the Warlock player chooses an alien race to play (some of which have special powers) and chooses a home system and colonies, along with a decoy race; all of this information is kept secret. The object of the game for the Technoid player is to find and destroy the Warlocks' systems.

This game should not be confused with Warriors of the Dark Star: The Age of the Neutron Wars.

72310.description:
The object of ‘Tradewinds’ is to earn victory points by controlling valuable trade routes. As colonists develop the local infrastructure, many islands will experience an economic boom. Before that happens, dominate the exports of an island by investing there more heavily than others...but the value of those exports depends on the population demanding the products, and how well funded they are. Of course, not all would-be colonists are particularly loyal subjects: make sure to deposit enemy sympathizers and other undesirables where they can do little harm.

(rulebook overview)

80503.description:
As DEXTER, travel through the streets of Miami trying to hunt down a suspect that has slipped through the cracks of the justice system and make them your next victim.

Keep your day job by completing Blood Spatter Reports to avoid any suspicion and reap the rewards of a job well done. In the meantime, try to avoid your opponents, who will expose you, the first chance that they get.

Once you have found your suspect and have collected the Tools that you need, you must head over to the Marina to get rid of the evidence and win the game.

Strategic game play, loads of fun….if you’re a fan of DEXTER, this game is a must have.

Components: Game Board, Playing Pawns, Six-Sided Die, Cards, Suspect Tokens, Tool Tokens, Mini Garbage Bags.

Playing Time: 2 Players (30-45 minutes), 3-4 Players (45-75 minutes). .

Features: Ages 17+, 2-4 Players.

72312.description:
description provided by designer

Essentially, an asymmetric square 'Hex'.

The board is an nxn square grid (19×19 is probably a good start) Two opposite edges are designated white goals, and the other two are black goals. Corners count as part of both edges. Each player's objective is to connect their two goal edges with an unbroken chain of their stones. White (O) stones may use both orthogonal and diagonal connections to complete their chain, while black (+) stones may only use orthogonal connections. However, black places three stones on each of their turns, while white places only two. White moves first, then turns alternate. If there are not enough spaces remaining to place all of a player's stones for their turn, place as many as possible. Play ends when the victorious player completes a valid connection. Draws should not occur.

Any serious two-player abstract requires a great many playtests before being deemed 'unbreakable', so I consider this to be a beta version. Though its name (and possibly some minor points of the rules) are still subject to change, please feel free to implement it for online/AI play (given proper attribution).

publishers: The United States Playing Card Company
72313.description:
From the rule book:

"How to Play: Each player is dealt 25 cards by the dealer. Cards are placed one-at-a-time in an empty slot in the card tray to make 10 poker hands, five across and five deep. Once placed, that cards cannot be moved. When each player has filled his/her card tray, players bet on each of the ten hands to win points."

The winner is the first player to score 100 points.

72320.description:
Gêm fwrdd hwyliog ar gyfer rhwng dau a chwe chwaraewr yn gofyn i chwaraewr deithio o gwmpas maes yr Eisteddfod Genedlaethol yn osgoi rhwystrau di-ri cyn dychwelyd i'w gar o flaen ei wrthwynebwyr, yn cynnwys cyfarwyddiadau llawn, bwrdd chwarae, cardiau, cwestiynau, dis a chownteri; i blant ac oedolion.

A lively board game for two to six players requiring a player to circuit the National Eisteddfod field avoiding many hindrances and returning to his car before his rivals, comprising full instructions, a playing board, question cards, dice and counters; for children and adults alike. (www.gwales.com)

For those who don't know the National Eisteddfod is the largest travelling arts festival in Europe, the game attempts to recreate a visit to the Eisteddfod avoiding unpopular relatives, achieving goals, etc. Particularly poigniant to those who have spent any time on the "Maes".

76417.description:
Two to five players act as leaders of different peoples and command them to explore, send out fleets, build trading posts, and generate the highest possible profit. Poseidon contains most of the basics of 18xx games and due to the relatively short running time of two hours is as suitable for 18xx-newbies who want to explore this wonderful world as it is for experienced train gamers.

The 18xx basics included are:
1) Instead of running a corporation, players control a country/people
2) The goal of the game is personal wealth, the wealthiest player at game end is the winner
3) Players create trade routes similar to railway lines in 18xx games
4) Trains are replaced with common modes of transportation at the time (i.e. ships) with varying types
5) 18xx type stations are replaced with trading posts

Game Contents: game board, eight "possession sheets", play money, lots of wood pieces, cards, 1 rule book

72322.description:
From the publishers website:

The Silent Forge is the third Battle Pack in The Enemy Cycle for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game. It includes three copies each of 20 cards, designed to expand and enhance the Warhammer: Invasion deck-building experience. Including powerful neutral cards like The Marauding Giant and Battle Pilgrims, as well as formidable new units for all six factions, The Silent Forge is a must-have for fans of the kingdoms, quests, and epic battles of Warhammer: Invasion.

What’s more, The Silent Forge includes a short story by J.R. Godwin, helpful for immersing fans and newcomers alike into the grim and perilous setting of Warhammer’s Old World. New information has led an intrepid band of High Elves to one of the Dark Elves’ secret forges. Now they have the chance to eliminate the source of some of the most powerful weapons of their long hated rivals.

CONTAINS CARDS 41-60 of "THE ENEMY CYCLE."
72322.name: Warhammer: Invasion – Die Stumme Schmiede

72329.description:
From the back of the book:

To Battle! To Glory! To Song!

The trumpet is sounding "To Arms! To Arms!"
and heartfelt the anthem prolong!
Oh, gather the Catrawd and let them go forth!
To Battle! To Glory! To Song!

The Long War has entered a new phase. Decisive battles are now won by a handful of rhyflers fighting for freedom, king, or home. Based on "Flying Lead" and "Song of Blades and Heroes," this book provides rules for fighting smaller skirmish actions between the might of Alykinder's Crusade, the strength of Coftyran Crymuster, and the elusive Partisans of Elghmore. Gather your rhyflers, fight for your cause, and join your squad and sing the

Songs of Our Ancestors!

This book is a 110 page soft cover featuring rules for small unit action (5-10 models per player) miniatures war game set in the same world as This Quar's War featuring technology that parallels WWI. Relatively fast paced. Uses only D6 dice.

76427.description:
A Chance of Ruination (or "How Demedotte Got Sand in His Eye") is a scenario for the black-powder fantasy wargame; Flintloque Reloaded.

It about the Elves and their Allies battles the Othari in Aegypt.

The scenario has also some additional rules for the Othari.

It was avaliable as a web page, but now it only avilable as a free PDF from Alternative Armies.

72332.description:
Players each have a stack of cards, each card with 3 ducks of the same color, each with 2 of the 3 ducks having a hole in the center of their body. The game board has large colored circles, the same colors of the ducks. The object of the game is to be the first to lay down all your cards, by placing them on the game board so that the ducks with holes match the circles on the board.

Each player always has two cards face up to be seen by all, so opportunities for strategy occur by placing the ducks (vertically, horizontally, right-side up, upside-down) to block opponents. Also, if a card cannot be placed, one from the board is removed, thoughtfully, so that the played is helped on his next turn, but not the opponent.

Contents:
1 playing board
28 cards in 4 colors

76429.description:
The Othai of Aegypt is a free sourcebook for the fantasy wargames of Slaughterloo and Flintloque.

It contants the background and rules for the Otharmann Empire of the Fourth Age of Valon.

It was originaly a free "Rank and Style" flyer from Alternative Armies mail order, but was improved (Flintloque rules was added) and was relesed as a free PDF.

72335.description:
A reaction game for children. The crocodile is hungry and tries to catch the frog; the frogs try to flee when the crocodile gets activated.

One player is the crocodile player and turns over cards with various animals. When an awake and hungry crocodile shows up, the crocodile player hits the button to close the big mouth, and the other players hit their buttons to make their frogs jump away. If your frog gets catched, you get a bite marker; there are also penalties for trying to flee at the wrong moment (for example at the sleeping crocodile card).

A player with 5 bite markers is out of the game. Last frog player wins; the crocodile player can't win.

According to the box cover, the game needs 2 batteries. They are only necessary for the voice output, not for the mechanic.
72335.name: Croco' Gourmand: Krokodil Knabbel

72336.description:
DragonElves was a short lived foray into developing an E-card game by Fast Forward Enterprises in 2000. This was an unusual design in that players could design and customize their cards and then print out the decks themselves.

Gameplay is a mix of standard CCG cardplay and some aspects of a wargame. DragonElves depicts the battle between the armies of the DragonElves and the BronzeMen.Players arrange their armies in 4 columns and striving to eliminate the units in the enemy ranks by direct combat and boosting attacks by playing various effect cards over a 4-Phase skirmish turn. Players attempt to better their opponents attacks with spells and skills, then augmented by a random draw.

As characters are eliminated then new warriors are exposed to attack until one side or the other has been totally wiped out.

72339.description: Jacked In is a solo game in which you send your digital avatar through cyberspace to hack the protected data node of the evil company known as ToxiCorp. As your avatar moves through the matrix it will encounter data nodes with useful programming code but decrypting the necessary passwords can be time consuming and time is not on your side. Almost at once, ToxiCorp's intrusion countermeasure electronics (ICE) will sense your avatar's presence and begin to zero in on its location. If the ICE captures your avatar then that you've got a backup to give you a second chance. You must make it to the ToxiCorp Node and decipher the final password to succeed.

76436.description:
Avalon Hill's (AH) Bismarck 1979/80 edition, designed by Jack Greene, is a totally different game from the AH 1962 edition designed by Lindsley Schutz and Charles Roberts.

The game centered around the hunt for the KMS Bismarck and the KMS Prinz Eugen in mid-1941. The game has some similarities to game Battleship, with both players having a hidden map-board and calling out coordinates to locate their opponent.

There are two players, German and British. The British player has the arduous task of placing the large number of Royal Navy vessels and search aircraft on his map-board before game play begins. Each map-board is on a grid, with letters on one axis, and numbers on the other. Each Royal Navy unit has a historically accurate starting point. The German setup takes but a moment, since the Germans have only a few bomber units and the task force with Bismarck and Prinz Eugen to place on their map.

Each turn, the players move their respective units (cardboard counters), searching for enemy units, and possibly engaging in combat. In the vast spaces of the Bering Sea and North Atlantic, the search phase becomes vital. Each player calls out grid coordinates containing a ship or aircraft, and the opponent indicates whether a ship is located there, and if so what type. A player may choose not to search with a particular unit, thus keeping its location secret (common tactic for German player, obviously). Since the Bismarck is the only enemy Battleship on the map, British discovery of her is key to victory. As the British are unlikely to have a force sufficient to sink the Bismarck when they initially find her, they will need to "shadow" the mighty vessel. A fast unit, such as the Heavy Cruiser Suffolk, is able to keep up with Bismarck and follow her on radar without engaging in combat.

Eventually, British heavy units, such as the Battlecruiser Hood may be vectored into the same square as the German Task Force. At this point combat ensues. The British also have air units on the Aircraft Carriers Victorious and Ark Royal which can both search for the Germans and attack with torpedoes from a distance. The game has combat damage sheets with squares representing areas of each warship that can be damaged in combat. As combat is resolved, squares are checked off.

The Germans win by avoiding contact with the British, successfully "breaking out" into the Atlantic and ravaging merchant shipping there. They can also achieve victory by destroying any opposition they encounter and making their way to a friendly port in occupied France. Historically, either scenario would have grave consequences for the Battle of the Atlantic. The British have a tougher task, needing to intercept and destroy the Germans. Since most British vessels are no match for Bismarck, it is necessary to vector several vessels currently on convoy escort duties in the area to form a powerful task force. Poor planning by the British or clever moves by the Germans allow Bismarck to slip through.

The advanced rules of the game implement a weather system, combat using a miniatures-type system (with ship counters laid out on the floor), realistic damage to ships, etc. Alternate "what if" scenarios and ships are provided, such as the German Aircraft Carrier Graf Zeppelin, breakout with the Tirpitz and others. U-boats are also represented (albeit in an abstract way) in the Advanced game.

Second edition changes included:

the square grid on the original map was replaced with a hexagonal brick grid overlay;
the single Bismarck ship unit was replaced by multiple German ships;
the relatively simple search, movement and combat systems of the original were replaced by much more complex rules. (Indeed, many considered the rules changes ponderous and detrimental to gameplay.)
packaging was modified, second edition coming in a smaller, standard-sized AH flat box (compared to the over-sized box of the first edition) and having alternative cover artwork.

72341.description:
The pdf. file containing the complete rules and game components can be found at:

World Turtle Games

Here is a brief description:

Rakentaa is a new and unexplored set of islands. You represent a group of explorers who have been sent out by your King to find new lands and wealth for his Kingdom. Players build castles and structures in a race to dominate the landscape. Victory is obtained once your people have garnered enough resources to bribe the King into letting you keep the land for yourselves.

76438.description:
"Partner up with a keen and clever horse. A variety of challenging jumps await. The exciting Perfect Stride horse game starts now! You and up to three competitors play skilled riders. Be ready for the unexpected -- sometimes lucky events occur and sometimes trouble comes your way. Collect the most ribbons to win the game!"

The jump course, made up of up to 10 jumps or obstacles is determined by randomly placing (face down) up to 10 Jump cards in a row. The game contains a total of 20 Jump so chances are, your course will be different every time you play.

In Perfect Stride, game play occurs in two phases.
During the "Set the Pace" phase, all players secretly choose the speed at which they move their horse and simultaneously reveal that speed. This determines the order in which the players will attempt the upcoming jump and how many Skill cards they are allowed to draw. Skill cards will be used during the "Jump" phase to successfully clear the newly revealed jump ahead. Rider Jump Order may also affect the outcome of other events which will occur. The rider in the lead receives the Lead Rider Token and jumps first and can gain bonus points for keeping the lead BUT the faster you ride, the fewer Skill cards you draw. The lead rider also reveals the next jump during the next game phase.

Players then draw their Skill cards and the Jump Phase begins. Each rider in Rider Jump Order, makes an attempt to successfully clear the jump ahead by playing skill cards and activating special card functions. In addition, unknown events will occur (from the Event card deck) which will affect a riders attempt. Those that successfully clear the jump win Ribbon Points. The order in which riders clear the jump determines how many ribbon points they win. The Lead Rider Token may change hands many times during the Jump phase and the rider who is in the lead at the end of the Jump phase will gain bonus ribbons.

Perfect Stride is a game with many levels of strategy with just the right amount of luck blended in. How fast should I ride? Who is in the lead? Should I sacrifice my draw to get ahead of other Riders? Should I save specific Skill cards to use later on? When should I take the lead from another rider? Perfect Stride is a game you will want to play again and again.

Included in the game is a beautifully illustrated 95-card deck, 54 Ribbon Point Cards, 16 Pace Cards, a Lead Rider token and Rulebook.

76442.description: Those Pesky Humans game turns the tables and lets you play the role of the Monsters who are fighting off the annoying Humans who keep invading your dungeon. This game is playable against one or a team of your "friends". It is highly re-playable due to the variable dungeon tile design and the variety of Avatars and abilities you may choose to play with each game. Mechanics are kept very simple to keep the pace of the game moving quickly.

72347.description:
From the introduction and website

Each player is a Norse god that will control various viking kingdoms which will evolve and change thought the passage of time. After a while, new kingdoms will invade the land to destroy the older kingdoms. This process will continue until all the kingdoms evolve enough to unite themselves as one nation.

Players must try to do their best out of each civilization in order to win. They accumulate glory points every turn for each city they control and they can acquire trophies which will make them score extra points. There are three kinds of trophies, when two of them are depleted, the game ends. The player who accumulated the most glory points wins.

72348.description:
Willi the Word Whale plunges the players into the depths of the sea and bring his word friend the octopus with him to blow letters. Unfortunately he has forgotten the vowels. Can you allocate the appropriate vowels so that meaningful words arise?

Gameplay: The 36 cards are dealt to the players, the players divide the cards into two stacks - backside up. The first player reveals the two cards simultaneously and place them on the middle of the table -the players then try to form words from the letters on the card by inserting vowels. The first to form a word wins a card. If one of the cards shows a golden ring the players try to be first to shout "Ahoy", the next time a golden ring card is revealed you should shout Ehoy!, then Ihoy!, then Ohoy! and then Uhoy! When all cards are revealed and distributed, the game is over. The player with the most cards is the winner.

72349.description:
YOU are the top-ranked military leader of a strange and warlike alien race - one that could have come straight out of a 1950's sci-fi movie. For reasons better explained in the movie, you have been ordered to conquer the people of the planet Earth. As Supreme Commander of the Terrestrial Invasion Forces, CAN YOU CONQUER THE CAPITALS OF EARTH AND RETURN TO YOUR HOMEWORLD IN VICTORY?

Alien: Invasion Risk (AIR) is a print-and-play solitaire game that began as a set of "variant" rules designed to be used with components from the board game Risk. AIR now has its own set of custom print-and-play components and fully-revised rules, transforming it from a variant to a stand-alone game.

Excerpt from the PDF rulebook:

Be warned – this is "thematic" solo gaming. Expect to plot your strategy, roll lots of dice and ride the wave of your luck only to be ripped from the jaws of victory in the most sudden, arbitrary and unexpected way – all in furtherance of the epic unfolding story of an oddball alien race.

If you enjoy a game that focuses on the narrative and takes you on an interesting ride, then AIR is for you. On the other hand, if you prefer a solo game that will always reward your perfect "armchair general" strategy - you’ll just have to cheat!
72349.name: Alien Invasion, A Solitaire Risk Variant

72350.description:
From the publisher:
Learn now words while playing with Spot and his friend. Choose the colorful puzzle piece with the picture and try to find the matching word from other puzzle pieces. Watch out, because the wrong pieces won't fit and you lose points. Be the first little learner to get 5 correct picture/word match and win the game.

72351.description: Among the ice floats in the Arctic Sea swim the fattest fish. This is also where the polar bears and go hunting. Of course, every polar bear tries to catch the most fish and eagerly jump from float to float. But wind and waves move the ice. The voracity of the other bears also reduces the number of fish rapidly. And sometimes even an Inuit or a cheeky seal steals a fish already caught. Who in this icy environment first collects ten fish is the winner. A memory game for children were the fish are fastened to the ice-floats with magnets.

72352.description:
From the publisher:
Throw the doe and move round the board, picking up cards as you go. the first player to have collected enough cards to complete a pirate picture and race around the board to the treasure is the winner.

Content:
1 board
24 pirate cards
4 counters
1 die

The skills being developed at this age include:

counting skill
co-operative play
concepts of winning and losing




This Pirate Race Game will aid this development as a child:

throws the die and counts the correct number of places on the board
learns to take turns with the other players

72353.description:
NUTS! - War Against Japan is a supplement to the NUTS! World War 2 tabletop miniatures wargame describing forces and rules specific to the Pacific Theater of Operations.

From the publisher's website:
For the Allies, the war in the Pacific Theater of Operations (PTO) was fought under conditions unlike any found in Europe or North Africa. Fought against an enemy unlike any they had ever faced before.

For the Japanese, the war was about proving that their cause was just: the liberation of Asia from the yoke of Western oppression.

Welcome to the world of NUTS! - War Against Japan. NUTS - War Against Japan includes American, Australian, British, Chinese, and Japanese armies, all the major players in the Pacific from 1941 to 1945..

WAJ portrays actions at the "tip of the spear", the area of combat where small arms dominate the field. This is that deadly space where you can look your enemy in the eye while driving a knife into his heart; where the foxhole next to you may just as easily have the enemy in it as one of your buddies.

Are you ready for it? Come experience PTO combat in a way that no other game can. Come experience War Against Japan.

NUTS! - War Against Japan is not a stand-alone game. You must have the core rules, NUTS! Second Edition, to play.

79643.description:
Before the German blitzkrieg stormed across Europe in 1939-40, a group of elite soldiers prepared the way by seizing bridges and other strategic targets ahead of the attack.
