In the following years, these warrior-spies, known as the Brandenburgers, operated behind enemy lines around the globe, from Russia and Yugoslavia to Egypt, Iraq, and India, Often bending the rules of war while completing their daring covert missions. Trained to be mobile and independent, steeped in foreign languages and customs, and expert in numerous military specialties, the Brandenburgers influenced the world's special forces long after World War II.

Brandenburg is a tactical wargame for up to three players, depicting the actions of the German commando force throughout the entire WWII. The game's map is assembled using hexagonal tiles, a method which simulates the fog of war and increases the game's replayability over time. Counters represent individual units, with specialized infantry (soldiers, medics, engineers, scouts and snipers) able to pack, equip and use a wide variety of weapons and gear to carry out their missions. Civilians, agents and partisans populate the conflict zone, acting as influential factors capable of tilting the balance of power to either side's favor.

76454.description: A simple spin and move game, moving between the treasure locations to reveal and collect treasure tokens. If a revealed token is a thief instead, start your next turn from the thieve's hideout. Some movement spaces may force you to lose a treasure to Iago's hiding place, but you may also land on a magic carpet which allows you to go anywhere on the board, including Iago's hiding place where you can take all that stolen treasure. When all the treasure tokens are claimed, the player with the most wins.

76456.description:
Gobal Simulation circa 1990-2010. Each player takes the role of 1 Nation: USA, Russia, EU, China, Japan, or India. Each
Nation has 4 Traits: Economy, Military, Social, and Environmental. Players play Development Cards to improve their traits. Each player draws 1 card from the Crisis deck each turn. There are 10+ types of Crises, most requiring a decision on the part of the player on how to resolve them. Some decisions are riskier than others. Through resolution of Crises, players earn Prestige Points which will ultimately determine the winner.

72361.description:
Sixth Sense: A Game of Perception challenges a player's perception of others on two levels, and rewards those players willing to take social risks in a tongue-in-cheek atmosphere. There are no wrong answers and the topics include Self-Image, Sex, Marriage, Money, Morality and Politics to name a few.





QUESTION: What is the greatest motivator for most adults?A. Love
B. Hate
C. Fear
D. Money






Score points by:
MATCHING the answering player (2 points) or predicting as part of a MAJORITY (+ or - 6 points)

name.#text: Sixth Sense: A Game of Perception

72364.description:
The Ten Major Construction Projects (traditional Chinese: 十大建設) were national infrastructure projects during the 1970s in Taiwan. They were proposed by the Premier Chiang Ching-kuo, beginning in 1974, with a planned completion by 1979, which ultimately cost over NT$300 billion in total.
Please refer to the wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ten_Major_Construction_Projects

Summary :
Ten Major Construction Projects looks similar to Monopoly games in appearance,but it is not a game of trading and negotiation, and you don't have to make others bankrupt.
You just roll the dice, moving Chiang Ching-kuo, deal with events where Chiang Ching-kuo stayed, then collect resouces,
through the Technique cards, you may affect the moving of Chiang Ching-kuo, get more resources, and change your resources into victory points. you may also disturb others' plans by Meeting or Inspecting cards,but you will always need a roll of luck to do this.
If 1.all kinds of Technique cards have been completed. or 2.all Meeting cards have been resolved, the game ends, the player with most victory points wins!

Ten Major Construction Projects is more like a family game than a strategy one.

Publisher: Academia Historica (www.drnh.gov.tw)
Production: 2Plus Studio (www.2plus.com.tw)
Designer: Jong Kong
Illustration: Fumi.03(Zi-wen Huang)
Art Design : Hsin-lin Liu
72364.name: Ten Major Construction Projects

76462.description:
(from the APL website :)

During the late spring and early summer of 1942, the Imperial Japanese Navy launched a series of aggressive operations. Barely taking time to refuel, Japanese carriers and cruisers struck the Dutch East Indies and Ceylon. Committing a basic error of dividing their forces, the Japanese then split their fleet carriers into two groups for Operations MO and MI, which resulted in the Battles of Midway and the Coral Sea.

Combined Fleet is a 64-page book supplement to the Second World War at Sea series, focusing on Japanese and American plans and options for these two climactic battles. There are 20 scenarios, or separate game situations, based on both actual actions and potential battles that could have taken place with the forces that both sides either could have committed or discussed sending to the battle zone.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Coral Sea and Midway to enjoy most of he scenarios, with some pieces also drawn from Bismarck, Bomb Alley, Strike South and Eastern Fleet.


http://www.avalanchepress.com/gameCombinedFleet.php

System Description at http://www.avalanchepress.com/line_WWIISea.php

name.#text: Second World War at Sea: Combined Fleet

72367.description:
The Ogre is a mini expansion for the Dungeon Twister series of games. The Ogre comes in blue and orange color, so it´s only usable in a 2-player game. It stats are Movement 2, Combat 4

Stun
Once per turn, the Ogre can stun an adjacent enemy character for 1 AP. Place a stunned marker on the victim. A stunned character is considered wounded. All rules applying to wounded characters also apply to stunned characters. At the end of his turn, the active player removes all stunned markers on all of his characters. They can act normally next turn.

The ogre was given out at Dungeon Twister tournaments during the tournament season in 2007. Leftovers are still given out at various Dungeon Twister tournaments.

Expands

Dungeon Twister

72368.description:
Roll dice, cover plates, hide the little mice - the first game of the color-learning with fun and exercise.
Five colored fabric mice meet at the game board on which a picnic blanket is shown. In addition, a mouse-hole is made of soft fabric material. Once a child rolls the mouse icon, a stuffed animal squeezes through the hole in the "real world". Then the child seeks a hiding place for his rodent. It must find an object in the room in the color of the mouse and then put the animal below it or behind it. When all the mice are gone and on every plate is the right food, the children take the rodents out of their hiding places and the picnic begins.
72368.name: Mein Mäuschen-Farbspiel

72369.description:
Players take role of Reksio (famous polish cartoon dog), Kurator or Żabba, construct space vehicles and collect hens that appear on planets. They throw dice to move their vehicles around the galaxy, landing on planets and battling between themselves.
Player who first gather 40 point win.

76466.description:
Publisher's Description (from website)

The Munchkin was sleeping all snug in his bed, when Santa came back with a BOOT TO THE HEAD!

Santa's Revenge is a holiday-themed supplement for any Munchkin game. It goes especially well with Waiting for Santa, but you don't need WFS to enjoy Santa's Revenge. It adds Santa monsters like Harold Angel (as in, HARK!) and the Anti-Clause. And it gives you new things to hit those monsters with, from Snowballs to the North Pole. And the new Armor is Christmas Wrapping. John Kovalic had fun drawing this one. (Actually, he had fun with them all. You can tell by looking. You'll have fun too.)

This is an expansion for Munchkin, not a stand-alone set. Santa's Revenge is not collectible or randomized; every pack is the same as every other.


Other

Part of the Munchkin series.
76466.name: Munchkin Santa's Revenge

72373.description:
This game is a sequel of R-Eco.
Each player is a company that does the trash separation and recycling. By carrying trash to corresponding storage places, a player gets points. However if you carry too much, you must throw trash away illegally!
The trash which cannot recognize contents is dumped in many cases. A player needs to perceive the bluff of other players, or to entrap other players, applying a bluff.
72373.name: R-Eco Recycle

72374.description:
[Translated and condensed from the Spiel des Jahres website, http://www.spiel-des-jahres.com/cms/front_content.php?idcata...;id=606]

Eric Carles' Very Hungry Caterpillar has an enormous appetite. Very close to the original book, the children embark on an adventure to change into a butterfly. On Monday it begins its journey. Before the caterpillar reaches the apple, it has to go on a sun box. Travel cards are revealed; Whoever finds the sun card earns a solar chip, and continues in search of the red apple. This memory game is easy to learn, so that even three year-old children can successfully complete the transformation into a butterfly.
72374.name: Die kleine Raupe Nimmersatt: Das Original-Spiel zum Buch

72375.description:
From the back of the box:

Things have really gotten grim. The food is gone. The barricades
are about to collapse. The car could sure use a tuneup. Perhaps it is time to hit the streets and see what you can find. Ammunition would be nice. A working phone would be fantastic. Maybe you’ll be fortunate enough to run across some steak and potatoes!
Who are you kidding, you’ll be lucky to make it back alive...

ZombieTown 3 contains:

24 Item cards
6 House cards
20 Event disks
New rules for this set




Requires the ZombieTown base set (TLC 3500) to play.
ZombieTown 2 (TLC 3501) is also recommended.

From the publisher:
Game play does not change radically for this expansion. The new item cards add first aid kits, car repair kits, molotov cocktails and sniper rifles among others!

The event disks are added to the street spaces. With the addition of these disks, the street is not a bad place to be... mostly. The disks include: master keys, +1 actions and +1 health. Of course, there are hidden zombies and obstacles as well.

72376.description:
From the back of the box:

Forever Young brings the excitement of life as a vampire to your gaming table. Each player plays the head of a vampire family struggling to maintain control among his minions and human protectors. Beware, your opponents are aiming to convert your servants and... Well, let’s just say they have something a little more 'unkind' in mind for your humans.

Forever Young is a light strategy game that involves secretly placing your vampires and humans, hiding weapons and items and trying to discover where your opponents have hidden theirs. Each beautifully produced and illustrated game has everything needed to play for 2 to 6 players.

80570.description:
Publisher's Description

Munchkin Booty introduced Ships to the world of Munchkin. You guys immediately asked why we didn't have Ships for Star Munchkin as well. So now we do!

Star Munchkin: Space Ships lets you ride in -- or on -- the Horsefly, the Starfurry, or the USS Secondprize. You can buff your ships with a Quad-Mounted Laser or a Bridge. And you can let your new Sidekick, Otto, do the flying for you.

Live long and prosper and kill monsters!

Note: This is an expansion for Star Munchkin, not a stand-alone set. Space Ships is not collectible or randomized; every pack is the same as every other.


Other

Part of the Munchkin series.
80570.name: Star Munchkin: Astri e Disastri

80571.description:
Game description from the publisher:

When Munchkin Dice went out of print, some really great cards became unavailable. Now they're back as a new booster pack: Munchkin Reloaded!

All your favorite cards have returned: the Race modifiers "Dark" and "High", the class modifier "Master", and of course the Reloaded Die (and we threw in an extra one, too!). This set also features the classic card "Rocks Fall, Everyone Dies" from the virtual pages of Randy Milholland's hit webcomic Something*Positive. And of course, all the art is now in full color!

This is an expansion for Munchkin, not a stand-alone set. Munchkin Reloaded! is not collectible or randomized; every pack is the same as every other.
80571.name: Munchkin Reloaded!

76478.description:
Trafalgore (Fyre As She Bares) is a free supplement for the Slaughterloo and Flintloque games.

It has a story about a navel engagment between the Orcs and the Elves, and the rules for the Orcs sailors and Marines.

It was first published in a Alternative Armies news letter, but has also been relesed as a free PDF.
76478.name: Fyre As She Bares

72385.description:
The objective of the game is to get as many points as possible answering questions. Every correct answer is awarded one point.

Every question (1920 in total) is accompanied by a picture. Cards with pictures and questions are put into a specially designed folder that allows you to only see the questions on one side and the answers on the backside.

The person or team that has the most points after finishing the 3 folders with random questions, wins.

(Source: inside box)

80578.description: Place the different colored stacks (three colors) on different levels onto each other without making fall the building. Each stack has to be stacked onto two stacks of another color. The player who stacked one piece on another legally, can replay directly. The winner of the is the first player who has placed all of his 30 stacks.

72387.description:
Transylvania, land of dark forests, dread mountains and black unfathomed lakes, still the home of magic and devilry as the nineteenth century draws to its close. Count Dracula, lord of corruption, master of the undead, and monarch of all vampires, is about to act on his long-contemplated plan for world domination.

Abraham Van Helsing, and his loyal vampire hunter companions, must battle against all manner of horror to save the people of Klausenberg and march upon Castle Dracula. Once inside, can they fend off the three bloodthirsty Brides, in order to infiltrate Dracula's secret tomb, deep within the walls of the ancient castle, and ultimately defeat the dreaded Prince of Darkness?

Consisting of one 90-card deck, the game pits four to eight players against each other. One team takes on the role of Van Helsing, assorted pitchfork-waving villagers, god-fearing priests, and various stalwart companions, and the other team assumes control of Dracula, the Brides, the Hound of Dracula, and numerous hissing, bloodsucking vampires. Each player must manage his hand of cards effectively to win. Gameplay is swift and slaughterous, with vampires staked, maidens drained, holy water administered, vampiric teeth exposed, and crucifixes brandished, frequently.
72387.name: Dracula Must Die!

72388.description:
The objective of the game is to quickly try to find words in a certain given category. For every word you name, you flip the first letter of that word from the game board, thus preventing others from using words with that letter. The person who's able to flip the most letters in 90 seconds, wins.

The game comes with an electronic timer and a handy way to mark used letters.

72391.description:
Ahoy mates! As an upstanding member of the pirate community, yer goal be to gain fame and fortune, aye, but mostly fortune! To amass wealth, ye must go on the account and join a pirate crew. Working together, you will embark on voyages of great danger. Or if ye be lucky, yer captain will have a map to untold treasures that can be unearthed with just a few tools o' the trade. So be prepared and beware! Yer mates cannot always be trusted, nor can that blasted lubber.
Perhaps ye have the pluck to be captain yourself? Captains gain a large share o' the treasure, but beware a mutinous crew! Eventually, you may become so famous that ye retire to enjoy yer legitimately acquired riches. But if some young scallywag flaunts more riches than ye, ye will fade into pirate obscurity!

In Cutthroats!, players take on the role of a crew of pirates. Each turn one player is voted Captain and a voyage is selected from the six available. Working together and using the tools they have purchased and their crew abilities, the crew attempts to defeat each voyage and gain reputation and doubloons! When a player reaches the rank of Pirate King, all retire from a life at sea. But the pirate with the most loot is the ultimate winner, so watch that reputation track carefully and decide when the time is right for treachery!

72392.description:
In the school of magic there is great excitement. The apprentices arrive for their final test to be included in the circle of masters. The tower is full of mystical magic, and only the master can unravel the mystery about the progress of the examinees. Who will be the first to enter the circle?

Zauberlehrling is a delightful game of dice, and a bewitched race for the great art of magic. The magnetic charm of the stones creates a game with wonderful surprises. And with a good memory you will anticipate the steps of the master's magic...

A magnetic race for sorcerer's apprentices with a good memory.

80587.description: Very simple roll-and-move game (or replay simulation) of auto races. Drivers get their rolls in the order of their current standing on track. They are moved according to the number rolled. If a car arrives at a unit of 10, 20, 30 etc (marked previously on the track) then he must make the so called 'action roll' and follow the appropriate instructions. Different tracks and teams can be downloaded.

families: Dungeons and Dragons Adventure System Board Games
80591.description:
The Gray Hag is a promo card that was being given out at GenCon and PAX Prime 2010. It's also been reported that it was being given away to people who were already a part of the DM Rewards program but that people who now sign up will not get the promo.

---

Gray Hag is a Fey creature. AC of 14 and HP of 4

Tactics:

-If the hag is within one tile of a hero, it attacks each Hero on the closest Hero's tile with a blast of lightning. After the attack, pass this card to the second player on your left.

-Otherwise, the hag moves 1 tile toward the closest Hero. After the move, pass this card to the second player on your left.

Attack is +6, Damage is 2 (Miss: 1 Damage)

Worth 4 Experience

name.#text: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game – Gray Hag Promo

72401.description:
Collection of Desires is a twenty-card expansion pack to be played along with the card game Seppuku. This set introduces two very significant themes in every well-rounded samurai’s life, women and art.

The expansion pack consists of (20) cards. There are (7) Geisha, (9) Haiku Cards, and (4) Action Cards.

Collection of Desires is the first of three expansions set to be released for the samurai card and dice based game Seppuku.

80595.description:
User Summary:

Gameplay: A shogi variant that adds dice-driven combat, modified by using effect cards (only one card--selected at the beginning of the game). Figures are pewter. Collect figures (power levels from 1 to 5) to construct your 5-combatant team (using two of six colors). More powerful characters can only be summoned if a certain number of colors are on the table.

Theme: Uses characters from Dragon Ball Kai, pitting one team of combatants against another. The same character can be found across multiple colors, roughly corresponding to allegiances found in the manga (comics). For example, Goku is found in both a low power level and a high power level (super), but even characters without supers are represented.

Goal: There are two variants, basic and advanced. In the basic, simply having characters breakthrough (reach the opponent's starting line) completes the game. In the advanced, there are three win conditions, including having the majority of your characters occupying the Dragon Ball area in the middle of the playing field.

Components: There are preconstructed starters (currently 3 available), and booster singles (currently 2 available). Starters include 5 figures (using two colors), a die, a double-sided effect card, a rule sheet, and a play mat (paper). The third starter play mat sports different coloring and English. Singles include a figure and a tip sheet showing how all the figures from the set might be used.

72404.description: A Warpspawn card game for two players. Theme is the building of the transcontinental railroad in the 1860's; one player is the Union Pacific RR, the other is the Central Pacific.RR. The players draw from a common deck of 80 cards: 7 suites each symbolizing an aspect of railroad building (jobs, money, supplies, etc.), and a "difficulty" suite. Each attempts to make melds of cards in the same suite, or cards of the same rank number, or cards of sequential rank (E.g. "a straight" or "straight flush"), to garner "Railroad Markers." First to get 100 Markers built their line to Promontory Summit first.

72406.description:
Igel und Floh ("Hedgehog and Flea") new game from their Clever Kiddo series that features a "spiel + buch"-- game and book, with book's text being in German. Obviously geared towards younger players, it appears to be an "alphabet game" that engages players with colorful cards and pictures.

This unusual game helps children to learn their first letters and words. The book can be read out loud by children under 5 years of age. Children are playfully introduced to the 5 vowels. The letters become objectives in a story. Chopsticks and rings are attached to the lovingly illustrated book, with which one can append the vowels. There are 55 cards depicting the entire alphabet. Using the cards, simple words can be added to the pictures to create imaginative stories.

72407.description:
From the bottom of the box:

"It's bulls vs the bears!

The Stock Market is a vibrant and exciting place where fortunes are won and lost. This real life game helps you in understanding stock trading and could help you in making big money, one day.

Invest in Blue chips like Asian Paints, I.T.C., Grasim, Tisco, Reliance and Blow Past. Buy when low and sell when high and you could end up becoming one of the stars in the ring!"

Everything is in English, but this is a game either for Indians or made in India. The currency of the stock market is rupees, and it's drawn from the Bank of Dalal Street.

72408.description:
The Disciple is a mini expansion for the Dungeon Twister series of games. The Disciple comes in blue and orange color, so it´s only usable in a 2-player game. Its stats are Movement 4, Combat 1.

Oubliette:
For 1 AP, the Disciple can flip face down the room he is standing on. All tokens in this room, including the Disciple, are placed face down on the room. All markers are removed from this room (including open or broken portcullis marker). Golem marker or other similar markers return to their owner. Wounded characters remain wounded. The "forgotten" room cannot be revealed again during the turn it was flipped. All rules concerning revealing a room apply to this room again.

The Disciple was given out at Dungeon Twister tournaments during the tournament season in 2007. Leftovers are still given out at various DT tournaments.
72408.name: Dungeon Twister: Der Jünger

72409.description:
Four Operations is a free, print-and-play card deck that can be used for designing and playing a wide assortment of math games.

It includes 54 cards, numbered 1-9 in six suits: rain, clouds, leaves, clovers, fish, and butterflies. The six suits are divided into three colors: gray for the weather suits, green for the plant suits, and purple for the animal suits. Each card has a number in the center, surrounded on the edges by the four basic operations.

The deck is designed to support a variety of mechanics and scoring systems and allows for the use of negative numbers.

72420.description:
A game of heroes, lies and unfortunate fish.

Publisher description:
You sit in The Heroes Return, a tavern famed for its heroic clientèle. You're not a hero, but you talk a good game. You and your friends are holding court, regaling the crowds with your tales of derring-do. Can you fight your way through a drunken haze to concoct the best boast? The most believable? Or at least ones that are funny? Or will you be called out as the liar you are?

In Braggart, each round players play cards from their hand which each contain a part of their story to combine them into a compelling tale. Stories are by turns hilarious or awe-inspiring and other players can accept them or accuse them of lying, downgrading their boast into something much less impressive (though usually much funnier!).

Winner 'Best Card Game' UK Games Expo 2011
72420.name: Braggart

72423.description:
Once upon a time, there was a wonderful game based upon the beloved fairy tale "Jack In The Beanstalk". All the children who played the game always played happily ever after. Collect treasurers as you move our "Jack" up the beanstalk to the Giant's Castle. Get down safely with three treasurers - gold, the singing harp, and the goose that lays the golden egge - and you will win the game! Careful! you'll wake the sleeping Giant if you don't climb quickly and quietly. "FeeFiFoFum". Run - he's after your treasurers! Game contains 4 "Jack" movers with stands, 1 "Giant" mover with stand, 30 die-cut treasure cards, spinner, game board, rules with short story of Jack And The Beanstalk.

Publisher's Website

72426.description:
User Summary:

This is an extremely rare Milton Bradley game from WWII. The International Game Database lists its publish date as 1942.

The object of the game is to gain the most points over 5 games played.

First Player is chosen by roll of the dice. Each player in turn rolls two dice and moves 2 tanks. One tanks move the number of spaces indicated by one die and the other tank moves the number of spaces indicated by the second die. If you only have 1 tank left then you can move the number of spaces indicated on either of the die or the total of both.

You may move in any direction except diagonally. You cannot move forward and then backward in the same move but you can move over the same square repeated as your move.

If you land on an enemy tank with an exact move you capture the tank. Each captured tank is worth 5 points and winning a game is also worth 5 points.

72427.description:
From the publisher:
Try this fast puzzle solving game for two players. Take all the pieces and be ready for the pattern you will need to build. Built it fast and correct and you will win.

The contents:
32 pattern tiles
Rule book
Patter book

The players divide all the tiles into two piles. Each player then tries to build a pattern that they choose from the patter book. Each pattern is made up of 16 tiles, so every pattern can be built. Be the first player to win 5 rounds and you win the game.
72427.name: Carres Magiques

80621.description:
Fool's Poker is a surprisingly deep poker variant which retains the hidden information and bluffing of poker but adds a strong deductive element. It is played with a traditional 52-card deck.

At the beginning of the game, all players are have hands of size 5. Each round, the players are dealt a new hand. One player calls out a 5-card poker hand that they believe can be made by the collective cards of all the players. The player to their left must call the previous player's bluff by saying "BS" or similar, or otherwise state a higher hand of their own. Play continues clockwise until a player's bluff has been called. Players pool their cards and see if the last name hand can be assembled from their cards. If the hand is possible, the hand size of the player who called the bluff drops by 1. Otherwise, the hand of the player whose bluff was called decreases by 1.

The next round begins with fresh hands using the new lower hand limits. The player who called "BS" last round starts the new round. If a player's hand size drops to zero, they are out of the game. Play continues until the players only have 4 cards between them, and the player with most cards remaining is the winner.

Rules for hands:
Pair, Two Pair, 3 of a Kind, Full House, and 4 of a Kind: must name their card values
Straights, Flush, and Straight Flush: must name their high card
Flush and Straight Flush: also must name their suit

Variant: The 2's are wild able to take any value and suit. The 5 of a Kind hand becomes a valid poker hand, ranked higher than Royal Flush. This variant addresses the issue where, late in the game, it may be difficult to assemble even small hands.

80622.description:
From the publisher:

Obamanopoly is the Property Trading Game for the New Economy! As the only game parodying the dysfunctional politics of Washington and the ridiculousness of our current leaders, Obamanopoly is the right game at the right time.

76538.description:
Each player is in a classroom with 5 (short games) or 10 (long games) schoolchild. One of them is in front of the blackboard.

Each player can play on his turn can draw a card and play one card for chalenge one opponent or all other players with little schoolyard games :

"Ni oui ni non"
"Jeu de la barbichette"
"Chi Fou Mi"
Counting
"Jeu du béret"
"Mains Chaudes"
etc...

The schoolchild of the winning player move to the next grade and leave the game.

The first player with no schoolchild win the game.

76539.description:
Textile is a tile placement game for 2-4 players. It's designed for nestorgames' game system Nestortiles.

The game's objective is to "knot" a piece of "textile", which is made of smaller parts, so called "patches".

The players freely choose any colored tile from a supply and create the patches by putting tiles together and always following the main rule of allowed color patterns: the same color may not occur on any two orthogonally or diagonally adjacent tiles. If a player decides to add a patch (or if the patch reaches its maximum size of five) it is "knotted" to the main textile in the middle of the table. The players then score points by the formula "knotting sides x size of the patch". After all tiles are played, the winner is the one with the highest total score.

76540.description:
You are an official F1 driver: choose your team among Ferrari, McLaren, Red Bull, Mercedes and all the others and start with the qualifications! Decide your strategy, 1 or 2 pit stops or no one? Upon this, your tyres’ management is vital. Once the red lights turn off, insert the 1st gear and gradually speed up...you will feel like really driving! Pay attention to the curves: if you are driving too fast you could take the longer path or even go out of the track! But if you are good, you will enter the following straight at the best speed! Overtakes, accidents, tires’ wear, booster, engine damages and rain will add a touch of enchantment to all races.

Formula 1 IS A GAME FOR FAMILIES but SINCE no cards or dice move your car IS ALSO an interesting and appealing GAME FOR GAMERS.

HOW TO PLAY: cars are not moved by any die but according to the gear in that turn. The gear level is a pawn that can be moved on the own cars' card of one unit any turn, so the drivers can accelerate or slow down engaging a higher or lower gear every turn.
The curves must be faced according to an optimal speed value shown on a sign. If the cars enter the curve with speed higher of 1 or 2 gears than the optimal one they will be forced to drive the entire curve on the outer lane or in the worst case to go out of the track and restart in the 1st gear.
The cars' movement can be powered by playing the tyres cards: at the beginning of the race any driver receives 6 tyres cards (35% of value 1, 48% of value 2 and 17% of value 3). These cards increase the cars' speed (not the gear) and playing them means to have a tyres' wear: the drivers can decide for 0, 1 or 2 pit stops during the 3 laps of the race, depending how they are spending the tyres cards. Actually in the pit stop the drivers will receive other 6 new tyres cards.
The booster can give a +2 movement by rolling two 6-sided dice but with the risk of damaging the highest gear compromising the race. Slipstreaming, engagement and weather conditions (with rain and slick tyres) complete a real simulative and easy to learn game.

80637.description:
Extension to MageBattle.
Nekromant contains 55 cards and adds cards to win the game by emptying the hand of the opponent.

Die Erweiterung Nekromant ist eine Erweiterung mit einer untoten Kreatur und besteht aus 55 Karten. Sie ist eine Erweiterung der Schwierigkeit "schwer". Mit dieser Erweiterung kann man Magebattle auch gewinnen indem man dem Gegner alle Karten von der Hand zieht. Es sind Gegenstände mit neuen Effekten vorhanden und natürlich auch wieder Countersprüche zur Verteidigung.

www.4globalplayers.com

80638.description:
Extension to MageBattle.
Dämon contains 55 cards and adds counterspells to defend versus heavy attacks and several items with strong effects.

Die Erweiterung Dämon ist eine Erweiterung mit einer bösen Kreatur und besteht aus 55 Karten. Es ist eine Erweiterung der Schwierigkeit "schwer". Mit Countersprüchen kann man sich gegen Angriffe verteidigen. Es gibt auch neue Gegenstände mit starken Effekten.

www.4globalplayers.com

name.#text: MageBattle: Dämon – Die Magie des Bösen

80639.description:
Extension to MageBattle.
Lich contains 55 cards, including an undead creature and adds curses and benedictions to the game. It´s the first extension with the difficulty level professional. Also there is the possibility to win by emptying the opponents hand and there are many new visitors and items.

Die Erweiterung Lich ist eine Erweiterung mit einer untoten Kreatur und besteht aus 55 neuen Karten. Diese Erweiterung ist von der Schwierigkeit "Profi" und man kann erstmals auch Flüche und Segnungen spielen. Ausserdem kann man jetzt auf den Handtod des Gegners spielen. Es gibt auch viele neue Besucher und Gegenstände.

www.4globalplayers.com

name.#text: MageBattle: Lich – Der Beherrscher des Todes

76544.description:
Scarecrow doesnt like pesky crows so if you steal his corn he goes wild! Spin the spinner to see how much corn you need to lift but beware if you wake him! For 2 - 4 players. Requires 3 x AA batteries (not included)

Publisher's Description

76545.description:
Each player takes a set of 3 of the same colored balls. Push Mr.Wiggle's bow tie to turn him on. Players have to throw their colored balls into Mr.Wiggle's head one by one trying to miss his moving wig! The first player to get all 3 of their colored balls inside Mr.Wiggle, before he spits them out, must push his bow tie to turn him off and declare themselves the winner!

Publisher's Description

80642.description:
Antics! is the 2010 Essen release by Fragor Games. You play an ant colony. Prey and leaves abound nearby - if only those other ants would not take what is rightfully yours. Players attempt to have their ants bring back prey and leaves to their anthill. Only the best ant colony will survive and the winner proclaimed The Ant Queen.

Gameplay is straightforward yet rich in challenging decisions. Do you concentrate on building your ant-hill only to discover that others have got to the food before you ? Or do you go and grab the food only to find yourself outpowered towards the end of the game ?

The game is for 3-4 players, ages 10+ and lasts for 60 minutes. It features Fragor’s "ant-hill system" - a revolutionary new game mechanic.

Get carried away this Essen...

81707.description:
The game board is ring-shaped and depicts a calendar, i.e. fields for each month. The players put their pieces in their birth month; Klaus the mouse starts in the current month. The playing pieces are birthday cakes (Klaus is an actual mouse). Eleven picture tiles are placed openly into the center of the board.

The active player first checks whether there are any gifts under his/her cake. If so, the player has to say which month the gift(s) belong(s) to - if right (the color code on the backside tells the answer), the player can keep the gift. If wrong, the player has to put the gift under another player's cake.

Afterwards, Klaus is moved by a die. The active player picks a tile from the middle that matches the month Klaus moved to and keeps it (if there is no matching tile or the player makes a mistake, the tile is given away as above). When Klaus passes a player, he gives that player another tile as a gift.

When all tiles have been distributed, the player with most tiles is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name.#text: Klaus die Maus entdeckt das Jahr

76548.description:
The Chad Valley catalogue from 1910 stated that this is "The best indoor football game invented - highly popular with followers of the game." -----from the book "PLAYING THE GAME" by Brian Love, 1978.

Object of the game was to be the one to score a predetermined number of goals first. Players throw a die and then move foward that number of spaces. Certain spots on the board resulted in fouls, throw in, penalty, and offsides resulted in your marker being moved to different places on the board.

Scoring a goal was done if you were close enough to the goal (spot # 25) and rolled a number high enough to get past that #25. If you sinmply reached #25 with your roll the golie made the save and punted the ball back to number 4

72453.description:
River Of Heroes follows Hammer and Sickle and focuses on the Soviet units carrying out the final phase of Operation Bagration, the final assaults across the Vistula River led by the tank spearheads racing towards Warsaw along with the specialised assault engineers and supporting self-propelled artillery regiments.

With the lead tank spearheads finally meeting stiff German opposition the advancing Soviet Armies made their final Operation Bagration assaults to secure bridgeheads over the Vistula River.

What Soviet forces are inside?

River Of Heroes introduces the specialised Soviet Assault Engineers along with Independent Self-propelled Artillery Regiments designed to attack, secure, and hold key bridgeheads needed to continue the advance towards Germany.

name.#text: Flames of War: River of Heroes

76550.description: This game Sinnet (Tennis spelled backwards) is from Chad Valley, Harborne, England. It is for 2,3 or 4 players. The server throws the die and moves the ball counter to which ever linked circle is indicated. After a successful service throw. the receiving player throws the die and moves the ball accordingly. If during the course of play the ball falls outside of the court (x,y,z) or on the players own side of the net the point goes to the opponent. The ball must always move forward never backwards

72455.description:
Hammer and Sickle follows Stalin’s Onslaught and focuses on the Soviet units carrying out the second phase of Operation Bagration, the exploitation of the Shock Armies’ breakthrough of the German defences.

These highly mobile corps launched through gaps created in the Germans lines and immediately rushed deep into German held territory heading directly for Minsk and its lines of supply.

Highlighting the northern and southern spearheads (the Hammer and Sickle) and their associated corps brings some interesting tank and equipment options.

What Soviet forces are inside?

Hammer and Sickle concentrates on the mobile exploitation forces of the Mechanised and Tank Corps that raced through the front line and smashed into the hastily assembled German blocking forces holding key objectives in the rear areas.

name.#text: Flames of War: Hammer and Sickle

76552.description: This strategic war game was produced in the years leading up to World War I. Two invading forces are set against each other, a 4 strong Navy against a 5 strong Army. The object is to secure possession of Europe by placing pieces on squares containing "Ringed Cities". Moves are made by both a die roll and a compass spinner which determines the direction that all moves must be made in. If either Commander cannot move a single one of his forces he must "pass" and offer his roll to his opponent who can either use the move or chose to reroll the die.

name.#text: The Invasion of Europe: The Great War Game

76247.description:
Description
In the new game Eaten By Zombies! players strive to survive as the horde of the living dead make it their goal in Death to force you to join the crowd. You must work with or against the other survivors to be the last one standing. No not standing, cowering in the corner crying for their mommy.

In the spirit of AMC's "The Walking Dead" and "I Am Legend", Eaten By Zombies takes you into a dark world of eventual death. Every turn you must venture out from your safehouse and scavenge for Swag. But not so fast, the Undead have other plans for your brains. Every day a Horde of fresh zombies will be waiting for you, and over time the threat gets greater. Now it's time for your "Fight or Flight" instincts to help you to survive just one more day. Using the swag you've got on you (ie cards in you hand) you must survive any way you can.

If you can get away or kill the Horde, you may scavenge the remains of the desolate suburbs for any Swag the neighbors may have left behind. With the right stuff and a few good friends to out run, you may just make it through this alive... well, no probably not. But being the last one to die a slow, painful death means you can claim sole victory!

With a set of over thirty different cards to start with, no two games will ever be alike. This game is a combination of Card Drafting, Hand Management and Survival Horror with a few dirty tricks thrown in.

Game Play/Mechanics
You start with five heavy sticks (each worth +1 fight) and five hide cards (each +1 flee) as well as two sandwiches (+1 Flee & Draw one card). You shuffle these 12 cards and draw 6 into your hand. You then face one of the 25 zombies from the Zombie Deck with a fight value ranging from 1-8 and a flee value of 1-4. You must announce Fight or Flee and then proceed to play some/all of your 6 cards in your hand.

If you successfully fight/flee you then take the total fight/flee value to the scavenging portion of your turn (think of it as a "buy") where you acquire items such as Shotguns, fists full of ammo, crowbar, binoculars, fire on a stick, grandma pantry, deadeye or other cards which you then put INTO YOUR HAND for use in the very next turn and draw back up to 6 cards from your draw deck. Played cards go to your discard pile, including any zombies you have succeeded in killing.

If you flee then the zombie card goes to the zombie discard pile. As you draw zombies into your hand (from shuffling your discard pile) you are stuck with them in your hand forever unless you play them into the zombie horde attacking on another player's turn, so the zombie horde gets tougher over time.

If you are unsuccessful in killing/fleeing then you must lose a number of cards equal to the flee value of the horde. These lost cards come from either your hand or as a blind draw off the top of your draw pile and go back to the scavenging area, weakening you. If you run out of cards you succumb to your wounds and become a zombie, now trying to kill the other players on each turn.

If a player ever ends up with six zombie cards in his/her hand the zombie players win as the remaining players have gone insane. Each time the zombie deck is gone through and reshuffled you add one more zombie to the horde for the rest of the game, making perpetual survival impossible.

It isn't a matter of if you're going to die but when. Be the last player standing and win. If at any time the entire zombie deck is depleted (because the players have killed all of them rather than using flee), all remaining players alive win together.

This is a unique cooperative/competitive game where you really feel the tension and inevitability of doom. You spend the first few turns building up your deck only to see the zombies increase in power and slowly drain your will to live as the game progresses.

Integrates with:

Eaten By Zombies!: In Cahoots
76247.name: Eaten by Zombies!

76556.description: This game for 2-4 players. Each is equipped with a counter, 2 money bags and a stock of tokens. Players throw the die and move the number of spaces indicated. There are fines and rewards on the different spaces in the game. Landing on spaces 4, 20 or 29 causes the player to lose a turn. If you land on space 30 (Poor Lady) you must promise to buy her gloves. You move to space #30 and pay a token into the pool.In addition you can, on your turn, place the money bags on any of the servant spaces. When opponents land on those spaces they must add a token to the pool in the center of the board. If you reach space number 32 first you colect all of the tokens in the pool and win the game.

72461.description: Grab your blaster and swing into action to save Woody and the gang! Activate your shooter and target enemy toys. You can see how it feels to be Buzz Lightyear as he helps save the good toys from the Evil Lotso at the Sunny Side Day Care! Easy to understand game rules so everyone can have a BLAST!

name.#text: Space Shooter Target Game: Toy Story 3 Edition

72462.description:
From back of box:

"You are a Space Alien and you need Earthlings for a sinister and mysterious goal known only to you.

Use your alien mind-control powers to manipulate Earthlings into doing your bidding and use your ship to blast your foes in this action packed game of deception and intergalactic mayhem"

Earthling Abductor is a quick, simple card game with a strong memory element. Players assume the role of alien species competing to abduct and control Earthlings. Cards represent Earthlings (human and otherwise). Cards in a player's hand are Earthlings that have been previously abducted, and can now be activated by their alien overlords to do nefarious tasks - most frequently abducting more Earthlings. Cards face-down at various locations on the table represent Earthlings to be abducted. The face-down stacks at each location are built up by players during the course of the game; thus each player potentially has some knowledge about what types of Earthlings are at each location, which is where memory becomes involved.

Players move their spaceship tokens from location to location, abducting Earthlings (moving some of the face-down cards away from the location), and then fly back to their homeworlds to score them. Some Earthlings cause trouble when they are abducted (damaging the spaceship), while other may offer benefits while they are aboard. Players can also directly and indirectly attack other players' spaceships, to either prevent them from completing their abduction goals or sometimes to steal dangerous Earthlings without suffering the consequences.

Players win by successfully abducting 10 Earthlings and returning them to their homeworld. Each player also has a secret objective which allows them to win with a smaller number of Earthlings, such as six of the same species or 7 of the same gender.

Earthling Abductor: Deluxe Edition contains 68 Earthling cards, 7 Alien races, and 6 plastic space-ships. It supports 2-4 players.

Earthling Abductor also comes in a non-Deluxe edition, in a smaller box containing 44 Earthling cards, 4 Alien races, and 4 plastic space-ships. It supports 2 players. The two versions are otherwise identical.

80657.description:
Talpa is a 2-players game that belongs to Connection Games family. While in most connection games players try to make a chain built of their pieces, in Talpa players remove pieces to make a path of empty spaces.

Initially the board is filled with black and white pieces, forming a checkerboard pattern. A player moves by picking up one of his pieces and capturing a horizontally or vertically adjacent opponent's piece. The captured piece is removed from the board and replaced by the capturing piece. The capture is mandatory if possible. When capturing becomes impossible, players remove one of their stones per turn.

The goal is to "dig" a "tunnel" of orthogonally adjacent empty spaces connecting player's sides of the board.

No draws are possible in Talpa.

76562.description:
User summary: The twenty cards, each of which shows a temperature in Fahrenheit, are shuffled and five are dealt to each player. In turn, each player generates a random number using the spinner and then advances one pawn the indicated number of spaces. The five players try to match all of the cards dealt to the spaces one has landed, which are in Celsius, The first player on the gameboard and return Home is winner.

The game is an educational tool designed by Dr. George Spooner of Centarl Connecticut State College to reinforce the conversion of the Fahrenheit and Celsius systems.

76564.description:
Yes, you are an Archaeologist. You track down antiquities all over the globe. You don’t want trouble, yet trouble always seems to find you. But you are ready for anything with your whip, gun, and lucky hat.

Sen So is a 2 or more player strategy board game for ages 10 and up. Most games take about 15-30 minutes to play.

Sen So uses a unique set of octagon cards and card holders. Players have to think ahead of opponents by placing and revealing cards together. This provides fast play for even large numbers of players.

Sen So Print Your Own decks

TwinBlade Games is proud to offer this affordable way to enjoy Sen So. Print Your Own (PYO) is designed to be printer friendly. PYO uses less ink and very little color ink to provide you with a cost effective way to print and play Sen So. Some details that were ink heavy have been removed, but the cards and materials still provide clean, clear and exciting graphics.

80662.description:
Muffin is being captured by Krimson.Krimson used the time-machine to go back 500 years to a heavily monitored island. The object of the game is to collect 500 'flitsjaren' en 6 character cards to rescue Muffin.

Players roll a move a six along the board. When a player completes a round, that player collects 100 'flitsjaren.' During the game players win and loose 'flitsjaren.' If a player lands on a space with the image of Muffin, Spike or Suzy, the player gets a character card.
The first player which has collected 6 different character cards and 500 'flitsjaren' wins the game, but only when he or she stands on a space with 'flits'

The game could be played with the 12 figurines of the Spike and Suzy series. These figurines were availeble in 2000 at the Albert Heijn super markets.

72471.description:
Zombie Manor II is a mini-game that is included with the terrain model set "Wildwood Grove." Besides the change in setting, it expands the original Zombie Manor by adding new monsters and treasures. This set can be combined with the contents of "Zombie Manor I" to create a longer game and add variety.

From the rules introduction:

The objective of the game is to search the Graveyard for the ring of Lady Coreanne Swarthington. The Graveyard is not completely abandoned however, as strange forces (or perhaps even the curse of the ring itself) conspire to make it a focus of foul magics and a home to misshapen creatures that never should have been. Will you recover the lost ring, or will you find your own grave in Wildwood Grove?

Link: http://www.worldworksgames.com/store/index.php?main_page=pro...;products_id=288

76569.description: Your bingo boards contain 9 simple mathematical exercises (in addition and subtraction). You claim the announced number by being the first to finding a matching exercise on one of your boards to which the number is the answer, claiming the number tile and covering the matched exercise on the board. The first player to cover an entire game board wins.

80666.description:
The goal of the game is to collect fairytales.

There are 28 fairytale-cards and 4 Witch-cards. At the beginning of the game all the cards are shuffled and the cards are placed, face down, on the table.

The first player takes one or two cards. If both cards are from the same fairytale, that player gets the cards. Otherwise the player puts back the cards.
If you turn around a fairytale-card and another player has that fairytale, you may ask that player for the second card.
If a player has collected 3 cards of one fairytale, he/she puts the fairytale-cards in front of him/her. So the other players can see the cards. These cards cannot be taken by the other players.
If the fourth fairytale-card shows up and you own the fairytale, you may place the card in your collection. If you don't own the fairytale, the card is put out of the game.
If you take a Witchcard, that player has to keep the card till the end of the game.

At the end of the game the player with the most Witchcards looses 1 point.

If all the fairytales are completed, players count their fairytales.

A fairytale with 3 cards is worth 1 point.
A fairytale with 4 cards is worth 2 points.

The player with the most points wins the game.

72476.description:
An urban skating game included in the cardstock model set "Urban Grind" published from Worldworks Games.

From the publisher:
Mayhem: Urban Grind is a skate park, standees and mini-game all in one! Design the park of your dreams and furnish it with all the ramp and grind combos you can handle! Once constructed build up an army of skater dudes to inhabit the park and cause completely mayhem!

As mentioned, this release includes "Mayhem Skate"; a skate park themed multiplayer game which pits your skater against others in an exhibition style or racing format challenge! Includes a number of game variants to spice up the competition! Fun, fast and sweeeeet!
Mayhem: Urban Grind includes all of the following (All skate park terrain comes in both graffiti and "clean" versions)

72478.description:
Game Description
You and your hideous troll-friends have decided that it’s time for a career change. You are tired of guarding bridges and shaking down weary travelers all for the sake of a few clinking coins! Tolls are down, bandits are up, and besides, living under your bridge is damp and uncomfortable-—and breathing all that crumbling bridge mortar is taking a toll on your lungs...

It’s time to venture forth and find some fresh sea air! In Trollhalla, you join forces with your fellow trolls to sail the seas in search of islands filled with pillage and plunder. Crunchy livestock, nervous monks, panicked princesses, piles of gold, and casks of grog await you! But watch out for Billy Goats--if you’re not careful they will knock parts of your precious stolen cargo out of your boat!

With so many goodies lying about on these islands, it feels like you’ve died and gone to troll heaven, or perhaps someplace even better -- Trollhalla!

Object
Players take turns placing trolls on the board. Trolls emerge from below each ship’s deck ready to plunder and scout the seas of Trollhalla! Trolls placed on ships claim plunder from nearby islands when a ship sails. Trolls placed in the sea will scout for destinations and determine where these ships sail, and also award players cards that perform special actions. The player who uses his trolls to fill his private boat with the most valuable collection of plunder wins the game!

72480.description:
First mini-expansion for the game "Arriala, canal de Garonne".
The expansion only contains the figure of Pierre-Paul Riquet and the rules.

In the beginning of the game "Riquet" is placed on the village "Montauban".
"Riquet" can be moved by the active player, so "Riquet" can help with the construction of "Canal de Garonne". He's considered as a worker and follows the basic rules of occupying a place on the canal.

The active player can:
- move "Riquet" one time from one village to another village,
- use some of his actionpoints to move "Riquet" one or more places on the canal.
You can't move "Riquet" to the vinyards or the structures by the canal and you can't use cards to move "Riquet".

When a section of the canal is completed with the help of "Riquet", the active player may choose which colour Riquet is to be considered.

source: free translation of the official rules

76578.description:
From the designer, Matt Arnold:
Antigrams is a 5-minute 2-player print-and-play abstract strategy game, involving simultaneous tile placement, subtitled "Rock Paper Scissors Tiles".

Equipment is a stack of 48 identical square tiles, each divided diagonally into a light-color triangle and a dark-color triangle, presumed in these instructions to be white and black.

Choose which player is which color from the two colors on your tiles.

On each turn, both players drop a tile. After the first turn, they alternate having first choice of where to place. Tiles must touch any edge of at least one tile that is already played, or of a location the opponent has currently chosen.

Hiding the front side from the opponent to conceal the tile's rotation, they position their tiles upright with its edge on the table. Simultaneously, when their tiles are both touching the table, they tip their tiles toward each other so the tiles are laying down on the table. Repeat.

Players attempt to form three target shapes with their own color and the opponent's color.

Look for a Black rock which crushes a White scissors, for instance. The game would immediately end in a victory for Black-- unless a White paper is formed at the exact same time, and covers the Black rock. That's one point for White and one point for Black. In that case, the game continues until one player has at least one more winning shape combination on the board than the other. If the score is still tied when the last tiles are played, the game is a draw.

It is possible for two tiles to be part of multiple shapes. For example, a White scissors and White paper can share two tiles and still qualify as two complete shapes.

Strategy Basics:


Pay attention to what structures your opponent is building, and disrupt them if necessary.
Remember, with every tile, you are placing your own color and your opponent's color.
"Telegraph punches that you're not throwing." Get your opponent to believe you're building toward a particular victory, and suddenly switch to build a different one.

76595.description: This is an Icehouse board game in the style of the Frogger video game. Icehouse pieces represent cars on a road that might run over turtles that are trying to cross the road. Each player secretly programs a series of moves for their turtles, and then the moves are revealed and resolved. Hitting traffic will cause your turtle to backtrack. The first person to reach the other side of the street is the winner!

76596.description:
This is a race game from 1 to 60 and was produced during the black-out period of the Blitz in Britain. Special squares on the game board resulted in different things happening during the course of the game (i.e. Dogfight in the sky, stop to watch and lose your turn, Red plane shoots down enemy, receive two tokens, black and red flyers collide, lose two turns, etc.) Players start with a number of tokens which are at different times placed in the kitty or removed from the kitty. The first player to reach #60 wins and gets 2/3rds of the kitty the second place player gets the rest.

Objective: be the first arriving at target space 60, moving by turns. Simple 'Roll & Move' game.
Translation of the title "Feindliche Flieger in Sicht!" "Enemy Planes in Sight" - see further remarks about the Klee company in the data base
76596.name: Aerial Attack

76598.description:
A tile laying, domino-style game played within the confines of a board using 2x1 oblong shaped thick cardboard tiles of a diamond design utilising seven colours.
The game box contains
4 page rules sheet in 6 languages.
a 48cm square board with 14 x 14 squares thereon onto which the tiles cover 2 adjacent squares.
a pad of score sheets.
4 x cardboard racks for players to display their tiles to them whilst concealing from other players.
a box containing 49 different tiles.

To start the game all the tiles are placed face down on the table and each player selects 8 - 10 tiles [depending upon number of players] and puts them on his/her rack.

The double tiles [coloured triangle the same each end] are numbered 1 - 7 and the player with the lowest numbered double starts the game by placing the tile to cover 2 of the 4 centre squares.

The next player [if wished] matches the end or side of one of his/her tiles and places the tile so that the triangles on the 2 tiles make a coloured square. If the player cannot or chooses not to play a tile the player misses a turn and picks up, if available, a tile from those faced down at the beginning of the game.

Players cannot form squares using triangles of different colours.

The game continues until one player succeeds in playing his last tile [or no player can play]

Matches consist of several games to decide overall winner.

76600.description:
From Play The Game description:

Game for two players

Circa 1920

Information on gameplay from Play the Game by Brian Love.

Two farmers try to force their apparently 1-eyed if not totally blind pigs up the road to market. The route is a minefield of detours. The only consolation is that the players get to control 2 pigs rather than 1 and can decide in which order the beasts shall be moved nearer to the finish enclosure. You roll two dice and then determine which one will move . Both of your pigs must get to the finish line in order to win. If your pig gets to a field marked IN it must enter the field and go through it until it gets back to the out gate. Once 1 pig has reached the MARKET you can only roll one die for the remaining pig.

72507.description:
Take the helm of a small shipping company, deliver valuable cargo and out-sell your opponents! You face an exciting challenge to bring your fledgling company up to speed with the changing demands across the region.


Anchorage is a fast moving strategy game where you build factories, create high-speed shipping routes and devise tactics to make sure you deliver the most valuable cargo. Steer your merchant ship to take advantage of the high tides, and weather the impact of the low tides in order to prevail. The region can only support one company in the long term so you have a lot to prove!


No game of Anchorage is the ever the same, due to the interchangeable tiles which allow different game-board layouts and the ever-changing demands of the ports.


This game is available from arcticfoxgames.com. Limited copies will be available at the UK Games Expo 2013.

72508.description:
A ship loaded with treasure has been wrecked near your island.

Whirlpools, storms and sharks lie amongst the changing currents between your island and the wreck. Instruct your pirates to build rafts and salvage treasure from the wreck or steal it by attacking other player's rafts!

This is a quick tile turning game suitable for 2-4 players from age 8.

(Publisher Blurb, Copyright 2011)

72509.description:
Icebomb Arena is a strategy game of gladiatorial combat in a bomb-laden arena for 4 or more players. Each player is a gladiator in the arena. Icebomb Arena is played with Icehouse pyramids on a chessboard.

Each turn consists of a planning phase and an action phase. During the planning phase, players will determine the orientation of pyramids which will determine the actions they can take during the action phase. During the action phase, each player will take two actions either blocking or moving on the board.

The goal is to be the last player with a gladiator on the board that has health. The players can lose health through fights with other gladiators and through stepping on squares that have bombs.

72512.description: The Icehouse Plant Game is an Icehouse Pyramid game played inside a loop of string. Each player controls a plant that is trying to grow while blocking all of the light energy from the other players' plants. The more energy your plant can collect, the bigger it can grow, but you must be careful not to grow so fast that you kill your leaves.

76609.description:
Cinemaware's Thematic Overview

"In a time of lusty wenches and black-hearted villains, King Richard has been murdered and England thrown into civil war! Amidst the ringing clash of steel and the thunder of charging steeds the bold Saxon knights have chosen you to lead them into battle against the hated Normans. Players will compete in grand tournaments of joust, siege castles and raid enemy strongholds in their attempt to find the lost crown of England. Enlisting the support of Robin Hood, players will have to outwit their enemies to control England and restore order to a war-torn land."

Game Description

Defender of the Crown is set in the Middle Ages, where following the death of King Richard, players assume the role of a Saxon lord, try to fight off Norman hordes and ultimately wrestle for complete control of England. The players will collect valuable resources to build strongholds, amass armies and fight for control of opponents' castles and territories.

Players may engage enemy lords with their armies on the battlefield or contest lands and fame in medieval tournaments. They may also loot the treasuries of opposing lords or lay siege to their castles. Players must also contend with random events such as plague, drought, locusts while fighting for their right to be crowned King of England.

Once a player has taken control of all enemy counties they will be crowned king and win the game.

72514.description: Infinity Human Sphere is an expansion to the Infinity tabletop miniatures skirmish game. This supplement contains rules for sectorial armies which have more limits on troop type selections but gain the ability to form “Link Troops” where entire squads act as one. Human Sphere contains new troop types, weapons, equipment, and skills for all of the factions as well as rules for using civilians in your games. In addition, the expansion introduces the new Aleph faction which features cybernetically advanced humans leading robotic remotes as base troops.
72514.name: Infinity: Human Sphere

76611.description:
From the back of the box:

There are 594 words to be spelled. The more words you get right, the bigger your chances to win. A game based in the TV Show Soletrando from Caldeirão do Hulk. A pratical and sturdy box for you to take and play any place you want.

Verso da caixa:

São 594 palavras par serem soletradas. Quanto mais palavras você acertar, maiores são as suas chances de vencer. Um jogo baseado no quadro Soletrando do programa Caldeirão do Hulk. Uma caixa prática e resistente para você levar e jogar aonde quiser.

72523.description:
Simple, introductory wargame, first in the Postcards from Tuscany series, being a spin off of the Battles of Middle Ages system, from TCS Games.
It is a classic wargame with hex map, leader activation through chit draw, while a peculiarity is the fact that each unit has variable strength, according to a chit drawn before each combat (or once for the entire game).
It is a print & play only game, featuring 2 different battles from Italian Middle Ages: Montaperti and Campaldino.
Each game has a single A4 map and around 80 playing counters

name.#text: The Age of Dante: Montaperti and Campaldino

families: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)
Call of Cthulhu: The Yuggoth Contract
76621.description:
For Tyler Scindere, a lowlife thug-for-pay, his most recent unsavory job may be his last. The victim of a double-cross, Tyler has become a living science experiment, caught in a perpetual hell of pain, hallucinations, and despair. But just as time loses its meaning and Tyler begins to lose his mind, a sliver of hope appears... from an unlikely ally.

Screams from Within is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

Also included in this cycle is part five of a gripping new short story by Nate French. In the last installment, Erin Morai was trapped in a supernatural menagerie of horrifying beasts, surviving on revolting scraps and subject to mind-bending psychological experiments. Now, we return to the plight of her kidnapper, Tyler Scindere. With his eyes ripped from their sockets, Scindere is horrified by the fact that he is still able to see.

Surrender your mind to the will of your captors...

This is not a stand-alone deck; you must have additional Call of Cthulhu LCG cards to play.
76621.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Screams from Within Asylum Pack

80719.description:
Publisher Blurb:
It's a classic from the word "GO!" With spectacularly designed houses and hotels, tokens rich with the glow of 24 karat gold accents, a distinctive "Real Estate Portfolio," and much, much more -- including double the usual supply of money!

Best of all, the lush green playing surface is luxuriously framed in fine hardwood, to present the classic MONOPOLY® game graphics as never before! It's a grand combination of tradition and beauty for your home. There are built in drawers to store all the game components. It's the deluxe edition of the most popular board game ever. The perfect family heirloom for the next millennium.

76628.description:
“Paging Doctor Ward to the Emergency Clinic – Doctor Ward - Code Blue – STAT!”

It has been a tough shift so far, and the pressure is getting to you; so many patients, not enough time.

Doctor Sanjit needs a hand with pathology, Doctor Gruber is concerned about the patient in the waiting room whose condition may deteriorate rapidly if left untreated.

The patient in front of you needs urgent surgery, but the operating theatre is occupied and there is breakdown in radiology that requires attention.

Curse those budget cuts, we're left with no choice but to park patients in corridors and risk infections.

Both Ambulance docks are full and oh no! another critically injured patient arriving at the helipad, and to make matters worse you haven't even had your morning coffee yet.

-

You and your companions are highly respected doctors working in the high-pressure, environment of the Emergency Clinic, dealing with life and death decisions every day.

Working as a team, you each have to co-operate, using your medical expertise to diagnose and treat patients and manage scarce resources, all the while avoiding worsening conditions, infection outbreaks and crises that threaten the lives of your patients.

-
Emergency! is a co-operative crisis management and resource management game that also includes competitive elements.
Each player assumes the role of a doctor whose job is to work as part of a team to successfully treat sick patients who arrive at the Emergency Clinic and send them home.

Together you must make best use of your own specialist skills, to make life and death decisions affecting; treatment, transport and management of patients using the limited resources available to you, in a high-pressure environment.

As a team you must also deal with numerous infection outbreaks, equipment failures, and deteriorating patient conditions, many of which may lead to drastic situations.

Your Doctor already has a range of specialist skills upon which you may develop, researching new techniques or calling-in other specialists to assist.

To aid you throughout the game, specialised Treatment Rooms also offer additional equipment and bonuses toward treating your Patients. Making best use of these rooms is vital to your success as a team.

72846.description:
From the back of the box:

Pick a shape card and lay it down. Add another! Then another! Take turns adding new shapes until . . . You've made a Silly Body."

The rules give four different games that you can play with the shape cards: We Made It Together - a cooperative variant in which the players take turns laying down cards until they both think they've made a silly body; On Our Own - a competitive variant where each players takes 20 or 30 cards and makes as many silly bodies as he or she can; Use 'Em All Up - a competitive variant where each player takes 20 or 30 cards and uses them all to create one incredible silly body; and Jump and Switch where after completing one of competitive variants you switch cards with your opponent and play the game again.

The shape cards have many different shapes and colors, but are made out of very flimsy cardboard.

72535.description:
Game Play Description

Exile Sun combines some of the most compelling strategic mechanics in a way that delivers a streamlined, integrated, and fast-paced game of competition and conflict. Simplified deck building, hand management, simultaneous hidden worker placement, a card draft, 6 unique player advantages, and a revolutionary zero-luck combat resolution system ensure that playing Exile Sun is like no other game. Private and public card-based objectives give players options for points, but they must choose carefully when allocating their limited resources. The player with the most points accumulated at the end of three game cycles wins.

A Game Round

The game simply consists of cycles where each player in turn makes four fleet moves and then ends their turn by moving a pawn on the 'Timer Track'. The 'Timer Track' triggers events like 'Supply' and 'Battle' that effect all players simultaneously. Once each event is resolved, the player turns continue.


Moves - These moves can be regular movement, scanning an enemy fleet, launching a decoy fleet, and initiating a battle.
Events - The battle and supply events are resolved with a mechanic that may be best described as simultaneous hidden worker placement. This unique mechanic involves the use of a control card with 10 sliding tabs. The resulting game play is tense, intuitive, and intensely competitive.





Theme Overview

Far off and forgotten, orbiting the Exile star, a fragmented group of Colonial powers is struggling to exist in the harsh environment of their foreign home. Having been unexpectedly cut off from contact with Earth over two hundred years ago, the process of gaining some economic recovery has been slow and arduous. With dissension rising among the populace, these leaders must compete to gain military, economic, and technological advantages over each other in a race to lead the united colonies in a mission to contact Earth. Time is short. While an outright planetary assault could express dominance in military power, perhaps luring out and destroying an opposing Flagship or Construction Shipyard can have the same effect using fewer resources. Or hit and run assaults with fleets of strike craft can be equally effective. But be warned, leaders dare not neglect their own colony resources, or their supporters will lose faith in them and they’ll fall quickly out of the race.

72847.description:
Solitaire Statistical Replay game on World Football, it permits to replay in less than an hour any final edition of the most important soccer competition in the world, from 1930 to 2010.

Rules and flow of play are simple, but accurate.

To play match, each team simply compares his attack value versus opponent defence value. Then, each player rolls three dice to see how many goals he scores.

There are several data that have been used to rate the various teams for each edition of the World Cup, and an element of randomness has been added, to give much flavor to the replay of the tournaments.

Simply put, you compares the Attack rating of one team against the Defence rating of the opponent and viceversa, to get the number of goals scored by each team.
You may complete an entire tournament in less than an hour, but you don't have much chrome: simply the result.

A separate expansion set contains 23 different competitions taken from UEFA Eurocup (from 1980 onward), Copa America (from 1989 onward) and Africa Cup of Nations (from 2000 onward).

Another separate expansion set contains data for Champions League (from 1991 onward) and UEFA Cup/Europa League (from 2004 onward) for a total of 25 tournaments.

name.#text: The Dream to End All Dreams: World Cup Soccer

72540.description:
They said hello by destroying the moon. Tides ceased to exists and wave after wave of dead fish washed up on shores the world over. You will never know the pleasure of walking in the surf during a lazy summer vacation, bug. I'm so sorry for that.

In the midst of the panic over the moon they appeared. We tried to fight back but they destroyed our biggest weapons in their silos. Governments and world leaders responded in different ways. Some gave up instantly, and others resisted. The beach, bug, remember what I told you about that? It used to be a lot farther away, but that was before they made an example of it. All in all, it was a hell of a way to find out that we were not alone.

That was about 15 years ago. Since then, we've had some victories, but far too many failures. The biggest op your daddy was involved in was faking the crash on Mars a few years back. See, bug, we WANTED that ship to take heavy fire and crash, right where it did. There were enough diggers aboard to set up the underground Mars base. Last time daddy was there he got to see a new weapon, based on their tech. Hopefully we can have it ready soon.

This is why I have to go, bug. Mars needs people like me to sneak in, hide in the Moon belt, deliver supplies and workers, and get back home without being seen. And I promise you that one day I will take you to see the rings of Saturn, when we can fly throughout the system safely and freely. It'll be just you and me. I should be back soon. I will miss my little bug, bunches and bunches! Daddy will always l-

END TRANSMISSION

In SNEAK, players take on the role of heroic smugglers looking to transport supplies up to the secret Resistance base on Mars. On each turn, you will have an amount of energy (action points) that you can use to maneuver and move your ship around the board. However, any leftover energy is converted in cargo cards, that you draw into hand. Asteroids will then semi-randomly move around the board, blocking your way or revealing your hiding space. Then, the aliens will move and attempt to destroy you. Each time you get hit by an alien you will have to lose cargo cards- or else you will have to start your smuggling run again. Upon a successful run, you will score notoriety points based on the cargo you brought and can spend it to increase your maximum energy, maximum cargo (hand size), and number of special powers (mods), or to buy new mods.
The most notorious smuggler at the end of 10 rounds is the winner!
72540.name: S.N.E.A.K: Smugglers Nimbly Evading Alien Killer

families: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)
Call of Cthulhu: The Yuggoth Contract
76638.description:
Tyler Scindere was hired to do a job, plain and simple. But the dangers that face him now are anything but plain, and there’s nothing simple about the dark motives of his employers. Now, the betrayer has become the betrayed, and he’ll need every ounce of courage and wit he can muster if he hopes to remain alive.

The Spoken Covenant is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

This is not a stand-alone deck; you must have additional Call of Cthulhu LCG cards to play.
76638.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Spoken Covenant Asylum Pack
