The cards are now put into a special stand so the person names can't be seen; then the narrator reads out the quotes and everyone tries to guess which of them was said by the person that was announced.
The guessing is done by allocating five chips. Each correctly put chip counts 4 points, fooling someone counts one. Repeat this until all three of the narrator's cards have been used. Then the remaining cards are discarded and everyone draws new ones. This is repeated until everyone has been the narrator once. The player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

72936.description:
Warriors of Eberron is the twelfth Small Expansion Set (wave 12) in the HeroScape series. It is the second expansion (wave D2) for the Dungeon and Dragons crossover started by Heroscape Master Set: Battle for the Underdark. It is also fully compatible with all previously released Heroscape products.

There are 4 booster packs:

Golem and Wyrmlings
Veterans of the Last War
Ogre and the Goblins
Heroes of Khorvaire




Each pack contains 5 figures and a glyph.

name.#text: Heroscape Expansion Set D2: Warriors of Eberron

72938.description:
The game consists of a "magic" crystal ball, a number of plastic chips and some cards. The players put a number of chips (of each color) on the table equalling the number of players minus one.
The crystal ball glows in different colors until it suddenly stops at one color. Each player then has to quickly put a hand on a chip in the corresponding color. The player who is slowest (i.e. doesn't get a chip) receives a card and has to perform an action stated on it. When all cards are used up, the player with least cards is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
72938.name: Bibi Blocksberg: Hexenkugel

72939.description:
The game consists of L-shaped tiles which contain squares in up to three of the four colors used in the game.
Each player receives four open tiles, an additional tile is placed openly on the table. The players now take turns adding a tile which has to be adjacent to at least one square in the same color, while different colors have to be separated by at least one square. For each matching color the player gets a scoring chip. A new tile is drawn at the end of a turn. The player with most scoring chips at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

72941.description:
Thanks for all your support! This game is now sold out. -- John Kranz, Consim Press


The Situation

On December 9th, 1940, the British Western Desert Force launched their first offensive of World War Two, catching the Italian 10th Army completely off guard. Although greatly outnumbered, the British dominated by outmaneuvering the Italians with their superior armored vehicles. In the battles of Sidi Barani, Bardia, Tobruk, and Mechili, the Italian 10th Army had been soundly defeated but remained intact to defend the gates of Tripoli.

On this, the 58th day of the offensive, the remaining operational tanks of 7th British Armoured Division and a small advanced detachment of men, guns, and armored cars are attempting to block the last escape route for the Italians.

The Italians, yet unaware of the fast approaching Western Desert blocking force, will soon find themselves desperately racing against time to break through near the small village of Beda Fomm and escape into Tripolitania before it’s too late.

The time is 1200 hrs, 5 February 1941

The complete destruction of the remnants of the Italian 10th Army hangs in the balance.


The Game

Beda Fomm marks the triumphant return of one of the truly classic gaming gems originally released in 1979 by Game Designers Workshop during what many consider the heyday of traditional conflict simulation gaming. This fast-playing, operational-level game of the Battle of Beda Fomm represents a classic blend of simple gaming mechanics with nail-biting action suitable for solitaire or competition play.
Relive the drama as the British player, maneuvering your outnumbered but superior armored vehicles and supporting personnel and weapon units to cut-off and summarily destroy the retreating Italian forces. As the Italian player, you have strength in overall numbers, but your formations are brittle and are hampered by a lack of maneuverability in attempting to break through and escape complete destruction. Simple mechanics capture the flavor of desert warfare along with the unique qualities and characteristics of the opposing forces.

This Consim Press edition represents a re-mastering of the original release by introducing many enhancements while remaining true to the original game design. This all-new edition features a full size game map, newly-designed counters with additional game markers, and updated rules presentation. You’re sure to enjoy this classic Frank Chadwick game design like never before!

Re-implements:

Beda Fomm (GDW)

80971.description:
In these Instant Download PDF Game Book series (iDetective is NOT an iPhone App!), you are the Detective.

Have you ever had the desire to walk the streets of Victorian London with Sherlock Holmes. To walk up Baker Street as the fog is rolling in and hear Holmes cry out, "Come, Watson, come! The game is afoot!"?
With iDetective you can! You can capture the mystery and excitement of Holmes' London in these challenging single player gamebook series. You, the player, will match your deductive abilities against the master sleuth himself, Sherlock Holmes, using a unique paragraph system, like in the old do-it-yourself adventure books.
You are presented with a mystery to solve, and it is then up to you to trace the threads of evidence through the byways and mansions of nineteenth century London. You will interview suspects, search for clues, and put together the facts to reach a solution.

In iDetective #2: The Case of the Roped Ringer The small town of Ringleton is struck by fear when the young bell ringer of the local church if found hanged in the bell rope. Some talk about suicide, others of murder!
It is up to you to figure out exactly what happened in Ringleton Church. You will interview suspects, and put together the facts to reach a solution.

iDetective #2: The Case of the Roped Ringer comes complete with eveything you need to play and can be downloaded instantly:


Rules
Case Introduction
Location Entries
Quiz
Solution & Answers
MP3s of Author reading the Casebook and Solution.

name.#text: iDetective #2: The Case of the Roped Ringer

72957.description:
"After a lovely day at the beach the seals are taking their beach balls home happily. But Nino the cheeky dolphin isn't done playing. With one bold leap, he always shoots from the water and snags the balls away from the seals. Where he will pop out again? Only those seals who predict his clever moves can escape Nino. Whoever brings home two of their balls first is the winner! Who will find the best route to take?"

(Description from publisher, translated from German)

"Nach einem wunderschönen Tag am Meer tragen die Robben ihre Bälle vergnügt nach Hause. Doch der freche Delfin Nino findet kein Ende. Mit einem gewagten Sprung schießt er immer wieder aus dem Wasser und stibitzt dreist die Bälle der Robben. Alle fiebern mit: Wo wird er wieder herausspringen? Nur wer seine Robben clever zieht, kann Nino entwischen. Wer als Erster zwei Bälle nach Hause gebracht hat, gewinnt das spritzige Spiel! Wer meistert den Weg am besten?"

(Description from publisher, in original German)

This is a game for children, with seals going around a circular board, trying to take their metal-marble-balls back home (the destination). However, a dolphin stands poised in the center to leap out in a random direction and knock the seals' marbles away. The goal is to avoid the dolphin and get the marble-balls back to the seals' home.

72958.description:
A promotional card game given out with purchase of Shel Silverstein's book, Runny Babbit. Teams compete to be the first to decode the spoonerism on an updrawn card. The 1st team to do so earns a point. The team with the most points at the end wins.
Contents:
20 cards with a spoonerism and an illustration by Shel

81109.description:
A game about the weather.

The board displays rows with all kinds of weather and rows with dots. The player turns the spinner and moves his or her pawn in the direction of that kind of weather. The player may move as many dots as the spinner indicates.
The first player who arrives in the centre of the board wins the game.

72964.description:
Agordat 21st December 1893
The first victory of the Italian Army in Eritrea.
Game in No Turkeys! n.6 2010

2200 native Askari and some Italian national soldiers, led by Lt. Colonel Arimondi, encounters in the plain of Agordat around 12,000 Mahdists, led by the Amir of Ghedaref, attempting to invade the Italian Colony of Eritrea. An asthonishing Italian victory and the very first one of the young nation.
Company level wargame of a forgotten battle, with the flavour of the colonial clashes.

Agordat 1893 contains the following components:
- One A3 DIN shape map
- One Rulebook
- One sheet of playing pieces

72967.description:
Suleika - 2 Teppiche is an expansion for the base game Suleika.

This expansion replaces the dice with cards.
Every player get an identical set of cards. Holding 2 of his cards in his hand a player can decide what card to play and than picks up a card again.

The cards have 2 areas. People have to decide before every game if they will use the grey or the yellow part of the cards.

72970.description:
Pépé is rich, very, very rich. He is nice but he decides to have only one and only heir. Could you be good at creeping him ? Will you playing the worse dirty tricks to your brothers and sisters ? All the way, don't forget to put your moods aside because your only goal is to obtain "Le magot de pépé".

(my own translation from the french box)

81111.description:
The 'Elfstedentocht' is a Dutch event were ice-skaters try to complete 200km along 11 cities.

In this game each player gets a control-card representing his/her color.
Each player gets 7 'rijders-cards'. With the rider-cards player can skate the distance needed between two cities or rest. When a player reaches a city, he/ she gets a stamp on the control-card.
Players recieve along the way 'Skrik-crads' (alarm-cards). With these cards the player gets an advantage or disadvantage.

The first player who skated 200km wins the game.

72973.description: Preschool dexterity game where players take turns adding different size blocks to a stack. If the players successfully add all the blocks the penguin is rescued.

77072.description: "La maison des mots" is a game for children who are beginning to read and write. The mechanism of the game is very close to bingo game. Each player has a card with 4 words and have to find the right letters to to finish pre-built words. A picture of the word helps the children to know what words he has to find. The firt player who finish his cards with 4 words, won. A fun way to learn spelling.

72979.description: Multi-match dominos. Hexes with three matching areas: a ring on red, yellow, or blue, with 1 to 3 dots of red, yellow, or blue. Make a three-way match -- ring color, dot number, and dot color -- to get a second turn, which must be at least a two-way match. First player to run out of hexes wins.

77076.description:
Loch Ness is a game for children ages 4 and up, with expandable rules to make the game more and more exciting as they grow and learn.

All the world knows the monster legend, but anyone can take a good photo of it. The players have 2-3 tourist pawns to place on the spots on the shores of the lake, then try to drive the monster near to them rolling a 12 sided dice with different effects on his moves.
The more skilled and lucky tourists will be able to pick one or more photo tiles from the sack, keeping only the last one. At the end of tiles, the best photographer will be the winner.

The basic game is very simple to play; the game have some advanced rules for a more challenging play. The monster is composed by a set of three different painted pieces: head, back and tail.

Game contents

Gameboard
12 plastic Photographers
1 Nessie figure
32 Nessie pictures
1 bag
rulebook




Not to be confused with another 2010 game with the same theme, Loch Ness!

families: Victory Point Games States of Siege Series
72981.description:
The Curtain Falls: 1865

States of Siege #4 Expansion Kit

The War of the Rebellion continued after the Election fo 1864, and with this expansion kit for The Lost Cause so too does this game. With additional Confederate Resources and Leaders (including "Stonewall" Jackson and Longstreet), plus cards that extend the game into 1865 and enhance the narrative with several new Broadsheet events, you'll be whistling Dixie in no time!

Note, The Lost Cause Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of The Lost Cause to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:
Complexity: 4 (Basic Game) or 4.5 (Advanced Game) on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is one Union Army or Civil War Leader, and each turn is one month

Game Components:
• One 2-page, color Optional Rules sheet
• 8 color, die-cut 5/8” mounted game pieces
• 12 (total) ‘Headline’ and 'Broadsheet' cards

Credits:

Game Design: Hans von Stockhausen
Documentation & Development: Alan Emrich
Playtesting: Chris Dorrell, David Ells, Mark Herman
72981.name: The Lost Cause Expansion Kit

72986.description: Players divide themselves in teams. Each team consists of two or more players. During each turn, one player of the team is designated the clue giver. The clue giver takes the next card from the box. There are six lists, each of a different category, of five proper names. The clue giver must give verbal clues to get the teammates to say each name on the assigned list. The team will advance its pawn one space for each correct response. The team has forty seconds, as counted by a sand timer, to get all five names. The team that first completes one circuit around the gameboard is the winner.

81180.description:
(Goodies 2004-2005-2006-2007)


The Neutral Characters are printed on white counters. They are not part of any team.



The Neutral Characters are used in specific scenarios. The produced Neutral Characters are:
Cleric,
Mekanork,
Thief,
Pickpocket,
Red Dragon,
Magophage,
Courtesan,
Assassin.




Neutral characters based on the finalists of the 2006 DTL are:
Belsirat (Angel of Light),
Tanazan (Dark Angel),
Myriades (Shadow).
81180.name: Dungeon Twister: Neutral Characters

77085.description:
A semi-abstract, cooperative game designed to teach project management techniques.

The game takes place on an 18x18 grid. The players take the role of project managers in a company. At the start of the game each player has a single project in play. Projects begin in a single space on the board, and each turn grow out one space orthogonally in all directions. On a player's turn only his or her projects grow.

If a project grows into the edge of the board, the game ends in a loss for all players.

To finish projects, players utilize a mix of concept work and production work tokens. Placing a token on the board blocks projects from growing into that space. If a project cannot grow it counts as finished, and the players score one point. After a project is completed, a replacement is added in a semi-random square.

Concept work tokens are taken from a shared pool of 10, and once placed remain in play indefinitely.

Additionally, each player has 2 production work tokens. These tokens only last for one round.

A player's turn consists of doing one of the following: placing a single concept work token, moving a single concept work token, or placing both production work tokens.

That player then grows his or her projects. If two (or more) projects collide they combine into a single compound project. Compound projects grow on the turns of every player who has a project involved, and their multiple growth points make them much harder to finish. Additionally, compound projects are still only worth a single point.

The players win if they can finish eight projects. However, after every other project is finished, another project is added to the mix. This means that the end game requires managing seven projects simultaneously.

Designed by a team at the Singapore-MIT GAMBIT Game Lab for the MIT Sloan School of Management.

72399.description:
A Swedish quiz game containing 380 questions about football (soccer). The questions come in 5 categories: 'Swedish football', 'International football', 'The stars', 'The World cup' and 'All sorts'.

A die is rolled to to decide category. The first time you give a correct answer in a category this is marked in the score sheet.
The winner is the player who first has given correct answers in all categories.

72991.description:
In Asara, you take on the role of a wealthy builder competing to bring the most prestige to your name through constructing the largest and most ornate towers in the city. The game is played over 4 rounds (years), during which you will be acquiring the pieces for your towers and assembling them.

Players are given a hand of cards with different colors. On their turn, players play a card from their hand to an action space on the board. These spaces allow players to acquire tower pieces, get money, build a portion of their towers, etc. Once a card has been played in one of the action spaces on the board, all subsequent cards played in that area have to follow the original card’s color. Turns continue around the table until all players are out of cards for that round.

Scoring happens at the end of each round based on the number of towers a player has and the ornamentation present on those towers. After the scoring at the end of round 4, a final scoring occurs and bonus prestige points are given to the players with the largest towers of each color, the most towers, and the largest tower overall. The player with the most prestige points is the winner.

81185.description:
Suburbia is a party game in which players have to complete activities in each of the eight catagories in order to successfully move their pawn around the board. The catagories are:

-Acting Out: Act out the answer without talking or making noises.
-Ambidoodle: Draw with your non-dominant hand without talking...
-Brain Clutter: Trivia questions
-Common Thread: Figure out what three words have in common
-Mixed Messages: Unscramble letters to make up an anwser.
-Noise Violations: Make noises without talking or using words or gestures.
-Scribbles: Draw without talking...
-Unmentionables: Give descriptions without revealing the word.

72994.description:
Fast and easy to learn tactical wargame about medieval battles.

It is a card driven game, with historical leaders, cavalry charges and countercharges, infantry defending in fortified terrain, crossbow fire and bombardment, and much more. The unique combat system and a new way to visualize the battlefield makes this game a new quality in the world of the tactical wargames.

There are many scenarios in the base game, concerning battlefields of the:
- Wars of the Roses,
- Wars of Scottish Independence,
- Hundred Years' War.

The modular board and cube-based way to visualize troops on the battlefield, let players to create an infinite number of scenarios of the whole medieval era.

Thanks to the "play and learn" rulebook composition, this game can be played with equal pleasure by two experienced players, as well as by a father and son.

77093.description:
This expansion adds 8 new generals to Art of War and includes 2 blank cards that players may use to create their own generals.
Included in this expansion are;
18 General Cards
(the original 8 cards, the 8 new cards and 2 blank general cards)
1 rulesheet

The 8 new generals;
-The Spy (sacrifice civilians to change identity)
-The Burrowers (defend hexes in which they have 2 civilians)
-The Masons (may build wall pieces to aid in defense)
-The Scavengers (capture enemy military pieces after combat)
-The Bandits (can attack their own units)
-The Raiders (sacrifice 2 civilian to capture a military unit)
-The Ancient (destroy any opponent your forces surround)
-The Despot (sacrifice a civilian to gain a production)

72998.description:
When times are tough, as indeed they are just now, gather your friends and family around the table and cosy up for a few hours of traditional fun with Irish Quest. Together you can rediscover your Irish roots and the family values that really matter when you play Irish Quest. An ideal way to spend quality time together. Be Irish and proud of it!

Your Country, Your Heritage, Your Passion

Test your knowledge of everything Irish and learn so much more by playing Irish Quest. With over 2,000 Irish multiple-choice questions in four different categories HISTORY, LAND AND NATURE, CULTURE and MODERN there’s so much to share and learn, and the accompanying booklet enhances the experience with further explanations for many of the more interesting and unusual answers. But beware! As you tour the country to collect the letters ‘Q U E S T’, Destiny cards may help or hinder you and you will need to earn sovereigns to help pay your way.

73004.description:
From the Publisher...

The Game of Christmas Cheer is a simple, small game (box is 3.5" square) for families to play during the holidays or anytime you’d like to remember Christmas.

The object of the game is to be the one with the most Christmas cheer (chips) at the end. Cards depict holiday events like last minute shopping and package in the mail. Each one instruct the players to pass cheer right or left, take some from the center. Players can choose to keep rolling the die, hoping to get more cheer, but some rolls can make them lose it all. Everyone has fun because it’s impossible to know who will be holding the most cheer when the game ends.

It’s for 3 to 6 players. There is text to read on the cards, but as long as one player at the table can read even young children can easily enjoy the game. It takes only about 10 minutes to play.

The game comes with:
- a wooden hand-painted gingerbread man pawn (each is unique)
- a 1" die (green or red)
- 10 color cards
- 60 plastic chips
- 1 rule sheet (not in the picture)

Besides just enjoying the game with family and friends, rules are included to use it to give out gifts at a party or family get-together during the holidays.

76355.description:
This booster expansion for Munchkin Booty includes 15 complete new cards, with 2 new sharks, 6 new ships and 2 ship enhancers.


Publisher's Description

Avast ye! Fish & Ships be full of Sharks (and other denizens of th' deep) and Ships for yer Munchkin Booty game!

We gots here Fish rangin' from yer pathetic Fish in a Barrel to yer munchkin-mangling Tiger Shark. We gots six new Ships, and all of them be good and most of them be really dumb. We thinks that Jet Ski be the dumbest, but there be room fer argument here. And ye can give any ship a Glass Bottom, ta see what's comin' at ye, or Clockwork Wings ta rise above it all.

This be a supplement, not a stand-alone game. Fish & Ships be neither collectible nor randomized; every pack be the same as every other. Arrrr.


Other

Part of the Munchkin series.
76355.name: Munchkin Booty: Fish & Ships

73014.description:
From the rules "The object of the game is to be the first contractor to complete the job and cross the finish line. Just as in actual contracting situations, the quicker the job is completed, the better off you are."

This game was designed for marketing. One player chooses the CMI Autograder-55 and the other players choose any of the 3 generic autograders. Players take turns spinning a wheel to determine how many spaces they move. Spaces can direct the player to lose a turn, go again, draw a card, etc. Many cards tell the player to loose a turn but do not affect the player controlling the Autograder-55 and then describes why the superior technology of that machine makes it a better performer.

81208.description:
War by Proxy is a seven turn scenario contained in MMP's Operations Special Magazine #3 (Summer 2010).

Fifty years before the start of the Hundred Years War, France and England were engaged in a power struggle over Flanders between the Kings of France and England. This scenario covers these events (and more) that occurred during the years 1281 to 1345.

Operations Special Magazine includes 51 new 5/8" counters for this scenario. New types of counters include Naval Fleets.

The base game Warriors of God is required.

73018.description:
From the publisher:
TOTAL PACKS are a new scenario series featuring a wide variety of scenarios set on geomorphic boards—and including BONUS items like overlays and die-cut counters!

TOTAL PACIFIC THEATER PACK I features EIGHT brand new scenarios depicting varied actions with all scenarios set in the PTO but not overwhelmingly cave and beach landing oriented. Each scenario has been reviewed and your enjoyment is assured by a full money back guarantee of the purchase price if not 100% satisfied!

TOTAL PACK scenarios are OFFSET printed on bright white heavyweight cards and feature an offset printed presentation. They also feature some of the finest AFV art in the form of highly detailed and accurage line drawings, featured prominently on the cards.

Tournament sized designs with the occasional monster mixed in all designed by experienced, die hard enthusiasts YOUR FELLOW HOBBYISTS. Varied actions. That's what TOTAL PACK scenarios are all about.

73019.description:
Total East Front Pack I is a scenario compilation released by Critical Hit, Inc covering action on the Eastern Front during World War II. It includes eight scenarios and three overlays:

TEF1 #1 Eye of the Needle - German SS armor and mechanized infantry attempt to break out westward from Vienna (1945) as Soviet infantry and armor attempt to close the noose around them.

TEF1 #2 The Last Waltz - Russian infantry supported by lend lease tanks and engineers attempt to push the weakened German SS troops out of Vienna (1945).

TEF1 #3 Panzers in the Park - German SS troops with tank support attempt to hold a large park in Vienna from the advancing Russian infantry supported by lend lease tanks during the last days of fighting in Vienna (1945).

TEF1 #4 Squeeze Play - A light German reconnaissance unit attempts to hold the way open for retreating formations as the Russians attempt to close the noose on Vienna (1945).

TEF1 #5 Panzer Pioniers - A German Pionier Company with tank and artillery support attempts to eliminate a mixed force of Russian troops that had been interdicting supply columns during the drive on Leningrad (1941).

TEF1 #6 The Battle for Pisino - To protect the city of Rzhev from a direct Soviet attack an ad hoc force of German SS must seize a fortified village on the Soviet’s flank. This village is protected by a company of infantry with support on the way. This battle takes place with temperatures of -45 Celsius during the Soviet winter counteroffensive of 1942.

TEF1 #7 Last Line Before Oboyan - German Tiger tanks clash with Russian T-34’s as German infantry attempt to dig the Russians out of their fortifications during the early moments of the Battle for Kursk (1943).

TEF1 #8 Olin’s Surprise - A large German armored force that includes Panther tanks lays a trap for advancing Russian T-34’s in this large tank battle for a rail bridge over the Bug River during the Campaign to Destroy Army Group Center (1944).
73019.name: Ostfront Pak I

73020.description:
From the publisher:
STALINGRAD, SOVIET UNION, 22 October 1942: The German 6th Army push into the heart of Stalingrad played directly into the hands of the defenders, intent on contesting every building. Pavlov’s House became the name of one particularly well-defended apartment building, its moniker gained from Sergeant Yakov Pavlov, who commanded the platoon which first seized the building and which kept defending it throughout the battle. The house was a four-story building in the city-center of Stalingrad, overlooking a large square, the 9th January Square . The small garrison established anti-tank and machine-gun posts at the windows and held off all attacks for fifty-nine days. Each time enemy infantry or panzers attempted to reach the defenders, Pavlov’s men took them under heavy fire littering the square with corpses and wreckage. Eventually the defenders, as well as the Russian civilians who remained in the basement throughout, held on until 25 November 1942, when they were relieved by counter-attacking Soviet forces.

This is STALIN'S FURY, a brand new set of four scenarios + a new 22" x 34" map on heavyweight stock. You also receive a color (red, naturally) cover and VARIANT RULES page. All you'll need to dive into the heart of the inferno that was the Battle of Stalingrad during 1942.

This scenario pack also includes Teufelhunden (GWASL #1) a 1918 WW1 scenario set in Belleau Wood France.

73022.description:
In this battle game, each player is trying to end up last pig standing by forcing the other players to give up the five energy disks with which each began the game. To do this, you roll a die, and your pig must travel forward around the board and land on the same space as or pass by another pig -- when this happens, that pig's player must toss one energy disk into the game box.

The main deviation from this pattern comes when a pig lands by exact count on one of the five sparkling starter spaces in the arena. When this happens, the player has three choices at the beginning of the next turn. To continue on, to reverse direction and move, or to roll the Die of Power; the Die of Power may cause you to lose your turn, reclaim an energy disk, move 5 spaces or teleport to any space, designate another player to lose a disk, or let you become the Turbo Cochon (Pig), who teleports, forces another player to lose an energy disk, and collects that disk all in one fell swoop. One by one, players are knocked out of the game until the remaining player wins.

73025.description:
When times are tough, as indeed they are just now, gather your friends and family around the table and cosy up for a few hours of traditional fun with Welsh Quest. Together you can rediscover your Welsh roots and the family values that really matter when you play Welsh Quest. An ideal way to spend quality time together. Be Welsh and proud of it!

Your Country, Your Heritage, Your Passion

Test your knowledge of everything Welsh and learn so much more by playing Welsh Quest. With over 2,000 Welsh multiple-choice questions in four different categories HISTORY, LAND AND NATURE, CULTURE and MODERN there’s so much to share and learn, and the accompanying booklet enhances the experience with further explanations for many of the more interesting and unusual answers. But beware! As you tour the country to collect the letters ‘Q U E S T’, Destiny cards may help or hinder you and you will need to earn sovereigns to help pay your way.

81225.description:
From the rules book:

Family kit contains five engaging games that combine U.S. geography with the math of numbers, data, logic, and strategy. The games are ideal for children 7 to 13 to play with parents, siblings, or friends. Children a little younger can play them with an adult or older child. The directions include ways to adjust the games to fit the age and experience of the players.

Games included are: (1) Guess my state; (2) Take a trip; (3) Guess my rule; (4) Capture states; and (5) Closest match.

(1) Guess my state - In this game, similar to "Twenty Questions," players ask questions to try to identify a secret state that one player has chosen. At the start of the game, the state cards are laid out face up. Players take turns tryin to identify the secret state by asking yes-or-no questions (e.g., Did it become a state in the 1800s? Does your state border Canada?). After each question is answered, the states that have been ruled out are removed from the layout. The player who narrows the layout down to the secret state is the winner. Use either the East or West cards, or for more of a challenge, play with all 50 state cards.

(2) Take a trip - In this game, players navigate around the U.S. by finding states that border one another. At the start of the game, one state card is turned up. On the first turn, a player puts down a state card that borders it from their hand of 3 cards. The next player puts down a card that borders that state, and so on. For example, if Texas is turned up at the start of the game, on the first turn a player could put down Oklahoma, since it borders Texas. On the second turn, a player could put down Kansas, since it borders Oklahoma. The game is over when one player plays all of their cards or no more cards can be placed. Use either the East or West cards, or for more of a challenge, play with all 50 state cards. May also be played cooperatively with all players' cards face up.

(3) Guess my rule - In this game,players try to discover a secret rule that one player is using to sort the states into two groups. For instance, a secret rule could be "borders on an ocean." States that border an ocean would go in one group; states that do not border an ocean would go in the other group. the Rule Maker selects about six states form the layout ans sorts them into two groups according to the rule. Players take turns trying to figure out the rule by choosing a state that has not yet been sorted and saying which group they think it belongs in. After three turns in a row in which players sort states correctly, they may begin to guess the rule. The first player to guess the rule wins. Use either the East or West cards, or for more of a challenge, play with all 50 state cards.

(4) Capture states - In this game, similar to "War,"players compare the states according to a certain feature. At the start of the game, players choose a state feature, such as year of statehood. On each round, all players put out a state card at the same time from their stack of face down cards. The player with the state that has the biggest number for the chosen feature (e.g., became a state most recently) captures all the cards played in the round. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

(5) Closest match - In this game, players use math to find states that are most alike. At the start of the game, players choose a state feature, such as number of libraries. In each round, they compare the states in their hand to a Goal state. For instance, if the Goal is Colorado, which has 253 libraries, they find the card in their hand of five cards that has closest to 253 libraries. They compare their chosen states, and the player with the closest of all takes the cards played in the round. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Contents:
- large map of U.S. for reference
- 26 Blue fact cards, one for each of
the states in the Eastern U.S.
(sorry, no Washington, D.C.)
- 24 Red fact cards, one for each of
the states in the Western U.S.
- 10 Wild cards
- 10 sample rules/question cards

77130.description:
Please note: this entry covers the 2010 release of Sid Meier’s Civilization: The Board Game from FFG. This game is unrelated to the similarly named 2002 Eagle Games Sid Meier's Civilization: The Boardgame.

From Press Release:

Before you lies a vast bounty of land, ripe for the plucking. Your meager beginnings will influence the paths you must take. Lead your people well and they will take you to infinite heights of greatness. If civilization manages to endure the ages, your name will hang in every whisper of its legacy...

Fantasy Flight Games is excited to announce the upcoming release of Sid Meier’s Civilization: The Board Game! Forge an empire to stand the test of time using innovative game mechanics with multiple paths to victory.

Will you lead the greatest army in the world to conquer your foes? Or will you be the first to journey to the stars, becoming the most technologically advanced civilization known to man? The choice is yours.

Designed by Kevin Wilson, Civilization: The Board Game is inspired by the legendary video game series created by Sid Meier. Players are tasked with guiding an entire civilization throughout the ages, taking ownership of your people’s technology, economy, culture, and military, as well as all the choices that go along with them. There are four different paths to victory, and each is riddled with opposition.

In Civilization: The Board Game, 2-4 players take on the roles of famous leaders in charge of historical civilizations, each with their own abilities. Players will be able to explore a module game board, build cities and buildings, fight battles, research powerful technology, and attract great people by advancing their culture. No matter what your play style is, there is a civilization for you!

Fans of Sid Meier’s classic video game franchise will find familiar footing in Civilization: The Board Game. Staying true to the foundations of its video game predecessor while creating a new and unique way to play, Civilization: The Board Game captures the spirit and grandeur of carving out a magnificent empire from modest beginnings.

Players start off with a single city, one army figure, and one scout, and from these meager origins you must forge through the ages and become the greatest civilization in the world.

Those unfamiliar with the video game series will find Civilization: The Board Game a great way to enter into the world of Civilization. The strategy and tactical decisions involved in Civilization: The Board Game will appeal to strategy gamers and war gamers alike, and the ability to win through culture and technological advancement will give those who only wish to focus on their own empire a chance at victory as well.
77130.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: A Társasjáték

73037.description: A dexterity children game in which players take turns to place as many glittering drops as possible on a flower. But they must beware -- when the drops are too heavy, they will lose balance and the flower will shake off the dew. The first player to place all of his dew drops on the flower wins the game.
73037.name: Csipp-csöpp harmatcsepp

76356.description:
Roll, bluff and play the night away with this super-cool set of "MONDO" Dice and custom cards.

The zippered Fuzzy Dice contain --
3 MONDO sized black/white dice
70 playing cards, numbered 1 to 18
3 "Cooler" cards, with a value of -10
3 "Dealer" cards: High, Low, and High/Low
and rules sheets for all 3 games ...
and OF COURSE...the FUZZY DICE...the perfect cool carrying case.

Hang them from your rear-view mirror, stuff them in your backpack, bring them everywhere! Fun for all your friends and family.

These Giant Fuzzy Dice contain 3 games inside...

- "Fuzzy Dice" -- a variation on "Liar's Dice" or "Liar's Poker". The dice are rolled, and players declare how many cards they have that match a single die or a sum of two or more dice. Later players either raise or call the claim. Whoever loses the call loses a card from their hand. The last player with cards wins.

- "Chuck-A-Luck" -- world famous betting Carnival betting game of chance. Players place a card from their hand next to High, Low, or High/Low, then the 3 dice are rolled. If their total is 13-18, players who bet High save their card in their winnings plus a card from the dealer; if 3-8, those who bet Low do the same; if 9-12, those who bet High/Low save their card but with no extra card. After all the cards are played out, players reveal their saved cards, and the highest total wins.

- "Good Riddance" -- a fast-paced elimination game. Players place a card from their hand face up on the table, and the 3 dice are rolled. Cards that match any die or sum of dice discard their card; if doubles or triples are rolled every player passes a card from their hand to the left; and any player who matches the sum of the dice gets a free roll and discards all cards matching any dice or sum. When a player goes out of cards, the rest total their remaining cards. The lowest total after a certain number of rounds wins.

72128.description: User summary: In each round of this card game, players simultaneously try to collect a set of four matching pizza-topping cards. Players start with four cards in their hand. The dealer takes a new card and discards any unwanted card from his hand to the player to his or her left. That player then discards to the left and play continues (the dealer continuing to pick up and discard) with the last player forming a discard pile in front of them. When a player collects a set of four, that player grabs a pizza box from the center of the table. There is always one fewer pizza boxes than there are players, so each round eliminates one player. Last player standing wins.

name.#text: Pizza To Go: The Pizza Pickin' Card Game

73046.description: The Shogun has offered your family the isle of Hokkaido for years of faithful service. But your patriarch is in failing health, and his sons must prove who is the most worthy of Hokkaido! Hokkaido is the second game in Blue Panther's "Trailblazer Series", following Nepal. Featuring quick gameplay, key decisions every turn, and just a little bit of conflict. Hokkaido is a strategy game with a Euro feel for 2-4 players that plays in an hour or less. Players take the role of a clan leader in feudal Japan, trailblazing trade routes and holding on to them in an effort to convince the Shogun that they are worthy to rule the isle of Hokkaido. Three actions per turn, seven actions to choose from including move, grow, sea move, claim public trade route, draw a card, discard, reveal private trade route. An important decision or two every turn, and never enough actions to get it all done. Conflict can be used, but sparingly, when a province is overpopulated. A simple and robust combat mechanic rewards players who plan ahead. Victory is won through control of key trade routes and area control. Population limits scale with the number of players to ensure a tight board for any number of players.

73047.description:
FROM THE PUBLISHER"S INTRODUCTION (EXCEPTS):

Skirmish! is a quick-to-learn, easy-to-set-up game of combat that can be played using almost any miniatures figures. The point of this game is to simulate small-scale battles and to play as well as possible and to have fun, win or not.
Skirmish! is intended for both veteran and novice players. It is simple enough to be a beginner's first wargame, and versatile and expandable enough to satisfy more experienced gamers, especially those who want to pull out some of their old toy soldiers out of a footlocker or the closet and use them in a game.

Skirmish! is designed for simplicity and playability. The basic rules can be read, a handful of soldiers selected, and a game set up in about 20 minutes, and in much less time than that for players already familiar with the rules. And, while their emphasis is on playability, these rules allow for consistency, taking the gaming action up at least a few steps from merely "playing soldiers".

Would-be hardcore gamers mau complain that these rules are not "realistic". Sure they are. They are just exceptionally streamlined, and in the spirit of "playing soldiers" are simple and flexible. There are no cumbersome charts or combat matrices, no supporting papaerwork to keep track of a game in play, and a minimum of simple tables. Most attacks can be completely resolved with a simple roll of the dice.

Anything beyond the basic rules is optional. With the incorporation of selected optional rules, Skirmish! can be made as complex as is enjoyable for the players. Most players will eventually, if not initially, want to use some of the optional rules.

From RPGnow.com:

This book is part of a thematic series of works on miniatures wargaming published by Skirmisher that includes the H.G. Wells books Little Wars and Floor Games, the company’s spinoff Little Orc Wars rules, and the Quactica miniatures rules.

81243.description:
User summarey: A party game of confession. The party chooses one act of "confession" that they all must make when faced with the question. The act of confession might be raising your hand, taking a sip of your drink or paying a coin when faced with a question.

Each player picks up a card and reads the text out aloud. An example might be "I have never dated more than one at the time". If a player find this to be true they do nothing, otherwise they "confess".

This is a social game and there are no "winners" in traditional sense, it is about knowing more about the fellow players.

77148.description:
Globalization brings the exciting world of big business into your living room. You are the head of a multinational corporation with one goal in mind: to make money. Outbid your competitors to acquire businesses within six different industries and grow your conglomerate. Streamline operating costs, build additional factories, sue your competitors or take one of your subsidiaries public for big returns. Your corporate strategy will impact which companies you buy and how to take your corporation worldwide. The synergy that comes from the right company combinations increases your perceived net worth. The first to reach a billion in net worth wins!    

In the age of Corporate Imperialism, only the strong survive.

81246.description:
The Game of Powers is a 'roll and move' design coupled with an 'economic light' engine.

Each player represents a World Bank that is trying to annex as many World Powers (countries) as possible. The player that has secured the greatest power by the end of the game is declared the winner.

Source: Taken from the introduction found in the rulebook.

73057.description:
Look on the back of your Koala Crisp cereal box - free game!

From the Game Rules:

In this game, you need to get through a typical day, trying to make some good, healthy choices along the way.

73058.description:
Look on the inside of your Panda Puffs cereal box - it's a free game!

From the Game Rules:

OBJECT: To get your animal off the "Endangered Species" list by advancing them off the board. Just like in real life, you're only going to get so far and then get sent back to square one. Hopefully, with a bit of luck and skill, you'll make your way to the top. Too bad it's not that easy for the real animals!

81255.description:
A card and dice tennis game.
From the rules: "Grand Slam is a cardgame where young and old can win an exciting tennis match on the kitchentable.

Preperation: Shuffle the deck of cards and place in on the table. Each player takes five cards each. Roll the dice to see who starts."

The starting player rolls the dice and depending on the outcome the serve is aimed at the forehand or backhand of the other player, or even an ace. Then it is up to the other player to return the ball by using a card from the hand which matches the forehand or backhand serve and lay it down on the table. Then the server plays a card to match the returning ball the same way.
The game is played this way until no player has a card on hand that can return the ball.
For each card a player lays down the player draws a new card.

63 Cards
1 d10
1 Scoringprotocol
Rules

73065.description:
Main Street in your town has just been incorporated into Route 66, the US highway system that links Chicago to Los Angeles. Can you manage to snag a piece of the tourist business pie? Will you build a motel or a cafe? How about a mini-golf and can you make money from your neighbor's giant ball of twine? Some of your family may work for free, but you will have to pay a higher wage to get the people in town to leave your competition and work for you.

Erecting neon signs and billboards, expanding current businesses, and annexing land to increase the size of the town (can we actually incorporate that huge canyon over there?) are all viable ways to make the most money before the interstate system opens and all the traffic bypasses the towns.

77162.description:
From the rules booklet:
A game of strategy and conquest in the Altara system. Your goal is to engage and beat the opponent's squadron of fighters.

This game is played on a three-dimensional gameboard of four levels. Each level is 49 hexes. One hex = 5000 km. The levels are separated by a distance of 10,000 km. By using the special four-sided die, you maneuver your fighters to engage the enemy without flying off the edge of the board - and out of the Altara system.

Two or more players can play this game simultaneously, each being in command of a squadron of fighters. A squadron may have one, two, three or four fighters.

At the start of the game, each fighter has eight energy units. Should the number drop to zero, the fighter is considered destroyed and must be taken out of the game.

The game is played in turns, each one being made up of three phases: Phase One - Movement, Phase Two - firing and Phase Three - damage assessment.

The special die is rolled - player rolling highest chooses to move and fire first or last in the phases. Damages are totaled and tallied on the score sheets. Movement can be done on the same level or the fighters may move up or down one level. Attack strength is determined by distance to the target.

The winner is the player with the last remaining fighter on the game board.

73070.description:
In the Ancient Greece, the poleis (city-states) thrived increasing their population and culture, occasionally waging war against each other, erecting buildings and celebrating ceremonies to get the favour of the deities abiding on Mount Olympus. The players will lead one of these city-states (like Athens, Sparta, Corinth, Thebes, Argos and others) expanding it and worshipping the various gods in order to become the hegemonic power of the Peloponnesus!

Olympus is a deterministic (i.e., non-random) strategy game, based on worker-placement, resource management and building an efficient engine to score victory points (VPs). It also features a few more aggressive options than the average game based on the same premises (but the savvy player knows how to defend against them, if he prefers to quietly develop his own position).

Each player leads a city-state that is defined by six values representing population, culture, military and productivity of the three resources (grain, venison and fish). During your turn, you send one of your three priests to worship one of the ten deities (Zeus, Hera, Demetra, Artemis, Poseidon, Athena, Aphrodite, Ares, Hephaestus or Apollo). Each opponent can now send one of his priests to celebrate the ceremony with you. After that, the deity grants his favor to whoever has sent a worshipper: the favor is larger for the leading priest (the one of the active player) and smaller for all the others (for example, Athena boosts culture by two points for the city of leading priest and by one point for the others; of course no boost is given to those who refused to send a priest to worship her). That deity cannot be chosen again in the current turn.

Since almost all deities are specialized in a certain field, the players must choose which ones they prefer to worship sooner (also guessing which ones may be of interest for the opponents and which ones are safer to skip as they will not be chosen until later) and when it is better to get a smaller benefit following the priest of another player rather than saving a priest to get a greater boon but in a field that may not interest them as much (sort of quality over quantity).

The resources your city produces (worshipping the correct deities) can be spent (worshipping other deities) to create buildings giving a variety of effects (and VPs), thus offering a lot of different strategic approaches to the game. Victory can be achieved with a plethora of buildings but also with very few ones. There are 45 different buildings: 33 can be built by anyone (even if someone else already did), while the other 12 are unique as only one copy of each can exist (introducing another element of contention between the players). You can also wage war to steal the resources of the other cities (if they were so foolish to keep their warehouses full and their military underdeveloped, it's just what they deserve) or invoke a terrible plague to decimate their population.

All the actions (development, production, building, war, scoring, etc.) are done by worshipping the proper deity (and some gods give you a choice like "do you develop your grain productivity – thus receiving more grain the next time you will produce it – or do you produce it now even if you won't get much?", adding crucial tactical decisions to the game).

When all the priests have been used, there's a brief upkeep to check some simple conditions (e.g., players with more than five unused resources must discard those in excess) and then a new turn begins (all priests return home and all deities can be worshipped again).

Being the first to reach the maximum value in a certain field (e.g. culture 10) gives you an award worth two VPs. When four of these awards are claimed, the game ends. Each player receives bonus points based on how developed his city is and the highest score wins.

81263.description:
"My first Triominos" (or "Triominos Junior") is the children version of Triominos.
Easy to learn for children and with colorful play tokens and pennylike counters it is fun to play.

Aim of the game:
Win as many reward counters as possible by placing the right Triominos next to each other.

Setup:
Give a rack to each player (included in the game)
Place all the Triominos in a pile (called the stock) with the numbers facing down.
Every player picks 5 Triominos and puts them onto their rack.
Every player gets 4 reward counters.
A random Triominos is picked out of the pot and placed open on the table. (If it's a joker, put it back in the stock and take another one.)
Select a player who begins the game (youngest....oldest).
The rest is playing clockwise.

Gameplay:
On his turn the player tries to fit one of his Triominos to the ones already on the table. A Triominos fits if it is placed so at least one side is completely in contact with another, and all sides that stick together must match in color and figure.
If you succeed in this, you will be rewarded with a counter. If you can not, then you must pay a reward count and draw another Triominos.
Your turn is then over, and it passes on to the next player.

Game end:
When a player places his last Triominos or the stock is emptied. The player with the most counters win.

Joker:
(Using the joker is not advisable for the first playthroughs.)
The joker counts as any figure or color and can be used anywhere a normal correct Triominos could be placed.
You can replace a joker on the table, with another Triominos that fits the position. If you do so, you can add the joker to your rack, but will not earn a rewardtoken.

2nd level of play (aged 6 and upwards), to become more familiar with counting points:
In this version of the rules, you play without the reward counters.

The only differences to the above rules are, that drawing Triominos does not cost you points, and points are counted as the total value of the figures on the Triominos you have placed. The score is then tracked throughout the game. The player with the highest score wins.

References:
The only place I have been able to find a digital copy of the game was here: https://www.gebruikershandleiding.com/Goliath-triominos-my-f... - here you can also see graphics of legal placements of your Trimonos.
81263.name: My First Triominos

73073.description:
A traditional trick-taking card game. Each player receives 5 cards. Beginning on dealer's left, each player has one chance to bid for the number of tricks they think they can win, or passes. The winner indicates trumps with the first card led, with standard trick-taking rules thereafter.

Scoring is 1 pt per trick bid, but a bid of all 5 tricks will be one of (in order):
- Nap (gain 10 points for a win / lose 5 points if you fail)
- Wellington (10 / 10)
- Blucher (10 / 20)

73074.description:
Rolls Race - The exciting new game of chance.

Rolls Race is a board/dice/card game Which is played in two parts. In part I, dice rolls determine which numbers will be eliminated from the "race". It is these eliminated numbers which determine the "point values" which will be paid into the "pot". Part II consists of the actual "race" to the top of the board. Players holding cards matching the first number to reach "home", are the winners, and entitled to split the "pot".

73082.description:
1) What is Sector?
Sector is a board game, for 2 to 4 players. The game is based on the strategic occupation of the game board. Taking turns, the participants role a normal cube die and place pieces on the board, according to preset rules. Some of the pieces, or some of the squares where the pieces can be placed, have specific properties that affect how that particular turn is played. Players who can't, in their turn, place the required pieces on the squares of the board are eliminated. The winner is the last surviving player.

2) What do I need to play Sector?
(a) A game board (15x15 squares), with special squares marked;
(b) 225 normal pieces and 20 special pieces (per 2 players);
(c) Nontransparent bag(s) or box(es) for the pieces;
(d) One cube (1-6) die.

3) Let's start the game. Who plays first?
Let the players throw the die and the person with the highest number goes first. After that, the turn proceeds clockwise.

4) What does each turn consist of?
(a) Roll the die.
(b) Take the number of pieces corresponding to the value obtained in that particular throw from the nontransparent bag and place the pieces, in a straight line, on the board. If you happen to draw a special piece or the last piece happens to end in a special square, certain other rules apply.

5) It's my first turn. I've rolled the die. Where should I begin?
In the first turn, all players start in any chosen square, on the edge of the board.

6) How can I place my pieces?
The pieces, always corresponding to the number obtained with the throw of the die, must be placed in a straight line. You are not allowed to turn in a different direction nor are you allowed to place one piece over another. The line, except obviously in the first turn, must always start from a preexisting piece belonging to the current player.

7) What are special squares?
Special squares are clearly marked squares on the board that have a unique propertie. When a line, in a turn, ends on a special square, the current player can place, if possible, an extra piece on any other free special square in the board. This only happens when the turn ends on a special square, not when it crosses a special square. The extra piece is only taken from the nontransparent bag when all other pieces are in place.

8) And special pieces? What are they?
Special pieces are distinctly marked pieces that allow the player to convert, if possible, adjacent opponent pieces into his own. They are mixed up with the normal pieces in the nontransparent bag and are taken, eventually, by chance, when the player is taking the number of pieces obtained by the role of the die or taking a piece for a special square as described above. Special pieces can be used at any point of the line and in any direction as chosen by the current player. The drawing in the special piece shows the allowed positions from which the opponent´s piece(s) can be converted into a player´s piece. In the drawing, on the piece, a dark circle represents the player special piece and the light circles represent the the allowed conversion positions.

Description from the author.

80447.description:
Designer Summary:

For ages, the studious inhabitants of Cogsburg lived without fear, happily ticking along as they went about their business. But now a freak accident has occurred at the Cogtower, scattering cogs all over town and sending the clockwork winders into chaos. The Cogmen must repair the Cogtower before it is too late.

Each player directs a handful of resourceful Cogmen to gather cogs and repair the Cogtower. Each turn, a Winding card will be drawn from the deck, and any Cogmen standing adjacent to a Winder will be wound up by that amount, gaining Energy. Once all the Winding cards have been used, a Rainy Day card is added and the deck is reshuffled. If a Rainy Day card is drawn, any Cogmen who don’t find shelter will get wet and rust (a terrible fate!)

Beginning with the starting player, players take turns moving all of their Cogmen, who must spend Energy to move. At the end of the turn, any Cogmen dangerously low on Energy (and not near a Winder) may make a Desperation move, one last push towards a Winder before becoming unwound. A Cogman that becomes unwound is inoperable until he is wound up by an ally.

Cogmen gather the cogs that are scattered about Cogsburg, returning them to the Cogtower to gain victory points, or he may choose to repair a broken/rusted Cogman instead. A Cogman can only carry a single cog at a time (They’re very heavy!)

Once the Cogtower has been rebuilt, final scores are tallied. Each player recieves one Victory Point for every cog they supplied to the Cogtower, plus an additional point for each operable Cogman.

The basic game is for two players. Rules for three players and four-player team play are included. Official rules for entirely cooperative play are forthcoming.

77034.description:
Cat & Chocolate is a card game set in a haunted mansion. Each turn, the active player must use 1-3 items in hand to avoid threats, such as a crumbling floor, erupting flames, or attacks by ghosts and the living dead. How can you use a cat and a piece of chocolate to defend yourself? How can a bankroll of money and rope help you escape unscathed? You tell me!

After you tell everyone the story of how you used various tools to ward off the threat, everyone votes on whether or not you succeeded. If a majority backs you, you keep the threat card; otherwise, you don't. Each player secretly belongs to either the Secret Society or the Cult, and you naturally want to vote for the players on your team, but no one knows who is on which team.

After a certain number of threats, the game ends, players reveal which group they belong to, and each group tallies the number of threats that their members escaped. Whichever side avoided more threats wins!
77034.name: 9 & Bancha

73087.description:
A free download-and-print board game released in response to the Deepwater Horizon oil spill.

From the game board: "Times are getting desperate at the Deepwater Horizon. The lies show no sign of running dry and the flow of bullshit appears unstoppable. Now you and a friend can play out the greatest ecological disaster in recent history and the goliath battle of BP vs. Public Opinion. Everyone knows that appearing to do something is far better (and a whole lot cheaper) than actually doing something. So, as BP, you’re going to do your best to spin your way to a healthier share price. As the public, you can bring a certain amount of pressure to bear upon the monolithic oil company - but maybe that’s exactly what sends their PR machine into overdrive? Can BP can be relied upon to do the right thing by themselves and fix the leak?"

73089.description:
From the rules book

In Airline: The 'Big Business' Game the goal is to run your airline in the most efficient, profitable way, enabling you to make more money than your competitor's airline. You buy, sell, and lease aircraft, plan and develop routes and detail jet aircraft in you race to the top.

This game is branded with air New Zealand - and all routes are in the pacific. The board looks like a monopoly board.

79083.description:
Dino Dig Challenge from Uncle Milton is a Battleship style game.
From the blurb on the back of the box "You're on a dinosaur dig, and the stakes are high. If you find all your opponent's Velociraptor bones, you win the game. Easy? Think again! You'll need to avoid dangerous tar pits as you build your Velociraptor with the excavated bones! The first player to excavate and build a complete Velociraptor wins!"

Players take turns to try to discover dinosaur bones using the same A-J, 1-10 grid references as Battleship. Key differences are that the bones do not have target points which consist of a single straight line and that the bones have preset positions to fit onto four 5x5 terrain tiles. Don't be fooled though, this preset position rather than destroying the game, as I expected actually makes it far more of a logical deduction game than a guess fest.

BTW the blurb about dangerous tar pits is just blurb. The game rules do not mention any tar pit effect.

name.#text: Dino Dig Challenge: Dinosaur Bone Excavation Game

81290.description:
A promo card for the game. This one and Harz IV were used as giveaways to bridge the gap between release dates of the base set and the expansion set for Igels.

It is an extra weapon card that adds 4 to SAP (small animal power) in a battle.

73099.description:
A trivia game. Players roll the two dice and move along the board. The board is devided in three stages, swimming, biking and running. When a player lands on a question mark, he/she has to answer a question. Each stage has its own category of question.
The first player who arrives at the finish wins the game.

Keser is a Dutch employment agency.

73101.description:
Dino, Pebbles, Bamm Bamm and Mr Slate have lost their stuff in Bedrock.
Players have to roll and move their character's to get the stuff back. Each character has lost four items. But the character's can only carry 2 items. Players have to put the items in the sheds of the other players.
The first player with an empty shed and arrives in Bedrock, wins the game.
73101.name: Familie Feuerstein: YABBA DABBA DOO

73102.description:
"Coins" is an all-new web-published game! It's easy, fun, and exciting! It only takes three people with a handful of coins each to play, there's no board and practically no time limit.
The full rules are in the forum, but here's a short summary:
Three players each choose a coin from their hand and reveal it to the others. The winner is the player who either played the middle coin or the different coin. F.ex. with 5, 2 and 1, the winner is 2; with 2, 2, and 5, the winner is 5!
It's that easy! Try it out, write your thoughts in the forum and join us on facebook:
http://www.facebook.com/home.php#!/group.php?gid=10204253318...;ref=ts

For other fun coin-games, check out Cognes:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/68480/cognes
... and Coin Clusters:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/70359/coin-clusters
Also, for a more traditional coin game that can be played in combination with these, try Spoof:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/18137/spoof
Another classic is Penny Football:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penny_football

77199.description:
'Blue Zone Hockey' is the third in our 5/6 System range of replay simulations, the others being 'The Beautiful Game' (soccer) and 'Rugby World'(Rugby Union), both available from www.owzatgames.com. It is also, incidentally, our first foray into the realms of North American sports, so it is with some trepidation that we launch this latest project, with phrases like 'bearding the lion in his own den'carrying coals to Newcastle' and, perhaps more appropriately, 'trying to sell ice to the Eskimos' springing to mind. But anyhow, despite what our great leaders tell us to the contrary (starting wars in other people's countries obviously excepted) life has to have some element of risk, so here goes.

This is a case of the title saying it all. 'Blue Zone Hockey' concerns itself only with the action in and around the net, strictly blue zone only. We wanted a quick-playing simulation - you already have some great detailed hockey sims out there in the lions' den - but we also wanted to capture at least a little of the excitement of top-grade ice hockey so we have adapted the 5/6 System to produce a game that takes only 6-8 minutes to play an entire match but one which also provides some blue zone commentary, covers such aspects as sin-binning, Power Play, Short-Handed play, injuries, Overtime and Empty Net situations as well as suggesting ways to identify goal-scorers and assists and even goal times if you want that detail.

What we don't provide are team and player details, you will need to do that for yourself. We have no intention of getting involved with the US/Canadian laws relating o the use of such information which, in this country thankfully, would be regarded as being 'in the Public Domain' and therefore not subject to the payment of Royalties. And long may it remain that way. We do explain, however, how you might go about all that.

Publisher Blurb

77200.description:
From the Rules:

All Time Championship Soccer lets you can relive the excitement, passion, glory and defeat of taking a national team through the World Cup. Choose from 64 national teams, representing that country’s best team ever to play in the World Cup. Each team is statistically generated to match its performance in the World Cup. Attempts, shots on goal, defenses, strategy, formations, yellow and red cards, corner kicks, penalty kicks, free kicks, injuries, key players, offside traps, marking players, long ball tactics, counter attacks, packed in defenses, home field advantage, hand balls, disallowed goals, bad calls by referees, penalty shootouts and sudden death are all present for you to maneuver through group play and the knock-out rounds with the hopes and dreams of making it ultimately to the Finals. All Time Championship Soccer is a strategic level game that still lets you make game changing decisions by selecting from 9 different formations, 3 distinctive strategies, and 7 unique tactics—all while allowing play of several games in a matter of minutes. Each game only takes 5-15 minutes to play, allowing you to play an entire tournament in a few hours. There are 6 levels of play: Basic, Advanced, Premier League, Tournament, Solo and Quick Play. However, each level is relatively easy to grasp and you should be playing a game within minutes of reading these rules.

Resolve the age old question of whether Brazil 1970 is the greatest team of all time. Rematch Germany 1954 against Hungary 1954 and try to recreate the “Miracle of Bern.” See if you can do the impossible—taking Dutch East Indies 1938 from qualification to the Finals!

81297.description:
In 1286, Alexander III, King of Scotland, died of a fall from a horse. None of his children who survived him, the Scottish lords declared his little daughter Margaret, then aged 4, Queen of Scots. But because of his age too young, the Lords put up a regency, the Guardians of Scotland for the administration of the kingdom until Margaret was old enough to reign.

Gathered in a meeting in Edinburgh Castle, with the referee King Edward 1st of England, the major Scottish clans will have to use their influence to get the honorary title of Regent, also known as "Guardian of the kingdom."

REGENTS is a placement game / majority where he must win the points of influence in areas key to the kingdom (political, military, religious, financial and trade). The dot gain sensitivity is based on a threshold to cross in order to progress making the game very tight. In addition to playing cards "ACTION" and a charge to make the ambience of the conspiracy.

77202.description: Starting anywhere along the Greenwich Prime Meridian player race to travel to six different continents to win the game. The game is designed to encourage children to learn about world geography.

77203.description: User review: Starting at the Panama Canal, the players, in turn, roll the die and advance one’s pawn on the gameboard orthognally. A player gets a Treasure Token by landing on it. Secret Squares bring an additional chance element to the game because they may or may not result in a treasure. The player with the most valuable treasures when the last Treasure Token is taken is the winner. The game is designed to encourage children to learn about world geography.

73108.description: In this Icehouse game, two players are racing their trios of pyramids in opposite directions along a five-square line. Pedestrians line the path to block you or your opponeent. During your turn, you roll a die and MUST use all your movement points that turn. You can move either your own pieces or the pedestrians. The first player to get their trio home first wins. Crosswalk may not look deep, but it is surprisingly fun and replayable.

77205.description: User review: Starting at Washington D.C. and moving clockwise around the track, the place race to score points and return home. Certain spins force the player to answer a simple question about US geography. The game is designed to encourage children to learn about US geography.

73110.description: Infiltrate is a quick strategic tussle. In this Icehouse game, two players build 15-point armies, and then try to get one of their units to the enemy's home row first. On each turn, you must move two of your pyramids. Each type of unit has special abilities. Smalls can only move by pushing another pyramid ahead of them. Larges can capture smalls or other larges. Mediums are uncapturable. With many options for army building, and a user-defined setup placement, it never plays the same twice.

73111.description: Quicksand is a deep brain-burning abstract for two players, played on a set of Martian Coasters. On your turn, you can either place a pyramid onto the board, or use a placed pyramid to capture other pyramids by jumping over them. After that, you MUST rotate one of the coasters, creating a volatile board that can radically swing the balance of power. The first player to capture 15 points of opposing pyramids is the winner.

81305.description:
Quarterback King is a board game which unites the sport of football and the game of chess into a fun, strategic game for two players. The game pieces are set-up in a traditional football formation, on a twenty-four square by ten square checkered football field board. The object of the game, like football, is to outscore the opponent. One player manages the offensive game pieces, trying to maneuver the quarterback towards the opponent’s end zone for a score (touchdown or field goal). The other player manages the defensive game pieces, trying to capture the quarterback or prevent its advancement toward the goal line.

Pieces are moved one at a time, similar to chess, beginning with the offensive team, then alternating to the defensive team. Each game piece is assigned a specific directional pattern of movement. Once a piece is captured it is removed from the game board. If the quarterback is captured, players switch roles, with the defensive team becoming the offensive team at the point of capture and vice versa. All pieces are returned to the board and play resumes.

Scoring: A touchdown is seven points; a field goal is three points; a safety is two points.

Game Timing: The game is played in two halves or four fifteen minute quarters. Each coach is allowed three timeouts per half.

Play timing: The offensive coach has thirty seconds to move a piece. The defensive coach has fifteen seconds to make a responding move, which makes for a fast-paced and pressure packed game of strategic fun.

This description is attributed to Cort Hubbard, the game designer.

73114.description:
From deep within the halls of Stonehold, the dwarven clans feel the Thunderstone's rumble… its calling power. Though opposed to interfering with the toplanders, the stoic clanmen elders know too well the trepidations of a Thunderstone falling to the darkness. As the dwarven clans join the fight, they are led by their brave sergeants, commanders, and champions, who bring impressive power while empowering others through heroic and determined leadership.

This set features a full playset of these promo cards:
x6 Clan Sergeant
x4 Clan Commander
x2 Clan Champion
x1 Clan randomizer

These promos are available through the BoardGameGeek Geek Store.
73114.name: Thunderstone: For the Dwarf Promo

81307.description:
From The Rules:

Woody is missing!
Let us run to the rescue! Nice cowboy disappeared. All toys have decided to organize a team and find a lost friend. It's difficult and dangerous job, on way awaits them a lot of surprises and bad ambushes. Take the challenge! Lean more about the disappearance and more friends will join your team, the greater the chances to find Woody and win!

To start the game
Choose a player token and place it on the "Start" field.

Objective
To collect the biggest amount of tokens - points.

Gameplay
Youngest player will start. You move by rolling the dice and collect token when moving. Every place on board has a token, until it is removed for some reason. Then the place get unactibe or contains a picture, which hold a surprise or a trap.

STOP - think about things and miss a turn
DICE+1 - Roll again to find Woody faster

+ 3 - step three extra steps

YELLOW STAR - take free token

The game has many paths to choose from. Some tokens contains special abilities like extra move or one less move, which help you to collect more token when you move around the board. When the last token has been collected, it means, that Woody now has been found and the race to the finish line now begins. While the race is on to the finish, player who lands one the DICE+1 space, can roll the dice and that to the final score or move the number rolled ahead. The first one to reach the finish will get all unused tokens next to the game board. If there aren't any left, can roll dice and take the amount of tokens from other players.

PS! Tokens with picture of Cowgirl, Woody and Buzz gives 2 points, while all the other ones 1 point.

Count the score and the one with the biggest score is the winner and hero who saved Woody!

81308.description:
Inspired by the old Getter Robo anime series, Getto Rocket is a 2-player combination DIY board game that plays very simmilar to Chess with a slight Stratego element to it. The rules and board are printed out from a PDF (the board and 10 pieces may be purchased from the game creator.) The board is a 5 wide by 6 tall illustrated grid of squares depicting the land the two sides are battling over. Each side has 5 colourfull rocket pieces each. 3 Rockets which can move 1 space forward back or sideways, 1 Pin which can move 1 space diagonal, and 1 Bomb which is stationary. These are arranged in 1-2 rows at opposite sides of the board. Each player chooses a "home base" and the objective is to either eliminate all of your opponent's pieces, or take and hold the enemy home base for 3 consecutive turns. Any piece can eliminate any other piece by attacking first. Both are removed if the Bomb is attacked.
The game also comes with 4 different Modifier Cards, 2 of which are randomly dealt each player at the start of the game. At any you may play one of your cards to the board so that it covers any two spaces that you either occupy or are currently free. Each card effects pieces differently. Such as allowing the Rocket to move diagonally while on those two spaces.
Additionally about 1 in 10 games are packed with a special Shifter piece that is randomly swapped for one of the other pieces. The Shifter can move in any direction, can occupy the same space as another friendly unit, and can transport those friendly units with it.

81310.description: A car racing simulation for 2-12 players. Players advance their cars around the track by rolling 2d6, changing lanes only in designated space.
