If there are instructions in the space where the car ends its turn, the player must follow the directions in that space (draw cards, move forward, move backward, etc). Different sets of cards allow players to take different actions such as using a pit stop, changing lanes, advancing their car or incurring penalties. Winner is the first across the finish line after a predetermined number of laps.

73119.description:
Contents 23 dice, some with numbers all the way around, some with mathematical symbols all the way around.
3 minute Egg timer
Cup

Turn the egg timer over and roll however many dice you wish. Try to make a true mathematical equation with as many dice as possible, while rerolling whichever dice you wish. When the timer stops, score a point for each die in the true equation.

example. "10 + 6 = 11 + 5" is worth 7 points

73121.description:
From the Designer's own description:

"The Tiltyard is a sort of multi-round trick taking game, somewhat like a cross between the Sedma Group and a beating game. The game is themed around jousting events (the lance, the axe, and the sword) so there are three rounds with two "passes" each. One player leads a card and the other must play a higher card of the same colour, or a matching card of the opposite colour, or pass. If they play a card, then the trick continues and the other player faces the same three options. This continues until someone passes, the other player captures all of the cards played to the trick. At the start of the game, each player chooses 3 Royal Favours (court cards or Aces). These cards can be activated at the beginning of a round to impart a special ability to the owner (for instance, a Jack adds +1 to the value of all cards of its colour). They also determine which cards will be used for scoring your captured tricks: only cards of the majority colour within the 3 Royal Favours are counted."

All you need to play are the rules (PDF file) and a standard deck of cards.

77219.description:
To play this game, one person acts as the examiner with 2 to 5 people acting as doctors taking the exam. The examiner shuffles the cards and the players in turn take the card and answer the question. The card may require them to answer a multiple choice question, to place an organ or bone sticker in the correct position on the body diagram or to examine the patient in an appropriately professional manner. Cards are worth varying amount of points depending on the difficulty of the question. The player with the most points at the end wins.

From the box:

The interactive medical knowledge quiz.

A side-splitting medical quiz game complete with bone and organ stickers to place on a fold-out body diagram.





Thrilling life or death situations, and the chance to prod and poke real live patients.



Discover whether you are destined to be a brilliant brain surgeon or a half-witted hypochondriac.


Featuring:

52 quiz cards
fold-out body diagram
wallet containing 12 stick-on body parts
32-page concertina book, with bonus questions, quiz answers, score assessment, suggestions for alternative careers, and gory after-dinner medical facts.

name.#text: ... is there a doctor in the house?

77221.description:
"A Game of Chance With Lots of Action"

Any number of players may participate in the game of BANK ROLL - the more the merrier. The box is used as the POT to hold the play money. At the start, each player contributes $5 in play money to the POT. Then, one player spins the arrow. If the arrow stops on a PAY section, he pays to the POT the amount designated...

Whitman Publishing Co, Originated by the Hollywood Amusement Co

73127.description:
Can you make it through the rapids with a whole crew?

Place one of your rafts at the "Put In" point and try to maneuver it through the pockets to the "Take Out" point. Your crew is represented by steel beebees, and they fall out of the bottom of the rafts if you cross over one of the pockets.
You score a point for each of your crew who make it to the other side. Once both of your rafts are safely ashore, your opponent takes their turn.

73130.description:
CAPITAN is a new concept of Napoleonic simulation game, which can be played by both the neophyte and the Napoleonic “grognards”

If you do not have figures we can endeavour you to build your own small units, if you already have them congratulations (28mm, 25mm or 15mm. no problem with the scale or the basing system), you have infinite game possibilities with CAPITAN

Do not think CAPITAN is a “skirmish” game, it is a game system based on the infinity of battles during the Napoleonic wars.

The Combat

CAPITAN is a selection of rules designed to play battles between small groups of troops, such as advance recognition, convoy escort, guerrilla actions, raids on small towns, border posts, incursions into enemy territory, actions against advanced camps, and all those situations where specific tasks were assigned to a few troops of their units.

The troops

In most cases these clashes included small combination of infantry and cavalry, where the training and preparation of the troops was important, unlike the big battles where the big formation groups and the way they were formed was very important (column, line, square, etc.). The gameplay is frenetic and highly addictive.

81323.description:
"In Joris en de Draak you play as a knight with fire and water! Be smart when heading for the great battle with the dragon. On your way you'll collect the powers of fire and water, fight duals with other knights and follow your own route. Collect a helmet, shield and sword so that you arive at the dragon in full strength. The first player to defeat the dragon is the hero and winner of the game."

The game is played on a circular board. In the middle of this board the dragon, which has to be defeated, can be found. The players start on different positions on the board and try to collect fire and water cards as well as an outfit. When a player thinks he has enough resources to fight the dragon, he may go to the middle of the board and start a battle. You have to hit the dragon three times before it is defeated. In between the hits you may return to the board to collect more cards or to expand your outfit.

Joris en de Draak is a board game based on a roller coaster of the same name which can be found in the Efteling. Therefore the game will only be sold in the Efteling as a souvenir. You can also buy the game at the webshop of the Efteling. Please note that the game is currently only available in Dutch.

77228.description:
This is a Monopoly game
From the back of outer cover:

Warning:Playing Quikopoly may be addictive. Do not operate heavy equipment while playing the game. Playing Quikopoly while consuming alcoholic beverages may cause severe mood swings, headaches and nausea. Children under 12 should not be allowed to play the game as adults may become depressed when the child wins the game. Quikopoly dollars are not legal tender and may only be used to purchase merchandise at QuikTrip competitors.

74313.description:
October Meiji 1st, the remaining force of Edo goverment landed on Hokkaido and declared that they are an independent new government of Ezo-republic.
But, April Meiji 2nd, the new Tokyo government decided to eliminate this small unauthorized new country.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Hakodate

The battle of Hakodate is the very last episode of Bakumatsu which ended the long continued Edo govenrment and opened the new age of modern Japan.

The game uses
1 map
80 counters
20 cards
1 rulebook

Basically modified version of card-driven game and played in 2 hours.
74313.name: Hakodate Sensou

73150.description:
From the publishers website:
Savage warriors, the Lizardmen of the jungles of Lustria are vigilant in their fight to restore order to the world, but their enigmatic motivations make them uncertain and often dangerous allies. Meanwhile, the Vampire Counts, from their gods-forsaken castles and fortresses, lust after the power of the mortal races. It is this willful ambition that gives them their power over the dead, and those armies of Order that refuse to surrender to the Vampire Counts in life may come to serve them as mindless slaves in death.

March of the Damned is the next deluxe expansion for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, and it will bring new strategic depth to your deck-building experience when it hits store shelves this fall.

With 165 cards (3 copies each of 55 cards) consisting of new deck-building options for players of all factions, March of the Damned brings, as neutral forces, the mysterious danger of the jungle-dwelling Lizardmen and the foul dark arts of the Vampire Counts to Warhammer: Invasion. March of the Damned also introduces two new keywords, 'Savage' and 'Necromancy', bringing a new level of strategy to your game.
73150.name: Warhammer: Invasión – La Marcha de los Malditos

73151.description:
Convoluted - it sounds complicated. But it isn't.

Convoluted is a card game that can be picked up in minutes and then enjoyed for hours. Complete the word 'Convoluted' while using action cards to disrupt your opponents. Why not steal their best cards? Or just destroy anything you don't like the look of. To throw a spanner in the works take some cards from play, shuffle them and deal them back out at random.

Play as nicely as you like but if you have a mean streak it might just help you win. Play with two to four players or shuffle together multiple copies of the game to play with even more people.

73152.description:
Bio-SNEAKERS is a multiplayer card game. Mankind has been subjugated by machines and the planet is ruled by an all controlling AI (artificial Intelligence) The object is to to hack the ruling AI and destroy all its core mainframes. If even one of the mainframes survives then all the players lose.
There are various ways of hacking the mainframes and doing it stealthily will give you control points. If you have the most control points at the end of the game then you will control the machines and rule.
The rules are only one page in length.
There are 9 pages of components required for the full 5 player game but only 5 pages of components are required for a 2 player game.

73153.description:
Fairly abstract, ligthly themed game on Crusades.
Basically each player has a fixed number of crusaders (pieces with variable strength - defined by the players using force points and speed points). With these crusaders the players will try to gather as many victory points as possible through:
- battles - fight other crusaders and take their points off (variable points)
- relics - bring back relics to their own camp.
Each player has a fixed number of action points each turn.
The board is modular defining a new landscape for each game, with different positions for relics. The landscape give bonus points in battle or add more difficulty in movements.


The Crusades were religious, military, political, and commercial expeditions against both rival religions and rival Christian groups. They helped European society define itself and they laid the groundwork for end of feudalism. One of the outcomes of the Crusades was the production of many religious relics.
In this game the crusader crusaders are fighting for relics. The players incarnate the crusaders struggling to find more relics then the others. They will be the commanders of their crusaders.

81347.description:
Sliding Puzzles Turned Into a Board Game!!

Game consists of 4 15-slide puzzles attached to the box bottom. In the top of the box there is a wheel with different solutions. When the top is placed under the bottom, the different configurations show through slots, and the players compete to make their slide puzzles match the examples. The first player to finish calls "Fidget Digit!" Each win counts 5 points.

"An exciting fun-packed game, for all age groups, with no loose parts to lose. May be played anywhere...even in a moving car, train, plane or bus."

"The object of the game is to duplicate on the sliding squares the example shown in the window alongside. To start the game, turn the dial one stop clockwise. The first player to finish calls "Fidget Digit!" From box.

73156.description:
It's about money, trade, wine, salt, grain, profit, buying and selling, time, sins, plague, witches, murderers, beggars, inquisitors, Knight ........

The aim of the council is to appoint a new Pope. Anyone who has at the end of the game on the most electors, may name the new pope and is the winner of the game.

---

Es geht um Geld, Handel, Wein, Salz, Getreide, Gewinn, Kauf- und Verkauf, Zeit, Sünden, Pest, Hexen, Mörder, Bettler, Inquisitoren, Ritter........
Ziel des Konzils ist,einen neuen Papst zu benennen. Wer am Ende des Spiels über die meisten Wahlmänner verfügt, darf den neuen Papst benennen und ist Sieger des Spiels.

73163.description:
OSKI is simple word game for two players. Game can be played as paper and pencil game - no tiles are required. Game can be played almost in any language.

Game is played on hexagonal board with 19 fields. Initial word has three letters and is written into central three fields. Player on move create some word from existed letters and from new letter added to board. Player score according to length of word. Player with higher score win game.

73171.description:
After 500 years, two factions emerge from their underground cities into a new world, an Earth reborn from nuclear disaster.

12 highly detailed miniatures represent the two factions which are:

NORAD: military in thinking and origins. Scientists, engineers, add to their strength.

SALEMITES: occultists working with cadavers, bringing the dead to life.

Soon after emerging, these two factions meet - and it is determined that they cannot live together in peace.

Earth Reborn offers nine scenarios that take you through missions of rescue, retrieval, and escort through areas of labs, mansions, towns, and more. Each scenario builds upon the rules of a new chapter: the game system is built like a tutorial. There are core rules to start the game, and each chapter offers 1-3 new rules along with a scenario that uses these new rules.

The game also contains the innovative S.A.G.S. (Scenario Auto Generating System), where 2-4 players can make their own maps and mission objectives for near infinite replayability!

Other features include:

A Tetris-like board construction using polyomino floor tiles.
An order tiles system to give commands to your miniatures.
Interrupt Duels with Bluff, betting command points to interrupt an enemy character and act during another player's turn.
The I.P.S. (Iconographic Phrasing System) that allows almost any effect to occur with icons, totally language independent.
Colored base arcs on miniatures to simplify Line of Sight, shooting, and close combat. It also multiplies characters’ variations and possibilities.
The Search rule, giving a visceral feeling to searching in rooms to find equipment.
A Mission Points track that also serves as a Morale Points track.
Radio Scrambling to mess with your opponents' orders.

73172.description:
The meandering path game.

Wend-loop is a path building game for two or more players. Players place tiles to build paths, and move their pieces along paths, sometimes jumping onto another path. The object of the game is to score the most points by completing paths containing your piece.

Contents
4 Player pieces
A set of 35 Playing tiles

Wend tiles are square in shape, and have 2 path entry/exit points on each edge. They each have four path sections which go from one path entry/exit point to another. When placed side by side, the path sections from one tile join up with those on the adjacent tile, to create meandering paths. There are 35 Wend tiles in a set, which includes one copy of all possible different combinations of 4 path sections on a tile.

A single set of 35 Wend tiles is enough for a good game with 2-4 players. You can use extra sets of Wend tiles to accommodate more players or for a longer and more challenging game with a small number of players.

77269.description: The board features a Football (Soccer) pitch on 1 side and a Rugby League / Rugby Union pitch on the other, each being a 28 x 19 grid covered with symbols (letter pairs and crosses) which allow special movement and passing options. Rules are provided for each of the 3 codes. You place your team of men onto the board (ie 11, 13 or 15 counters) into standard starting positions and kick off. Generally a turn is to move one of your men 1 space (with the option of passing the ball), but trying to take advantage of the board's special options to progress down the field and score a goal / try, while your opponent moves their men into defensive positions to tackle (hop over) and regain the ball.

73184.description:
Published in first issue of Dragon Hobby magazine.

The expansion provides new map with four scenarios and two new commander tokens (Thokoly and Mehmed whose statistics are changed as compared to Wiedeń 1683).

There are only minor changes in the rules mostly covering charges. The changes make the game more dynamic than original Wiedeń 1683.

73188.description: A dexterity game in the same vein as Mr. Mouth. A basketball backboard with baskets on both sides is placed in the middle of a turntable. While the backboard spins around, up to four players try to launch balls into the baskets using small catapults. The first player to get all six of their balls into the baskets is the winner.

73189.description:
The children's game Mauseschlau&Bärenstark: Weltreise features the lovable cartoon characters in a race around the world. The mouse and bear answer questions about geography, culture, flags, landmarks, and much more!

The whimsical spinner has two sides: one with pictures and another with text. The game is designed to be enjoyed by kids of all ages with different play levels.
73189.name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark auf Weltreise

73190.description:
from the rule book

Contenent: 16 large cards; 16 small cards; 16counter;
1 playing piece; 1 die.

Object of the game:
Players need to find the hidden Disney friends and collect counters to win the game.

How to play:
Place the large cards with the illustrated side face up to form a square. Place the small cards so they are also face up in the middle of the square.
The first player start throwing the die and move the playing piece around the large card in a clockwise direction. The Disney character you land on indicate the small card you must turn over in the middle. This ends the turn.
When you land on a large card that has alredy had the matching small card turned face down, you have to remember where this card is and find it. If you find it, you may take a counter, the first player to collect 4 counter win.

80862.description: A small, postcard-sized expansion, containing twelve 4-points souvenirs and a special Joker tile.

81385.description:
Players take turn rolling the dice and moving their race car the appropriate number of spaces following any instructions on the space they land on. Yellow spaces on the track will have the driver take an Official's Choice card that will alter the race (out of fuel, flat tire, spin out, engine trouble, drafting pass, lane shifts, and more). First driver to complete 3 laps is the winner.

Contents include: gameboard, 6 race cars, 6 sets of flags, 6 flag stands, 63 Official Choice Cards, 6 six sided dice, and rules
81385.name: Crew Chief Challenge

81386.description:
A strategy game for 2 players, 10 years old and more

By properly placing your pawns,
You will generate chain reactions
That will destroy all your opponent's pawns!
Except if the opposite happens...

Goal of the game
Remove all of your opponent's pawns.

Game components
A 19-hexagons boardgame
35 pawns, one side white, the other side black.

Game mechanism
The player who starts the game is randomly determined.
The first player places one pawn of his color on an hexagon he chooses on the first circle (the circle of 6 hexagons around the central hexagon).
The opponent places a pawn of his color on another hexagon of the first circle.

From now on, each player will place a pawn of his color on his game turn by applying the following rules:

a player cannot place a pawn on the central hexagon,
a player cannot place a pawn on a hexagon on which there are already 1 or 2 opponent's pawns,
a player can place a pawn on an empty hexagon if it touches a hexagon on which he already has 1 or 2 pawns,
a player can place a pawn on a hexagon on which he already has 1 or 2 pawns.




Explosion
If, at the end of his turn, a player has 3 pawns on the same hexagon, an explosion happens: the 3 pawns are distributed in a Y shape on contiguous hexagons, and pawns that may have been on covered hexagons before the explosion now belong to the player.

Chain reaction: successive explosions
It is possible (and it is even the good way to win!) that, after this first explosion, other hexagons have 3 pawns or more of the player's color. The player must proceed with the explosions until there is no more hexagon with 3 pawns or more, or until there are no more pawns from the opponent (he has won in this case!).


The player must start with one of the hexagons having the most pawns on it (it is possible that there are 4 pawns on the same hexagon).
After each explosion, if there are still possible explosions and pawns from the opponent, go back to step 1!


End of the game
The game ends when a player has no pawns left on the board. His opponent is the winner!

81389.description:
The game contains 12 sets of four tiles showing items belonging to a particular profession. The cards are color-coded, so there is a blue, a red, a yellow and a green tile for each profession.
One color is picked out and the 12 tiles are placed openly on the table. Each player picks one of these.
Then players take turns flipping open a tile from the draw stack. If the tile belongs together with that player's first tile, he/she can keep it. Otherwise it is openly discarded. The next player can take it if he/she needs it, then draw a new tile as usual. When a player thinks he/she has 4 matching tiles, the tiles are placed on top of a large plastic cube. A mirror shows the backside of the tiles - if these form a picture of the profession, the player keeps the set.
When all sets have been distributed, the player with most sets is the winner.

The game is themed for the a German children's TV show called "Die Sendung mit dem Elefanten"

(User summary by HilkMAN)
81389.name: Le cube des 12 familles

73203.description:
This is a children's game based on the Barney's Great Adventure movie.

Players leave the barn with Twinken's Rainbow Egg and move along the track by matching colors. The kids have adventures as they visit the circus, watch a parade, etc. Cards instruct the children to find colors or play let's pretend.

Players collect star chips for following instructions correctly. The kid with the most score chips when the players reach the finish line is declared the winner.
Includes a colorful puzzle-cut board, a plastic Barney, the egg, star tokens, a spinner, cards, and the rules.

73204.description: Shed is a clever trick-taking game for 2-5 players that fully utilizes all of the unique characteristics of the Decktet Game System. Players start the game with a pool of tokens matching the Decktet’s suits and then they try to get rid of them through careful trick taking. The first player to shed all of his tokens is the winner.

73205.description:
Description from box:

The little mouse who's hungry for cheese
Must avoid the cat and the old lady's broom
Help him to escape through the mousehole with ease,
Or win all the cheese that's there in the room.

User Summary:
The mouse is pulled back and wound up, then released from the center circle. Where will he land? Will you win 1-4 pieces of cheese (get 8 on your cheese board and you win!) or will you get the broom or the cat? If the mouse gets out through the mouse hole past the cat you win automatically.

73206.description:
In this color decoding, star gathering, trick playing game you gotta be the first to match your various colored Star Cards with the Code dealt and use special PLAY cards, switch abilities and Black Wild cards to change the round in your favor. Obtain five wins and the game is yours!

Color-Coded is simple to learn! Each player is given a specific code of colored stars they need to match using the colored cards in their hand. Match the code and you move on to the next, match five and you win the game!

There are special cards to help tip the balance in your favor. Use the Black Wild Cards which can be used for any card in your code. PLAY cards grant abilities like switching, trading, and even destroying your other players hand and code! When nothing else can be done, you can at least tempt fate by using SWITCH, which forces all players to choose a card from their hands and pass it to their left, maybe the card you need is just around the corner?

The best part is no matter where you are in the game, additional people can join in the fun! Simply deal then a hand and give him a code. Who knows, the winner may have just arrived!


of Players: 2-6


Game Time: 45 min.

Includes:
* Star Cards Deck (80 cards)
* Code Cards Deck (40 cards)
* Color-Coded Rules Document

73207.description:
An extra large magazine/supplement to make up for the 'year without ASL' (1994), containing articles and scenarios. It came with an outer cardstock cover that had overlays for Deluxe ASL; however, these turned out to be printed at the wrong size


( from the Table of Contents:)

Airborne Samurai by Steven C. Swann
Annual Crossfire by Robert Banozic & Mark Nixon
Warriors All! by David Payne
The Chestnuts of Normandy by Jim Stahler
En Garde by Chuck Goetz
The Gentle Art of Routing by Steve Tinsley
The Scenarios of Normandy by Jim Stahler
Series Replay: Festung St. Edouard by Steve Peterson, Brian Youse & Chuck Goetz

Scenarios:
A68 Acts of Defiance
A69 Broich Bash
A70 Wintergewitter
A71 Patton's Prayers
A72 Italian Brothers
A73 Not Out of the Woods Yet
A74 Valhalla Bound
A75 Medal of Honor
A76 Night Drop
A77 Hide & Seek
A78 Prelude to Breakout
A79 Mike Red
A80 Commando Schenke
A81 They Fired on Odessa...
A82 Orange at Walawbum
A83 Last of Their Strength
A84 Endless Struggle
A85 Airborne Samurai
A86 Fighting Sparrow
A87 The Grand Canal
A88 Surprise Encounter
A89 First Day of Diadem
A90 Cutting Out a Strongpoint
DA13 The Mailed Fist

81400.description:
Quick play English Civil War wargame played with regiments of foot comprising of 18 figures and cavalry comprising of 6 figures. The turn sequence is activated by cards, and units move and shoot using a straightforward system. There is no casualty removal until a full base has been destroyed. Ideal for 28mm plastic ECW games.

Includes special events for each game, and a variety of optional rules. Rather than an in depth analysis of Seventeenth Century warfare, Victory Without Quarter plays as a pleasant game with toy soldiers, without getting bogged down in too much detail.

73210.description:
De Twaalfde Man is a simple roll-and-move game. It was given away at EMTÉ Supermarkets (The Netherlands) for the 2010 World Cup.

The game recuires 1 die and a miniature from 'Het Oranje Legioen' per player. 'Het Oranje Legioen' are small, orange supporters you can collect at the supermarket.

The board is a soccerpitch on which players move their pawn. On different fields a special situation happens - always with a soccer background: a yellow card, an off-side, free kick, etc. The winner is the one who - on the last field - kicks the ball in the right corner (by throwing the die).

81405.description:
Rules for the North American Indian Wars, covering the period from the French and Indian War to the last stand of the Sioux at Wounded Knee. The Eastern Woodland, Plains, Rocky Mountain and South-Western tribes and their British, French, Spanish, Mexican and American opponents are all catered for. Based on the mechanisms used in Death In The Dark Continent.

The game aims to represent fairly large scale battles instead of the skirmishes usually played out with Wild West games. The rules come complete with a quick reference section, contents list, and army lists for all the major combatants.

name.#text: Too Few To Fight, Too Many To Die

81410.description:
Try to collect your house (9 pieces), buy it, fix the mortgage get the key.
Game published for a real estate company.
Game material :
1 game board, 72 cards (36 black & 36 green), 4 pawns and 1 dice.
By going around the boards outer ring, you must collect cards which you can save (to assemble a complete house set for which you receive a key card) of to discard.
After that you have to collect a buy card and an mortgage card, together with the key card and by doing this claim the win.

81413.description:
Publisher's description:

It is a board game with a story that goes along with it. Six teenagers dare each other to stay overnight in the spooky Dread House in their neighborhood. And in this game, the house really is haunted!

Dread House is a horror game for spooky children and brave adults. It's a role-playing board game in which you play teenagers who've dared each other to spend the night in Dread House.

Who will run home to their mommy?

What thing yet lives in the mansion?

Will the sunrise ever come?

Only you can answer these questions.

Your PDF will come with:


The Rule Book;
Six Character Sheets;
Six Monster Sheets;
Six Monster Cards;
A deck of 22 Spooky Events;
A deck of 22 Useful Items;
And a map of Dread House (in three parts).


Some assembly and a Jenga set required.

As the teens explore the house, the players draw cards and describe to each other spooky things the characters see and useful things they discover. Each teen has special abilities that can help them explore and help each other stand up to the Monsters.

The teenagers are scared by many things in the house. When their character is scared, the players pull blocks from a Tower of blocks to see if their character stays in the Dread House. If the Tower falls when someone pulls, that person gets to play a Monster in the house who scares the others.

If half the kids get scared away, the Monsters win and the teens have to try another time to prove their bravery. But if the card for the Sunrise is found while enough kids are still in the house, they have made it through the night!

73228.description: Hecho is Spanish for "made" or "done". In this fast-paced trading game, contractors are pitted against one another competing for various construction projects. Use materials from the community scrapyard and trade with one another for the right combination of cards to complete available projects. The turnless, free-form nature of the game-play makes for a quick and chaotic fiesta for the whole family.

73230.description:
From the Decision Games' website:

When Pakistan declared itself independent from India, the enmity that had long existed between the two cultures erupted into open war. Since 1947, Pakistan and India have been military rivals and have fought several wars. Those wars, however, have been inconclusive. Since 1998, both nations have become nuclear powers and, consequently, the next Indo-Pakistani war could potentially become nuclear. Indeed, another war between Pakistan and India may be the final showdown.

Showdown utilizes the new Fire & Movement combat system that's designed so players can augment their units with "support fire" during the course of the turn. From attack helicopters to self-propelled artillery, units can receive support to engage enemy positions and formations, allowing combat to develop at all levels. Showdown also introduces a new and disconcerting element: tactical nuclear weapons. Both Pakistan and India now have sizeable nuclear arsenals, and thus what begins as a conventional war may erupt into a nuclear exchange.

In Showdown, the attritional design of the new Combat Results Table simulates the true nature of modern warfare. Units are typically two-sided formations that can incur casualties, accurately replicating the realities of combat and the high losses likely to be sustained during another Indo-Pakistani war. Winning the battle is thus a matter of maneuver, firepower and asset management, particularly with regard to nuclear weapons.

73231.description:
From the box top,

Contains all that is needed to play Ancient Wargames on the move!,
set includes: Rules, Magnetic playing surface and terrain,
Dice,
Two measures &
Two painted and magnetised armies!!

User:

Players compete with two preselected ancients armies to be the first to out fight their opponent by destroying four enemy units whilst losing less of their own units. Each player has a camp which counts as two units if captured and a general who is equivalent to four units.

The scenery is fully magnetic and offers a myriad of battlefields. Scenery includes river, hills and rough terrain, all of which greatly affect unit capabilities.

The two painted ~2mm scale armies offer varying units including; cavalry, knights (including chariots), elephants, archers, pike and psiloi.

This original version includes Alma Wargames Easy-peasey Ancient Wargames Rules a simplified derivative of De Bellis Antiquitatis 1.2 and offer rules for flanking and unit depth.

All units and scenery are magnetic and battle is joined within the box which has a green battle area with magnetic storage.

This is truly a travel miniatures wargame which can be played on the move.

81424.description:
A new Death Trap for Thunderstone, This promo card came with Wrath of the Elements from the FLGS.

This is a Death-Trap card. The letter which came with the promo cards says to tell the players to add the card to their Death Traps when creating the Dungeon Deck.

It destroys the Hero card in your hand with the lowest strength. It also forces the other players to reveal the top two cards from their decks and all revealed Hero cards are destroyed except those with the highest strength.
81424.name: Thunderstone: Blade Trap Promo

73233.description:
From the Decision Games website:

At the start of the 1973 Arab-Israeli War, the Israelis could only spare two brigades to defend the strategic Golan Heights. On 6 October the Syrians attacked with five divisions, three of them mechanized, supported by mortars, artillery, mobile SAMs, and a heliborne commando brigade. The Israelis were therefore badly outnumbered, but were quickly reinforced by reservists (much sooner than the Syrians had anticipated). More significantly, the Israeli Air Force appeared overhead to impede the Syrian assault. However, the Syrians' surface-to-air missile batteries proved at least partially effective against those aircraft. Thus, among other things, the battle for the Golan would test the preeminence of air support against the ascendancy of the SAM.

Golan utilizes the new Fire & Movement combat system that's designed so players can augment their units with "support fire" during the course of the turn. From artillery to air strikes, units can receive support to engage enemy positions and formations, allowing combat to develop at all levels. But Golan also introduces a new element to the battlefield: surface to air missiles. The Syrians fielded numerous SAM batteries during their advance, downing many Israeli jets and compelling that air force to implement new tactics. A single armor battalion, for example — perhaps supported by air support — could be tasked to assault a lone enemy commando brigade defending a fort. As that attack gets underway, though, the air support may find itself under fire from a mobile SAM battery. More support will be necessary to take the fort, but assets are limited.

In Golan the attritional design of the new Combat Results Table simulates the true nature of modern warfare. Units are typically two-sided formations that can incur casualties, accurately replicating the realities of combat and the high losses sustained by both sides during the Yom Kippur War. Winning is thus a matter of maneuver, firepower and asset management.

81427.description:
Civil War Commander is a card game, in which you are a Brigidier General for either the Union or the Confederate army. You have command of 5 regiments consisting of infantry companies, artillery batteries, and cavalry troops.
Your mission is to hold 5 sectors of terrian either by defending or capturing them. How you deploy your given troops, how you use your reserves, and the abilities of your regimental commanders will determine the outcome.
Win and you'll be a hero and may be promoted. Lose and you may be removed from command. Such is the life of a CIVIL WAR COMMANDER.

(From Publishers Website)

73236.description:
From the Decision Games' website:

By August 1950 the North Korean Army had overrun most of the Korean peninsula, and was advancing rapidly toward Pusan, the last open port in South Korea.

The US Army hastily formed a perimeter along the arcing Naktong River to stop — or at least delay — the final North Korean breakthrough. Every available US unit in Korea, including a Marine brigade, was thrown into the fight against three North Korean infantry divisions converging to crush what became known as the "Naktong Bulge."

Naktong Bulge utilizes the new Fire & Movement combat system that's designed so players can augment their units with "support fire" during the course of the turn. From fighter -bombers to artillery, units can receive support to engage enemy positions and formations, allowing combat to develop at all levels. A single recon company, for example — perhaps supported by howitzers — could be tasked to assault a lone enemy infantry battalion defending a mountain pass. As its attack gets underway, however, the recon company may find itself under fire from heavy artillery. More support will be necessary to take the pass, but assets are limited.

In Naktong Bulge the attritional design of the new Combat Results Table simulates the true nature of combat during the Korean War. Units are typically two-sided formations that can incur casualties, accurately replicating the realities of combat and the high losses sustained by both sides during the Korean War. Winning the battle is thus a matter of maneuver, firepower and asset management.

73237.description:
Front Cover:

Brawls from the dawn of time until the age of black powder.

Inside the rulebook.

"Swordplay" is a set of rules. Written to provide a universal set of skirmish rules, from the dawn of man up to the beginnin of black powder weapons. It covers the sword and sharp pointy stick type of warfare best.
At the end of the book are provided some historical period details to get you started. It is planned to provide details for other periods at a later date.
The rules are written to provide a more "Hollywood" type of game rather than historical accuracy. So if you were brought up on a diet of swashbuckling heroes, and dastardly villains these are the rules for you.

User,

Exhaustive individual character skirmish rules including horses. Includes scenarios for Maldon 991 C.E. (Viking vs Saxon), Ambush Wars of the Roses 1461 C.E. and Bar Room Brawl France 1627 C.E.

81430.description: In "É Hora de Votar!", players assume the role of voters and politicians. Each round, two players try to win the votes of the others, by promising to build parks, schools, hospitals etc. But everybody has a secret agenda, and to win an election a player must try to do what the majority of the voters want. The first player to complete all his secret and open goals wins the game (text created by the game's designer).

81431.description: "Bakugan: Torneio dos Mundos" is a contest to see which player can win more tournaments in the 6 worlds of "Bakugan Battle Brawlers". Each round, a world is randomly chosen. Players then select one Bakugan card from their hands, and then one "special effects" card. All variables are added up and the owner of the most powerful Bakugan places a token on the world where the tournament was played. The first player to achieve a number of victories wins the game (text by the game's designer).

81432.description:
PocketStalingrad is a print-and-play game for two players (see the files section below). By David Laufle The game is free, and might even fit in your pocket.
It's 1942 in war torn Russia, head into the besieged city of Stalingrad and fight your way to victory in 30-45 minutes. The game uses several dice. Roll the dice and set aside unit deployment, tactics, events or command points, using at least one die per roll. Add units to the 5 major city locations or to Gumrak Airfield or the Volga Crossing, add in Fortifications, Pioneers, snipers, infiltration, Luftwaffe attacks, night, Guards and more; and you have yourself a battle.
Control of 3 of the 5 major locations by turn 5 is a winner, otherwise the most City Areas wins.

families: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge
73241.description:
From the Decision Games' website:

The initial onslaught of the Germans' Ardennes offensive, in December 1944, overran numerous US positions all along the front line, though the Germans simply bypassed other stubbornly defended locations so as to maintain their momentum. The small town of Bastogne, however, with its strategically critical road junctions, became the lynchpin of the entire campaign. The Germans soon realized Bastogne had to be captured; so they set out to assault the outnumbered and surrounded American units there. The desperate defense of Bastogne therefore came to typify the entire Battle of the Bulge.

Bastogne utilizes the new Fire & Movement combat system that's designed so players can augment their units with "support fire" during the course of the battle. From anti-tank units to mortars, units can receive support assets to engage enemy positions and formations, allowing combat to develop at all levels. A single recon battalion, for example — perhaps supported by artillery — could be tasked to assault a lone enemy battalion of paratroopers defending a hamlet. As that attack gets underway, the recon battalion may find itself under the guns of enemy artillery. So more support fire will be necessary to take the hamlet, but assets are limited.

In Bastogne, the attritional design of the new Combat Results Table simulates the true nature of battles in Europe. Units are typically two-sided formations that can incur casualties, accurately replicating the realities of combat and the high losses sustained by both sides during the actual fighting for Bastogne. Winning the battle is thus a matter of maneuver, firepower and asset management.

Re-implements:

Bastogne: The Desperate Defense, December 1944

73242.description:
From the Decision Games' website:

Saipan was a critical objective in the US Navy's "island hopping" campaign in the Pacific; its two airfields were suitable for heavy bombers. Hence three US divisions were scheduled to invade Saipan on 15 June 1944, supported by nearly two-dozen battleships that had begun a bombardment two days before. More than 30,000 fanatic Japanese were entrenched on the island, dug into caves and other formidable defensive positions. The battle for Saipan proved to be one of the fiercest battles of the Pacific War, and the deadliest up to that time for both sides.

Saipan utilizes the new Fire & Movement combat system that's designed so players can augment their units with "support fire" during the course of the turn. From naval bombardment to bazookas, units can receive support to engage enemy positions and formations, allowing combat to develop at all levels. A single engineer battalion, for example — perhaps supported by flamethrowers — could be tasked to assault a lone enemy infantry regiment defending a plateau. As its attack gets underway, however, the engineer battalion may suddenly come under fire from enemy mortars. More support will be needed to take the plateau, but assets are limited.

In Saipan the attritional design of the new Combat Results Table simulates the true nature of the battles in the Pacific. Units are typically two-sided formations that can incur casualties, accurately replicating the realities of combat and the high losses sustained by both sides during the actual fighting on Saipan. Winning the battle is thus a matter of maneuver, firepower and asset management.

Re-implements:

Saipan

73243.description:
(from the Decision Games' website:)

By February 1943, much of the inexperienced US II Corps had been deployed along the trails leading through a small canyon known as Kasserine Pass. The US commander, Gen. Lloyd Fredendall, had overextended his lead units, dividing them into individual, unsupported packets while disregarded his flanks. Rommel was quick to recognize the opportunity to inflict a defeat on the untested Americans, and he soon mounted an offensive with two panzer divisions.

Kasserine utilizes the new Fire & Movement combat system that's designed so players can augment their units with "support fire" during the course of the turn. From artillery to dive bombers, units can receive support to engage enemy positions and formations, allowing combat to develop at all levels. A single recon battalion, for example — perhaps supported by mortars — could be tasked to assault a lone enemy infantry regiment defending a ridge. As that attack gets underway, however, the recon battalion may find itself advancing through a minefield. More support will be necessary to take the ridge, but assets are limited.

In Kasserine, the attritional design of the new Combat Results Table simulates the true nature of the battles in North Africa. Units are typically two-sided formations that can suffer casualties, accurately replicating the realities of combat and the high losses sustained by both sides during the actual fighting at Kasserine Pass. Winning is thus a matter of maneuver, firepower and asset management.

81436.description:
The game is based on a Japanese light novel, Durarara!!
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durarara!!

One of the 500-yen games produced at Game Market 2010 in Tokyo, Japan. The deck consists of 15 each of three different color cards without numbers. These three colors represent three factions. You play and draw almost all the cards in front of you. The last three cards in your hand determine which faction you belong to: Blue, Red, Yellow or Daraas. You only score points if the faction you belong to is the one that most number of players belong to. In that case, you score the number of non-faction colors in front of you (For Daraas, the scores are fixed points). Clever little game.
81436.name: Dararara!

81437.description:
There are 5 pet shops in the game, each offering a specific pet (dogs, cats, rabbits, parrots and chameleons). Players are trying to amass the largest collection of pets by claiming pets from the pet shops.

The game is played over a several rounds, each of which goes through the following 4 phases:
1. Supply - The pet shops randomly gains new pets.
2. Donation - The players each donate a new born pet to the respective pet shop.
3. Claim - The players attempt to claim older pets that the pet shops are giving away by bidding. Pet shops give away older pets to the first customer that wants them. However if more than one customer wants to claim the same pet, they will decide to keep the pet to avoid a confrontation. However, if one of the claimants can provide a more conducive shelter for the pet, he will be given the pet during a confrontation. This phase will recur until all the pets in the shops are given away or the players all decide to stop claiming pets.
4. Birth - The players' pets give birth to new born pets.

Play continues through the 4 phases in each round recurrently until the deck runs out.

At the end of the game, players tally the number of pets they have as well as check who has the most shelters for each type of the pet. The player with the most shelters for each type of pet takes a penalty(loses some pets) as they are deemed to have too many shelters and thus insufficient space for the pets to live comfortably. The players with the most pets for each pet type gains a bonus (gains more pets of that type). After applying the penalties and bonuses, the player with the most pets win.

81438.description:
Back of the Box:

Players are rulers of rival kingdoms. Everyone wants to develop its power to the best of his ability and at the same time undermine and thwart the plans of the rival.

Each player, during the game, will build five stacks of cards in front of his/her, one representing each facet of his/her reign:

- Buildings
- Army
- Espionage
- Commerce
- Knowledge

For each category there are three types of cards:

- Score cards (points)
- Attack cards (delete the score cards)
- Defence cards (protect from the attack)
Some Attack and Defence cards don’t belong to a specific category, but have instead show a jester(Mercenary). Those cards can be played on any of the five stacks, to the player’s will.

The game ends when a player has a score card in the top of each category, or when a player's deck is empty.

Each player sum all valid score cards and the extra points earned by combinations. Who have more points is the winner.

(by automatic translator from Chinese)

WZY 2010 Board Game Awards - Best 2-Player Game (China)

81439.description:
Game in Vae Victis 93.
This game covers the spy and misinformation operations organized by the Allies around setting up the D-Day. The Allies will try to hide the real D-day landing location while the Germans will try to discover it.
The two players (German and Allies) will chase each other on a chess like board.

The game contains :
- 2 maps
- 26 counters
- 20 cards

77344.description:
Navigate your submarine through the murky depths to find sunken treasure in the new LEGO Atlantis Treasure. Fire at obstacles and block other explorers in a deep sea quest where only one sly sailor will triumph!

Be the first player to collect three golden treasures to win the game (four if you are less than four players). Place compassbricks on the board to navigate your sub in the right direction -or place a compass brick to divert one of the other players. -or roll a torpedo and fire at another sub and take one of their treasures...
77344.name: Atlantis Treasure

73249.description:
From the Decision Games' website:

The Blue & Gray classics are being updated with a slight change in scale to 352 yards per hex, an updated game system that treats unit differences more accurately, and a combat system that includes step losses.

The Union Army of the Cumberland had been pursing the Confederate Army of the Tennessee after the Battle of Perryville, in October 1862. Throughout November the Confederate commander, Braxton Bragg, had misinterpreted that pursuit as an effort to capture Chattanooga; so now he halted and deployed his troops northwest of Murfreesboro, Tennessee, so as to safeguard the road junction there. Thus the Confederates sat and awaited their pursuers for a month. When the Federal army arrived in late December 1862, the Confederates launched a surprise attack near Stones River.

Stones River utilizes the all-new Musket & Saber Combat System, which presents a simple yet accurate portrayal of warfare during the American Civil War. The combat system is intuitive, including all the details that characterized battle during the Civil War while also simulating the unique aspects of 19th century warfare. Units can become weakened and rout; attackers can pursue, and the fortunes of war can intervene at any time. Cavalry can rip open enemy lines and shred fleeing units, and reserves must be ready to plug holes or secure a line of retreat.

In Stones River a new Combat Results Table emphasizes playability while also simulating the lethality of the rifled musket. Leaders accelerate the action, replicating the importance of their presence during battle, and supply lines require players to protect their logistical trains. Winning a battle will depend on deployment, maneuver and massing firepower, as well as the strengths and weaknesses of each particular army.

name.#text: Stones River: Turning Point in Tennessee

73250.description:
From the Decision Games' website:

The Blue & Gray classics are being updated with a slight change in scale to 352 yards per hex, an updated game system that treats unit differences more accurately, and a combat system that includes step losses.

Once again the Union Army of the Cumberland was in pursuit of Gen. Bragg's Army of the Tennessee, after the Confederate withdrawal from Chattanooga. Bragg's actual intention was to stand and fight. In fact, this time — indeed, for the first time — his army, heavily reinforced, actually outnumbered his pursuers. As the dispersed Federals deployed along the Chickamauga River, large numbers of Confederates assembled to strike the counter-blow. The Battle of Chickamauga would be the Confederates' last opportunity to annihilate an entire Union Army.

Chickamauga utilizes the all-new Musket & Saber Combat System, which provides a simple yet accurate portrayal of warfare during the American Civil War. The combat system is intuitive, including all of the details that characterized battle during the Civil War while also simulating the unique aspects of 19th century warfare. Units can become weakened and rout; attackers can pursue, and the fortunes of war can intervene at any time. Cavalry can rip open enemy lines and shred fleeing units, and reserves must be ready to plug holes or secure a line of retreat.

In Chickamauga a new Combat Results Table emphasizes playability while also simulating the lethality of the rifled musket. Leaders accelerate the action, replicating the importance of their presence during battle, and supply lines require players to protect their logistical trains. Winning a battle will depend on deployment, maneuver and massing firepower, as well as the strengths and weaknesses of each particular army.

73251.description:
From the Decision Games' website:

Napoleon was, by 1813, the victim of his own success. His Grande Armée had ransacked most of Europe, but then the Prussians, Austrians, Russians, Swedes and others converged their armies, collectively known as the Sixth Coalition, around Leipzig in an attempt to annihilate Napoleon once and for all. The coalition commanders knew they had to approach cautiously. Napoleon had previously defeated each of those nations' armies, and had demonstrated a remarkable ability to overcome unfavorable odds before. At Leipzig, however, Napoleon was heavily outnumbered, and the princes of Europe realized there might never be a better chance to vanquish him and finally end the Napoleonic Wars.

Leipzig utilizes an all-new Musket & Saber Combat System, which provides a simple yet accurate portrayal of Napoleonic warfare. The combat system is intuitive, including all the details that characterized battle during the era while also simulating the unique aspectsof 19th century warfare. Units can become weakened and rout; attackers can pursue, and the fortunes of war can intervene at any time. Cavalry can rip open enemy lines and shred fleeing units, and reserves must be ready to plug holes or secure a line of retreat.

In Leipzig a new Combat Results Table emphasizes playability while also simulating the lethality of musket and bayonet engagements of that time. Leaders accelerate the action, replicating the importance of their presence during battle, and supply lines require players to protect their logistical trains. Winning a battle will depend on deployment, maneuver and massing firepower, as well as the strengths and weaknesses of each particular army.

73252.description:
From the Decision Games' website:

The Napoleon at War classics are being updated to a brigade-level system with artillery largely in separate units.

After crossing the Alps in 1800 and advancing into northern Italy, Napoleon overextended his army in an attempt to ambush a portion of the Austrian army. Misreading the situation, the hunter became the hunted when the main Austrian army in Italy, over 30,000 soldiers with 100 cannon, advanced against Napoleon's 18,000 troops and dozen cannon on the Marengo plain. Perceiving the danger, Napoleon urgently summoned his reserves and wayward detachments, bringing his strength up to near parity with the Austrians. It was just enough to forge victory from a potential disaster.

Marengo utilizes the all-new Musket & Saber combat system, which provides a simple yet accurate portrayal of Napoleonic warfare. The combat system is intuitive, including all the details that characterized battle during the Napoleonic era while also simulating the unique aspects of 19th century warfare. Units can become weakened and rout; attackers can pursue, and the fortunes of war can intervene at any time. Cavalry can rip open enemy lines and shred fleeing units, while reserves must be ready to plug holes or secure the line of retreat.

A new Combat Results Table emphasizes playability while also simulating the lethality of musket and bayonet engagements of that era. Leaders accelerate the action, replicating the importance of their presence during battle. Supply trains and headquarters help armies function smoothly, forcing players to protect their logistical base. Winning a battle will depend on deployment, maneuver and massing firepower, as well as understanding the strengths and weaknesses of each particular army.

families: Battles of the Ancient World Series
73253.description:
(from Decision Games' website:)

Throughout the mid-5th century AD, Attila's Huns terrorized Europe. The skill of the Hun horsemen, particularly their accuracy with the composite bow while mounted, made them a veritable shock army. They continued to bring victory after victory to Attila, making him the master of Central Europe. After years of conquest, oppression and extortion, however, Attila's recent invasion of Western Europe would be challenged: a remnant Roman army, under the command of Flavius Aetius, was sent to stop him on a field known as the Catalaunian Plain, near the village of Chalons. The Battle of Chalons would decide the fate of Europe.

Chalons utilizes the tried-and-true Battles of the Ancient World system, providing a simple yet accurate portrayal of ancient warfare. The combat system is intuitive, including all of the details that characterized warfare in the era of sword and shield. Various units may simply be swordsmen, while others may be archers or javelin throwers, horsemen, etc. The system includes rules for leaders, charges, melee, diversionary attacks, demoralization and more. A group of barbarians, for example, may be ordered to charge an enemy phalanx that had already hurled their javelins. As the barbarians near the phalanx, however, they may be ambushed by enemy ballistas hidden behind the ranks and waiting to disrupt just such a charge.

In Chalons the traditional design of the classic Combat Results Table emphasizes playability while also simulating the true strictures of ancient warfare. Famous leaders, such as Attila, also influence combat, replicating the importance of their presence during battle. Winning will depend on deployment, maneuver and opportunity, as well as the strengths and weaknesses of each particular army.

Contents:

17 x 22" (43 x 56 cm) terrain map
100 die-cut counters
One Standard Rules booklet for this series
One Exclusive Rules booklet for this title

73254.description:
Children's card game in which players take turns drawing a card, then placing as many cards from their hand as possible to form a picture of a donkey. The full picture takes 8 cards, however the tail card must be placed last.

If all the draw cards, known as the "stall," are taken, then players start passing cards one player to the left until someone completes the picture.

Packaged in a box the size of a standard deck of cards.
73254.name: Tail the Donkey

73255.description:
From the rules: In this game you play the part of a hero that goes into a dangerous maze to look for a great treasure. The maze is full of monsters called Maziacs who will try their best to kill the hero. Fortunately they're not very intelligent, but can be deadly if you're caught off guard...

The game uses tiles to build a new random maze each play and mechanics to create a unique path towards the treasure. This path is slowly uncovered by the player by asking prisoners that can be found randomly through the maze. Also, the Maziacs will appear randomly and try to kill the hero, but as long as he has a sword, he'll be safe. There's also a mechanic that will adjust the chance of a new Maziac appearing based on the number of Maziacs already on the board and the distance from the exit.

In the end, it's all about beating the game system, either as a solo or cooperative game, trying to maneuver through the tight corridors fooling Maziacs into dead ends and finding the correct path to the treasure.

The game is based on the great ZX Spectrum game "Maziacs" programmed by Don Priestley. He was kind enough to allow the designer of this game to use the same name.

73257.description:
From the box:

(The Family Board Game for the over 10s with a touch of merlin's magic.)

Similar to snakes and ladders, but with card drawing, money and set collection.

The Objective of the game is race around the board and collect enough jester tokens and money before reaching the exit.

Players take turns to roll dice and move around the board, landing on spaces can have good or bad effects. Players continue moving around until they have collected enough jester cards, jester tokens and money to win the game, however jester cards and money are often needed to pass special spaces, to help you or to hinder your opponents.

77354.description:
You are Generals of Oda Nobunaga. You have to prepare for wars against your enemies.

Lord Nobunaga is also prepared to fight.

A Great battle will soon begin!

After each attack is resolved, you or Lord Nobunaga will get Victory Points depending on the deed that has been accomplished.

After two wars have been fought, if you have the most VPs among the Generals in the game, you win. But if Nobunaga has gathered the most VPs, all of the Generals lose the game. Thus you must not only compete for Victory Points but you must also cooperate each other in order to get more Victory Points than Nobunaga.

Component
Clan cards: 60 (6 clans by 10 cards)
Nobunaga card: 1
Leader card: 1
77354.name: Nobunaga

73259.description: This is a dexterity "aiming" game where you flip plastic/rubber cats to cause chain reactions. It can be played solo, but it is intended to be played in a competition set-up with increasingly complex chain reaction set-ups. While the game doesn't specify a maximum number of players, six is the highest number that would not have too much downtimes between plays.

81453.description:
Prepare yourself for a fierce duel. Cleverly use the features of the four different families to snatch the most valuable gangsters away from your opponent. Your goal? To have the best gang at the end of the game.

In Famiglia, the players collect gangsters with the goal of collecting the highest-valued gangsters. With the exception of the 0-value gangsters, a player normally needs two identical gangsters (same family and same value) to be able to take a gangster with the next highest value of the same family. When a player does this, they place one of the smaller gangsters from their hand into their play area. To get higher-valued gangsters faster, the player may use the special abilities of the different families at the cost of placing more gangsters in their play area. By doing so, a player may reduce their options and so must carefully plan these actions in order to end the game with the most influential gang.
81453.name: Famiglia

73262.description:
From the box:

Find again Maestro and the figures from the animated series "Once Upon a Time... Planet Earth" and everything concerning sustainable development. The game includes 2200 questions regarding water, energy, recycling, global warming etc.

A game of co-operation: The players try to save the planet by means of co-operation. The purpose of the game is to get the planet rid of pollution and save the endangered species. The players must fight together the catastrophes created by nature and man.

Family game: There are four levels of difficulty so that children and adults can play together.
73262.name: Il était une fois... Notre Terre

73263.description:
From the box:

"The egg shakes and bursts in laughter in your hands - and you are out of the game.

20 subjects and the wheel of fortune determines the first letter. Start the egg and circle it from one player to another. But you can pass it on only after giving a correct word.

The remaining players continue until there is only one left. A new subject, a new letter, start the egg and continue playing. 5 different variants. Also good for on the road."

Muna is Finnish and Ägget Swedish for "The Egg". The game is basically board and timer driven variant of the "Ship Comes Loaded" game.

73264.description:
STORYLINE: Somewhere in an old funfair, Little Charlie owns an attraction that features a special kind of trampolines. Far from being a childish game, the tournaments he arranges provide a challenge for memory, tactics and intuition. Will you be able to set clever traps for your opponents while avoiding to get caught in theirs... or even yours?
MATERIAL: AN 8x8 board, 48 tiles and 4 counters in different colors.
TRAMPOLINES (TILES):Charlie´s trampolines do not allow to jump the way the user pleases, but only in certain directions (according to the arrows inscribed in the tiles) which are revealed just when they are trodden on. The arrows are in three colours: green (1-space jump), orange (2-spaces jump) and red (3-spaces jump). Besides, there are two types of arrows: one-way (self explanatory) and multidirectional (the user may choose among two o three possibilities). Finally, there also exist two ‘fake’ trampolines that once occupied will tumble down and will make the player lose its counter.
GOAL: To be the last player remaining on the board, the rest having fallen in a hole or being forced to jump out of the trampolines field.

77361.description:
Take 12 cards and a camera with a timer (a tripod is usefull to).
Read a card that describe what players must do in front of the lens and then press the button. Being in the air, hold their hands, being cut by the photo borders.

On each photo we count points, the player with the most point win the games.
77361.name: Photo Party

81461.description: This is a 10x10 chess variant with a unique mix of pieces. The king, rook, knight, and pawn are common to chess and shatranj. The hero and shaman are short range pieces easily as powerful as the rook on a 10x10. These two inclusive compound pieces may step one and/or jump 2 squares, either or both, in either order, changing direction between step and leap if desired, with the hero moving orthogonally and the shaman diagonally. The final piece in the game is a war elephant, the equivalent of an unchained padwar from Jetan, a piece that may move 1 or 2 squares diagonally, changing direction if desired between the first and second steps. The combination of strong and weak pieces, of different ranges and abilities, allows a strategically and tactically rich game with piece balance and variety. The opposed pairs of hero vs rook and shaman vs war elephant provide an intricate series of checks and balances between the pieces.

73272.description:
The game board is an 8x8 grid which consists of 16 groups of four holes. Each hole is assigned a number between 1 and 4 (same alignment on the entire board). Each player has 16 playing pieces in his/her color.
At the beginning, the players take turns rolling a four-sided die and can place one of their pieces in any of the holes with the number that was rolled. The aim is to form squares and lines of four pieces either completely in one's own color or in two colors (two pieces each, together with another player). A single color square or line counts 2 points, a shared one 1 point for each of the involved players.
When all holes of one number are filled, the die is put aside and the players place the pieces at their discretion for the remainder of the game (thus the luck factor is eliminated and the game proceeds as a pure abstract strategy game.
When all the holes are filled, the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
73272.name: Bravodi

73273.description:
You’re sitting on your deck under a cloudless day, when the phone rings. You answer it and a voice says “God calling, build an ark.” Before you can react, it hangs up. You look out your window to see storm clouds rolling in. You’d better get going!

God Calling: Build an Ark is an irreverent game that combines the biblical story of Noah and the Great Deluge and the timeless tradition of crank calls. Be the first to gather your Animals, Wood, and Nails, but be warned, everyone else wants the same, and competition is fierce!

Each turn, players play Supply cards, trying to fulfill the minimum requirements for their ark: three Wood cards, three Nail cards, and three Animal cards. However, everyone also has God Calling cards that aid or hinder the players, making them require more cards to complete their ark, discard cards, or counter other God Calling cards. Play is fast and frantic, as players play their cards as fast as they can.

73276.description:
This boardgame for the Yvio console consists of three different games for up to 8 players, for the first time introducing interactive cards in addition to the yvies. Those games are
1. Quizit: A kind of quiz show with multiple choice questions and three special rounds like identify a letter which is reveiled in parts, a true-or-not true question round and an action round for the player who is last.
2. Doshi Doshi: Card game where you have to react fast and place a card who matches the shape Yvio shows or the colour the Asian moderator is mentioning. If you hear "doshi doshi" first the card mustn't fit the colour and shape.
3. Tortenschlacht: This is a card game for two teams in which you try to throw cakes into the face of players of the other team.
(user summary)

73277.description:
Warring States is a light strategy game taking place during the Japanese warring state period (15th to 17th century). Players customize their armies and then fight for supremacy over five key locations.

Turns occur by players secretly choosing two of their units and sending them to one of the five locations of their choice. When both players have units at a location, they are revealed and a battle occurs.

The game ends after five turns. Whichever player controls more points worth of territories is the winner.

72311.description:
In ASMV, players 'invest' in the construction of connected regions, while attempting to predict their final size, sabotage opponents' plans, and squeeze into the spaces left behind.

Each turn, a player uses one of their own number tiles, and a color chip from a common supply. Most often, they will place both in an empty space on the board, subject only to the restriction that they may not create a connected region of a single color containing two or more tiles showing the same number. Alternatively, a player may remove one color chip from the game, and place their number tile face down on an empty space, preventing it from being part of any colored region. At the end of the game, every connected region has at most one number tile correctly describing the number of color chips composing that region: the owner of each such number tile scores its face value in points.

(description provided by designer)

73280.description:
From the publisher's website:

American Throttle, The Game is in a few words, a “Poker Run” that tours the United States. It’s about having some drinks, some fun and some laughs. Share stories of rallies you’ve been to like Laughlin, Sturgis or Daytona. Belch a name, take a swig of your drink, tell a joke, name that song, guess who was in that biker movie, or even give unwanted advice! Test your knowledge of motorcycling, motorcycle trivia, and road skills. You can even invite your family or friends who don’t ride, since they can play to win too! They will learn a lot about riding either from you or this game!

There are two ways to win: finish first to win half the game, draw the best poker hand to win the other half of the game. It’s smarts and luck. This is a drinking game, so it is geared toward adults. However if you forego the alcohol and let young adults in on the fun, American Throttle is actually a general audience, sometimes educational, definitely fun game for them too. In other words, we didn’t put in a bunch of junk. This is about riding!

Here is how it is played: Up to seven players or teams of players per game. Put money (or anything you would like) in the Pot. Pick one of 15 motorcycle playing pieces & take your first poker card. Start in the upper northwest and roll the die to tour the country. Pick another poker card at each rally you visit. The person to reach the end, or Hollister Rally first wins half the Pot. The person with the best poker hand wins the other half of the Pot. So, anyone can win! Oh yeah and it makes a great Christmas gift for the biker, the game player, or the person who has everything (because they probably don’t have one of these).

73286.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned. And this woman was spurned by the devil himself!
This book offers expanded rules for one-on-one duels, experience and veteran troops rogues and downtime between campaigns. A Fist Full O' Ghost Rock also features three full campaigns for Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars:

A Fist Full O' Ghost Rock features 'The Gal with no name' takin' on Enforcers from every rail baron at once.

Trail O'Blood is the tale of the huntin' of Ben Stern's band o' thugs, an you'll be followin' em to perdition itself!

The Many Tasks of Grimme forces the players to vie for the favour of Reverend Grimme in the City of Lost Angels.

A Fist Full O' Ghost Rock also features an innovative system for secretly briefing players so no-one can ever be sure exactly what's going to happen and a number of new troops for Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars.

name.#text: Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars – A Fist Full o' Ghost Rock

73288.description:
From the back of the box:

From the makers of Smart Ass, comes a brand new trivia guessing game - Dumb Ass!.

It's a new way to play your favourite board game, with all new categories. With Dumb Ass, the all new 'Which', 'How' and 'When' question categories can produce multiple winners nearly every turn... Plus there is also the favourite 'Who', 'What' and 'Where Am I' question categories included as well.

Like Smart Ass, everyone plays all the time and it's a quick game, but there are new and exciting twists as well...

Play the game where the Smart Ass can lose and the Dumb Ass can rule supreme!

Contents

* Playing Board
* 12 Dumb Ass Playing Pieces
* 2 x 12 sided dice
* 48 Answer Tokens
* Rules Sheet
* 420 Question cards
o 100 Which
o 100 When
o 100 How
o 120 Who/What/Where
o Rules

73289.description:
Translated (badly) from the French website...


BattleSpeed is a set of figurines whose combat are held in a universe where the wars became réality-show. The holographic television channels show, on line, the battles in which all the species of will oppose; universe. Among these transmissions of reality-TV " BattleSpeed" , on the holochanel Carnage Network, is looked by the accros of holovision: holo-adds. In the play, you are a chief unit and direct a unit of combatants. When you play part of BattleSpeed, you take part in a Premium of this transmission. Carnage Network retransmit your battle in all the universe. Beyond the political reasons. Only your victory counts. Success is what depends the celebrity on your unit, which will enable you to recruit new candidates with the suicide. Gain! And you will know glory. Lose! And your unit will sink in the lapse of memory.


This is a squad level papercraft miniatures game of televised futuristic battles between teams of humans, mutants, cyborgs and beasts. The free game Demo pits gorilla-like Zorg Pirates against the human ConsoMerc squad aboard a space freighter.

Combat uses a freeform movement system in centimeters combined with a 2 action turn per figure which can be performed however the player sees fit. Combat is resolved with a single d6 roll vs the attackers appropriate skill in melee or ranged and any modifiers to this.

The demo comes with both miniatures and terrain to print and assemble.

73290.description:
Moving your cars across the intersection and scoring points

Each player has 6 cars which move one step at the time.

You get higher points if you turn right.

It's a very large thin box and it pictures
cars on the wrong side (left side) on the street.

So it has to be published before Sweden got right side
traffic (and that was in 1967)

81483.description:
A Nim-like game where players take turns to split big piles into two smaller piles, with different numbers of things in each pile. The game ends when only piles of size one or two are left, and the winner is the last to make a move.

Wikipedia link

73091.description:
Momentum is a dynamic abstract strategy board game in which the lead swings back and forth like the steel spheres of Newton’s cradle. Grabbing the lead and holding onto it is the challenge.

The mechanics of the game simulate the game of marbles. Players take turns dropping one of their eight marbles (glass stones) onto a square 7 x 7 game board. The momentum of the dropped marble is transferred in up to eight (orthogonal and diagonal) directions through adjacent contiguous lines of marbles. The last marble at the end of each of these lines is pushed away one cell from the dropped marble. Some fall off the board and are returned to the owning players.

When a player has only one marble left in hand, he or she is required to announce the last marble. At which point, his opponent is forced to knock at least one of his other seven marbles off the board, otherwise the opponent would lose the game.

The first player to have all eight of his or her marbles on the board at the end of his or her turn wins the game.

For beginners and perpetual games the following rule applies to the standard 7 x 7 game.
30-Rounds Rule (Optional, recommended for beginners): If a game lasts for 30 rounds (60 player turns), play stops and the outcome is determined. If either player has a majority of marbles on the board that player wins, if not, the game ends in a draw. Players can use a spare token to keep track of rounds by using the outside edge of the board. Once around is 28 steps. Two more rounds and the game ends.

73293.description:
Move your meeples and score the most goals.

Each player have 11 football-playing meeples. Each turn you a player can make 3 moves: kick the ball or move a meeple, but watch out for offsides. There is no dice, just skill.

The board is 15x22 squares

81486.description:
Split Decision is a trivia game featuring X-or-Y pairings. You'll be presented with a word or phrase, and you have to decide which it is: A Discontinued Ben & Jerry's Flavor or a Band We Found on MySpace? A Presidential Nickname or a Professional Wrestler? A Celebrity Baby Name or a Computer Virus? A line from Doogie Howser's Diary or a Random Twitter Update?
